recent.comments: Danny’s place looks even better than the photos! All my friends said “Wow!!!” when we first entered into the Villa. Danny was very responsive and helpful, he actioned super fast to our request. The complimentary wine tasting was good, we liked the wine and the boutique style Winery. Definitely would like to come back again when we plan next family vacation.

items.comments: Danny’s place looks even better than the photos! All my friends said “Wow!!!” when we first entered into the Villa. Danny was very responsive and helpful, he actioned super fast to our request. The complimentary wine tasting was good, we liked the wine and the boutique style Winery. Definitely would like to come back again when we plan next family vacation.
We had a great stay at Danny’s place. It’s a beautiful home with tons of space.

We had the pleasure of staying at this beautiful property the weekend of my daughters wedding. We used this home as a place for my daughter and the bridesmaids to get ready. The wedding was wonderful and was further enhanced by this beautiful spot. We had a minor issue with the water supply and Danny resolved it immediately. I cannot recommend this place enough. The fact that the winery shop is literally at your doorstep is a definite bonus.

The Alvento Villa was a spectacular experience! Our group booked for a weekend and everyone thoroughly enjoyed the space.  It looks even better in person and is very spacious, especially for 9 ladies. Danny was a great host, always available for our needs and quick to respond leading up to and throughout our stay. We loved how private the space was, yet close enough to restaurants, other Niagara on the Lake wineries, and Niagara Falls. This is a great space for larger groups who don't want to be in the hustle and bustle of everything but still remain close enough. We also received a complimentary wine tasting at Alvento Winery. The hospitality we received from Danny and his team was unmatched. Not to mention their delicious wine. Thank you Danny for everything and I would book with you again in a heartbeat!
This place is stunning, both the house and the property. it was perfect for our wedding photos. highly recommend it as there really isn't anything comparable in the area
Our stay at the Alvento Winery Airbnb was fantastic. Such a beautiful house and setting. It exceeded all of our expectations.

The villa was spacious, quiet, clean and true to the  photos.  Danny was so easy to work with and accommodating to anything we needed.  He was a terrific host.

Our whole family loved the weekend - location is great - close to a lot of wineries and our gang enjoyed cycling, running and golfing.

We'll definitely come back!

description.summary:
Escape to the heart of Niagara's wine country and indulge in a one-of-a-kind experience at the Vineyard Villa. Our luxurious accommodation provides the perfect base to explore nearby local activities and attractions, including wineries, biking, canoeing, and hiking. At the end of the day, unwind in one of our beautifully designed suites that offer privacy and relaxation.

*For inquiries about outdoor Micro private function (10-50 people) please contact via the winery website.
description.space:
Our King Suite is the epitome of luxury, featuring a King mahogany canopy bed and an en-suite private bathroom with both a bathtub and rain shower. Step out onto your own private balcony and take in the sweeping views of the vineyard and Niagara escarpment. The Southern Asian-inspired décor adds to the elegance and charm of the suite.

The Queen Suite is perfect for a family or group of friends, offering two comfortable metal-framed beds with a soft white finish. The en-suite bathroom provides a peaceful view of the vineyard, making for a serene and tranquil stay.

Our Prince and Princess Suite features two separate adjoining rooms, each with one queen and one full-sized bed. This suite is ideal for two couples or a family with children, as the fluffy pillows and scenic views provide a peaceful and calming environment.

The spacious living room is furnished with a traditional Chesterfield-style sofa that blends seamlessly with modern and mid-century-inspired pieces. The light-filled dining room provides stunning views of the vineyard, and the minimalistic wooden table can comfortably host a cozy dinner party of 8 under the golden 5-light sputnik chandelier. The open-concept kitchen features a transitional marble island and modern stainless steel appliances with contemporary filament bulb fixtures in gold. Guests are welcome to use the assortment of cooking equipment to prepare their desired meals.
description.access:
Entire Villa:

Frist Floor: Entrance, Greeting Room, Kitchen, First Floor Powder Room, Dining Room, Living Room 

Second Floor: All Four Bedrooms And the En-suits, Second Floor Patio in King Suite

Basement:  Backdoor Entrance, Laundry Room, Home Gym

Outdoor: Patio Space with fireplace at Backdoor Entrance, Acess to the vineyard and courtyard at the back of the Villa* (Extra site fee may apply for the outdoor event)

*if conditions permit ( vineyard and courtyard are off limits during spraying and harvesting)
description.notes:
In accordance with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario's Manufacturer's Licence, guests are not allowed to consume any alcohol outside of the villa, including the first-floor patio and vineyard, that is not Alvento's. Failure to comply may result in the cancellation of the stay. Please note that the maximum number of guests allowed inside the villa at any given time is 10 due to fire safety regulations.

During your stay, please follow our house rules to ensure a comfortable, clean, and organized space for all guests. This includes removing outdoor shoes upon entering the villa, locking the front and back doors when entering or leaving, and not relocating any appliances or fixtures without consulting the host or on-site staff member.

Guests are welcome to use the home gym in the basement at their own risk and must wipe off any sweat stains after use. Please also separate your trash during your stay accordingly and return the house to its original state prior to check-out. Any loss or damage should be reported to the host, and any towels with unwashable stains may incur an additional fee.

At the Vineyard Villa, we want you to relax and enjoy your stay, and that includes indulging in complimentary wine tastings at the winery. So, drink wine and have fun!
description.neighborhood: Alvento Winery, founded in 2001 and located near the waterfront of Lake Ontario in Vineland, has a reputation for being a standout player in the industry. As the first winery in Ontario to grow the prized Nebbiolo grape, it has established itself as a premium producer of small-batch red wines. The winery's terroir, a combination of light sandy soils and heavier soils of red clay loam, creates the perfect environment for growing classic premium winemaking grapes. The name Alvento, meaning "in the wind" in Italian, symbolizes the winery's focus on crafting aromatic and fruit-forward wines. After its recent revitalization, Alvento is dedicated to producing wines that embody the essence of its name and rich history.
description.house_rules:
Welcome to our Vineyard Villa of Alvento Winery! While enjoying your getaway at our lovely villa, please follow the following rules to keep the space comfortable, clean, and organized:

1. In pursuant to Manufacturer’s Licence by The Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario (AGCO), any alcohol that is not Alvento's is prohibited to be consumed outside of the Villa, this includes the first-floor patio and vineyard. However, this does not limit the consumption of other brand's alcohol inside the villa and on the second-floor patio. 

2. Due to fire safety, the maximum number of occupancies inside the villa is 10 people during any given time. Failure to follow this rule might result in the cancellation of staying. For more information about cancelation please refer to Airbnb Help Center.

3. Please do not use the bath towels for makeup or any stain removal. Any towels that sustain unwashable stains will be filed under resolution claim via Airbnb, and an additional fee may apply.

4. Please remove your outdoor shoes upon entering the villa.

5. For your safety, please always make sure the front & back door is locked and secure upon entering or leaving.

6. Please do not relocate any appliance and fixture (Tv, speaker, lamps...) without consulting the host or on-site staff member.

7. Please position the chairs and bar stools back to the original placement once they have been finished used. 

8. Please clean up the kitchen after its use. (Dishes, knives, cookware, microwave, stoves, oven*, and sinks.)  *Please make sure the oven is fat, oil, and grease, free after the use (additional cleaning charge will apply otherwise)

9. Please separate your trash during your stay accordingly. Garbage goes into the black bag, recycling goes into the blue bag (to the right of the dishwasher), and compost goes into the white bin.

10. Please do not throw the bath towels on the floor after use, we have floor mats in the bathroom. 

11. Under no circumstance should you reposition the First-aid kit and fire distinguisher in the villa.

12. Please use the home gym in the basement at your own risk, and wipe off any sweat stains after the usage.

13. Please return the house to the original state prior to check-out and bring back the key to the wine retail store.

14. For the safety and convenience of the next guest, please kindly report any loss or damaged item during your stay (a damage claim may be filed via Airbnb).

15. Drink wine and have fun :)

hosts.about:
Hello Airbnb Community! 

I am a very proud Canadian, raised in Niagara-on-the-Lake, Ontario, where I now live with my husband on our second generation family fruit farm with our children and our Great Bernese dog Oswin. I am a devout Roger Federer fan and in my free time love playing cards with my daughters, cooking, and taking Oswin on long walks. 

My family has always been in the hotel business so therefore I have naturally felt drawn to working in the Hospitality sector.  Meeting new people is something I love and feels organic to me!  My education is in Business and in my late teens I was fortunate enough to partake in an International Management Program at Walt Disney World, studying their world-renowned training and hotel divisions. 

Whether I meet you as a host or a guest, I will always aim to make it a mutual 5 Star experience!

recent.comments: Erica's place was amazing! We were very impressed by the bedrooms with each their own private bathroom. It was perfect for us.

items.comments: Erica's place was amazing! We were very impressed by the bedrooms with each their own private bathroom. It was perfect for us.

Erica‘s place in NOTL was perfect for our weekend getaway. The location couldn’t be better, walkable to all the great restaurants and shops as well as the lake. Quiet clean comfortable with space for everyone. Highly recommend!
An amazing home, perfectly located, with an amazing host.  What more can you ask for? Thanks, Erica!
Erica is the best in the business and her home  is exquisite.

This was the perfect home base for our 2-couple's weekend in Niagara-on-the-Lake. Erica's house is exactly as pictured and described -- modern, comfortable, clean and very well-equipped (especially the kitchen), and extremely conveniently located. And Erica is an excellent host -- friendly, proactive, and very responsive and helpful.

Our primary activity for the weekend was cycling in the area, and Erica's house was the perfect base for us. It is within a few short blocks of many trails in the area, including (and especially) the Niagara Parkway Recreational Trail which runs from Fort George, past Niagara Falls itself, and all the way to Fort Erie. And as an added bonus, there is a garage where you can store your bikes.

Very comfortable home & great for two couples. Walking distance to everything in Old Town including the Shaw Festival. Great walking trails as well along the parks & Lake Ontario.  House has just about everything you need.  Highly recommend.

description.neighborhood: Niagara-on-the-Lake is a town in southern Ontario. It sits on the shores of Lake Ontario, at the mouth of the Niagara River. It's known for its wineries and the Shaw Festival, a series of theatre productions. The flower-filled, tree-lined Old Town features 19th century buildings, mainly along Queen Street. Near the river, 19th century Fort George was built by the British to defend against American attacks.
description.transit: Uber is available in Niagara-on-the-Lake. We are a 2 minute walk to Queen Street. 20 minute drive to Niagara Falls. Approximately 1.5 hours from Toronto Pearson Airport and 45 minutes from Buffalo Airport. Many local bike companies offer complimentary delivery and pick up (please enquire).

description.space:
Located in the Heart of Niagara Falls, Ontario, this exquisite house offers everything you need and is only minutes away from the action! In 5 to 15 minute drive (please refer to G00gle Maps), you could be standing at the top of Clifton Hill or enjoy Wine Tastings and Local Cuisine experiences, or Golf at our World-Famous places! 

The house is a bright, spacious, luxurious and peaceful sanctuary; the quality finishes, high-end appliances, professionally chosen decor and clean linens will make you feel like you’re in Paradise!

The house is perfect for couples or family retreat. Each bedroom offers a queen size bed with new premium quality Kingsdown mattresses, hotel quality linens, duvets and pillows, as well as thick luxurious towels. The house is ideal for up to six people. High speed Wi-Fi Internet, Smart Flat Screen Television featuring Netflix, fun entertainment books for all ages and board games are all included. The kitchen is equipped with everything you need including all new stainless steel appliances: stove, fridge, dishwasher, microwave, toaster, coffee maker and electric kettle. 

Plenty of coffee and tea are stocked for your enjoyment. Nothing is worse than waking up in the morning to no coffee! Sugar, salt, pepper and all olive oil are also supplied in the kitchen for your convenience.
I myself occupy the basement unit. I am not home often, you won’t even see me!!
description.access:
The backyard is private and you can soak up some sun on bright Niagara Falls days! The wide driveway will comfortably fit up to three cars.
As our guests, you have a complete and private access to backyard, front porch and the driveway.
description.notes: Not just for tourists! We welcome guests requiring longer stays for business travel, opportunities to learn and grow, or just reconnect with yourself.
description.neighborhood: We are located in a quiet and mature neighbourhood, only 3 minute walk to the Public Transit system, for easy travel around the city. WEGO System Map is provided for your convenience.
description.transit:
Easy Driving Directions to the Falls: Take Casey St. to  Dorchester Rd., keep driving straight. Turn left on Lundy's Lane and keep driving straight. After 5 minutes (refer to Google Maps) you’ll be at the top of Clifton hill. Turn right at Clifton Hill and you will see the Falls at the bottom of the hill. There are many all-day pay parking lots at the top of Clifton Hill along Victoria Avenue and the attractions are all close to each other. Lundy’s Lane will change names to Ferry Street and to Victoria Avenue. It is the same long road! It’s a longer walk, but this route is definitely walkable.
Public Transit:  Walk 3 minute towards Casey St., you won’t miss that bus stop! Public bus stop is right in front of you!
WEGO System Map is provided for your convenience and easy to use.
Uber is also a popular choice as well as traditional taxi services.
description.interaction: We like to greet each guest on their arrival to give them a quick tour and overview of the area, as well as answer any questions you may have. From that point, we are accessible if you need us, just a phone call away.

- Relax and have fun! If there is anything that would help make your stay better, please let us know during your stay!

description.house_rules:
What's expected 
-Must be over the age of 25 to rent 
-Additional guests must be made aware of 
-Ensure sliding door mesh is closed at all times when going in and out, to keep bugs out 
-Wash all kitchen items after use.

LAUNDRY 

Any dirty laundry needs to be put in the basket, taken to the laundry room on the lower level Remove any USED bed sheets, pillow cases, fitted sheet, duvet cover, blanket and drop off to the laundry room - pretty much everything EXCEPT the mattress protector which is the first thing that goes on the bed 

GARBAGE /RECYCLING 
-Take out Garbage from bin and place in black bag, take to garage - code is 5678 garage door.
-Place all recyclables in the blue bags under kitchen sink , take to garage 

-No shoes inside the house please
- Marble throughout the kitchen can be easily stained please wipe spills with diluted bleach immediately. 
-House must be left in the same condition as when you first arrived

A few tips ( this home uses a septic sewage system) 
-Never pour grease down the drain 
-Pour grease into container and dispose of it as solid waste
-Scrap food into the garbage , not down the drain 
-DO NOT put anything down the toilet except toilet paper, place baby wipes in the garbage 

Report any drain issues to landlord ASAP.

If a toilet is plugged or septic system fails, the presence of foreign material other than toilet paper will result in the tenant being charged for damages, repairs and labour

**Garage-restricted, unless used to place garbage/recycling
** Rinse feet when coming back from the beach. Hose located on the side of the house

NO PARTIES ALLOWED...

hosts.about:
My husband, Mike and I, traveled across Europe and stayed in homes instead of hotels. Hotels can be a little impersonal. We liked the idea of staying alongside the locals; shopping at the market; making our own food; and eating at non-touristy places etc.

After having such a great experience staying in other people's places, we wanted to provide that same experience to vacationers here in Canada. We bought our own cottages and started Holiday Homes Property Management. We now manage more than just our own cottages allowing us to provide a variety of vacation homes for you to choose from. Let us help you find the right accommodation for your vacation needs.

We loved our short but sweet stay at Sapphire Shores! Pictures are exactly as shown; bright, clean and so charming! The kitchen is even more beautiful in person. A quick walk down the road brings you to the beautiful crystal beach and all the cute local shops. Seems to be close to the border for some shopping, and was a 45 minute drive into NOTL! Lots around to keep you busy.

The hot tub was such a nice treat for an afternoon dip and evening chats with friends under the stars (the lid was dented in the middle, but the actual hot tub worked totally fine)! 

If we had any questions during our stay, they were very quick to respond. 

Very quiet area, in a lovely neighbourhood. Once we arrived for our stay, the rules for not allowing large parties, and noise etc. make a lot more sense- it is not the place for a large party vibe!! Great for a girls weekend away, or time away with the family! 

Hoping to make this an annual trip with my girlfriends, and can’t wait to return!
Great location for a little getaway!

This home was in the perfect location. Very close to shops and Niagara Falls which was the purpose of our vacation. The home was very nice and cozy and the kitchen is AMAZING. Would recommend to anyone visiting the area.

Wow such an amazing place to stay for a get away !minutes from the beach an awesome Italian resturant  all walking distant. Cottage had very comfortable bedroom and a fabulous kitchen  and living room . We enjoyed watching a movie on Netflix  since we had a rainy weekend! 😊

description.summary:
STR-000104

This sparkling jewel has everything you need for a wonderful vacation….hot tub, close the beach, and central air.
Stepping inside, you'll be greeted with a serene, tranquil living area with plenty of seating, a big screen TV and an electric fireplace. It's a great place to spend time with the ones you love.
The spectacular kitchen will leave you breathless. Who wouldn't want to cook in here?! It is absolutely gorgeous.
description.space:
No fighting over who gets the best bedroom as all three bedrooms have queen size beds and are nicely decorated. Two full size bathrooms round out this awesome cottage.

It's such a lovely place that you won't want to leave!

Hurry or you'll miss the chance to book this one and Bay Beach is only 600 metres away.

For more information on Bay Beach (Crystal Beach) restrictions, please visit the Town of Fort Erie website.


Sleeping Arrangements:

Bedroom 1: Queen

Bedroom 2: Queen

Bedroom 3: Queen

Hot tub is open from approximately mid-May to mid-October.
description.notes:
As part of our commitment to adhering to local by-laws, we have implemented a policy that precludes us from accepting bookings from certain groups. Specifically, we do not accept reservations from groups of people under the age 30, nor from all-adult groups who are unrelated.

Please note that this policy is not intended to be discriminatory, but rather serves to safeguard the interests of our cottage owners and align with their rental insurance policies.

A license is required to operate a short-term rental in Fort Erie, and the license outlines the maximum number of guests allowed in the property.  The limit includes all persons regardless of age.  We cannot approve more people than what the property is licensed for. 

Only the people registered to stay are allowed at, on, or in the property.
description.interaction: We are close by if you should need us.
description.house_rules:
Check-in:  From 4:00 p.m. / Check-Out:  By 10:00 a.m.  

If you or any members of your group are still at the property beyond the stated check-out time, you will be charged and expected to pay $50 for each additional half hour.  

Due to insurance and local licensing restrictions, you must be 30 years of age to book.  As the person booking the property, you will be fully responsible and liable for all the members in your group throughout the rental period.  This includes any damages beyond what would be considered normal wear and tear.  

Due to the local by-laws, once your booking is confirmed, you must provide us with your full name, address, and email address as well as the full names of the people that will be staying at the property within 24 hours.  This is non-negotiable!  This information is to be kept on file to provide to local by-law enforcement.  If you are unwilling to provide this information, your booking will be canceled.  

A Renter Agreement will be sent to you to complete once your booking is approved.  This Agreement must be completed within 24 hours of confirmation otherwise your booking will be canceled.

You must be staying in the property.  If we find out you aren’t or won’t be staying in the property, than we will cancel the booking, evict everyone at the property, and you will not be given a refund.

Occupancy:  Due to by-law and/or licensing restrictions, each property has a maximum number of people allowed, regardless of age, on or in the property both during the day and at night.  The maximum number of people allowed is included in the Airbnb listing. Once your booking with the number of guests is confirmed, no additional people will be allowed. If there are more people in or on the property than agreed to, we will cancel your booking; everyone will be evicted; you will not receive a refund; and there will be an additional charge of $500 charged plus hst.  You will be responsible for any and all by-law fine infractions.

We have a zero tolerance policy for any house party (including wedding and/baby showers), end of school party, or bachelor/ette type parties.  

Due to by-laws and/or licensing restrictions, no tents are allowed in or on the property.  If there is found to a tent, the booking will be cancelled immediately, everyone will be evicted, you will not receive a refund; and there will be an additional charge of $500 plus hst.  

Beach passes:  If beach passes have been provided any loss of Beach Passes will incur a charge of $150 per pass plus administration fee of $150 + HST

Parking:  Due to by-laws and/or licensing restrictions, there are a maximum number of vehicles that are allowed to be parked at the property.  This parking maximum is included in the Airbnb listing description.  If we are notified of or find that there are more vehicles than the stated maximum allowed, you will be responsible for removing the overage immediately or risk being evicted and/or charged an additional $100 per vehicle.

We inspect the property before your check-in time and after your check-out time.  Once you check-in, you must immediately report any damage and/or maintenance issues to us.  If we don’t know about it, we can’t fix it.  We will deal with the issues as quickly as possible.  If anything breaks down or is damaged during your stay, you must report it to us immediately.  

Every attempt is made to ensure that everything is in working order for the duration of your stay.  Should a breakdown or some other situation occur with equipment or facilities such as air conditioning, dishwasher, microwave, washer, dryer, televisions, VCRs/DVDs, hot tubs, pools, saunas etc, we will make every effort to fix the issue as soon as possible, however, we cannot guarantee that it will be fixed during your stay.  We will not be providing a refund due to the breakdown of these items as they are not considered essential.

If a breakdown occurs to a fundamental element such as water systems, plumbing and electrical systems, and major appliances such as the stove or refrigerator, every effort will be made to repair or replace, or an appropriate refund will be made for the inconvenience caused.  This does not apply to system breakdown caused by misuse, such as plumbing blockages caused by inappropriate use of sanitary facilities.
If electrical services stop because of extreme weather or other circumstances beyond our control, will not be providing a refund.  Similarly, we will not be giving a refund for inclement weather, changes in water levels or water conditions, conditions at neighbouring properties, or any nuisance afforded by nature such as flying insects or the animal population.

Upon check-out, the property should be left in the same condition you found it in upon check-in.  That includes all furniture, fixtures, chattels, and effects (hot tubs and pools included).  If we find damages beyond normal wear and tear, or extra cleaning (including excessive sand, soap residue in hot tubs or pools) is required to bring the property to what it was prior to check-in, you will be responsible for payment to return the property to the condition it was in prior to your check-in. Damages will be assessed and charged to you accordingly plus there will be an additional $150 administration fee plus hst charged.

Cleaning:  If the property condition is left beyond normal wear, tear and usage, additional cleaning fees will be applied of a minimum of $50 plus hst.  You are expected to follow all check-out instructions provided.  This includes property use and care of garbage.  

Pets:  Unless indicated in the property listing, pets are not allowed at a property.  Even where pets are accepted, you must ask and receive permission from us before you can bring your pet as we do have age, weight, size, type/breed and amount restrictions for pets.  There is an additional charge of $75 plus hst per pet.  If your pet is allowed to stay, you must remove all evidence that a pet was at the property.  This includes the outside area as well.  At no time are pets allowed on the furniture, including beds or in hot tubs or pools.  

If your dog tends to bark a lot, we ask that you leave him/her at home. There is a noise by-law in effect which includes excessive barking.  If a barking compliant is received, we have no option but to evict you, including all members of your group and your dog from the property.  If this happens, we will not be giving you a refund.  

If we are notified during your stay or find evidence after your stay that you had a pet and we have not given permission for one, you may be evicted, no refunds will be given, and you will be  charged $500 plus hst.  

Note:  We take no responsibility for any allergic reaction or other conditions arising at any property whether pets are allowed or not.  Just because if says “no pets” does not mean that there have never been pets at the property before.

Smoking:  Smoking of any kind (including, but not limited to, cigarettes, vaping, cannabis or cannabis derivatives, etc.) is not permitted in the property.  Any evidence of smoking in the property will incur additional cleaning charges plus a $150 administrative fee plus hst.

Fireworks and Campfires:  You are not allowed to use fireworks (including sparklers) at or in the property.  If you found to have or have used fireworks, you will be evicted without refund.  If campfires are permitted at the property, you can use the designated area to light a campfire, however, you must comply with local fire restrictions.   It is your responsibility to determine whether or not a fire ban is in place during your stay.  Please check the local town or city’s website for more information on fire safety/fire bans.

Information contained on Airbnb:  The information contained in the Airbnb property listing is believed to be correct at the time of this agreement.

You are expected to abide by the House Rules and the instructions contained in the property guidebook or any additional information provided by us.  

LIMITATIONS OF LIABILITY:  You accept, guarantee and agree that you will use the property and its facilities in accordance with the house rules above and the property information/instructions provided and that you do so at your own risk.  You indemnify and save us (the agent and owner) harmless from any personal injury, sickness or death, loss or damage, however caused, to person or property of you or the members in your group, before, during or after the time of your rental period.  Further, you accept full responsibility for the use of the property and any recreational equipment such as pools and hots tubs and agree to pay for any damage of said property or equipment beyond normal wear and tear.

title: Buffalo, New York

gallery.caption: dining room
kitchen
kitchen with island

hosts.about: Local real estate broker. Very outgoing, love to meet new people, travel and good food:)

recent.comments: Just like the pictures. Very easy check in and check out. Asks that you not wear shoes inside, so remember to bring slippers. Very well equipped home. Deck and front porch great spots to relax.

items.comments: Just like the pictures. Very easy check in and check out. Asks that you not wear shoes inside, so remember to bring slippers. Very well equipped home. Deck and front porch great spots to relax.

Everything was great! It was a wonderful home to host a group of people. Walkable to all of Elmwood and plenty of street parking! Irina reached out to make sure we got in alright and everything was fine., she also followed up to make sure we did not need anything else.

Place is as good as described. House was clean. Kitchenware and utensils were great. The space was spacious enough to house 10+ people. Kids loved the bunk bed and the attic. The only drawback is the neighborhood. Not enough stores/food places around. But if you are looking for a good place to stay, I would highly recommend it.

Beautiful house plenty of space in kitchen and dinning room where everyone was able to be in the same room. Has all the amenities you would need. A bunch of local shops and restaurants to eat at within walking distance or short drive. overall great stay and great experience

the place is exactly as described. very very spacious  , and perfect for big groups. the stairs and first floor are quite loudly squeaky, which could be a problem for light sleepers and kids. the living area could have more lighting. we didn't see any problem with the traffic noise that others have pointed.

This is indeed a very nice house to stay for shorter period of time with big family like mine. The house is situated in an upscale neighborhood. I loved visiting  Buffalo. I would prefer this house next time if I visit to Buffalo.
Another great stay at this property!

description.summary: If you are looking for warm and cozy family home, look no more! Our house will give you a feeling being home away from home! It's located just 2 short blocks from Elmwood Ave. with everything Elmwood Village has to offer: coffee shops, restaurants, local shops and market. The house has everything you need for big family gatherings: 3.5 bath, laundry room, nice size bedrooms, huge dining room table, fully equipped kitchen, wi-fi, cable tv and parking.
description.space:
Great location in Elmwood Village! Lots of living space, very cozy home with everything you need to feel home.
We have open first plan set up with fully equipped kitchen and dining room with oversized dining table for your big family gatherings. Living room has 65 inch TV and large couch with cuddlers. Half bath/laundry room is also on the first floor. 
Second floor 4 bedrooms, one of them is master bedroom with its own full bathroom with stand up shower, and another full bathroom with the tub. On the third floor you will find a loft that we use as a play room with kids toys and another full bathroom.
We also have deck with grill just outside of the kitchen. Guests are responsible for propane.
description.access: two bedrooms on the third floor and the basement are not to be used.
description.notes:
We are require to collect government issued IDs from all of the guests over 18. 


The house is located on the corner of two city streets so city noise is expected,  especially on the weekends.
description.neighborhood: We are steps away from Hotel Henry and Elmwood Ave. If you are looking to explore Buffalo,  you will be in the perfect location!
description.transit: Uber is available but car is highly recommended.
description.house_rules:
we ask our guests to follow few simple rules: 
1. please take your shoes off 
2. please do not flush ANYTHING down the toilet except toilet paper. No baby wipes, napkins, tampons, etc. 
3. please do not use strong smell spices such as curry.
4. please keep quite hours after 10 pm

hosts.about:
I am a mom of three young adults  and have a wonderful husband.  Travel with my family, husband or girlfriends is a priority for me.  I love to see a new destination, rent a car and explore.  

My summer life is busy running a successful Vacation Rental Business where I manage my own rentals along with those of homeowner clients.  Client and guest service is imperative to me and I will do my best ensure everyone's satisfaction.   This business allows me the flexibility to travel in the winter monthsband explore other vacation rentals. 

I am always up for a new adventure.

recent.comments:
We had a fabulous time! The view is amazing! My kids were able to walk to the beach, restaurants, and ice cream shops. 
Having a fire in the evenings was a great plus! The location is perfect! I highly recommend Teri’s place.

items.comments:
We had a fabulous time! The view is amazing! My kids were able to walk to the beach, restaurants, and ice cream shops. 
Having a fire in the evenings was a great plus! The location is perfect! I highly recommend Teri’s place.

We had a fantastic stay! Water is right there with fire pit and a deck.  The cottage was very clean and for a small group much larger than it appears in the photos. Very open space. Lots of places to walk, really beautiful.  Wouldn’t hesitate to stay again.   Teri was super friendly and helpful.

Teri’s place was great and set up for lots of people. The house is just like the pictures, beautiful and done in a quality good for visitors. Be careful with the oven. If for some reason there pans are placed in the drawer under the oven, it is not insulated from the oven temp and heats whatever is in that drawer up to oven temp. 
There is a very large apartment building being built two houses down which does take away a little from the ambiance but didn’t effect the stay. 
Teri was very responsive and answered any questions we had very quickly.
Visited multiple times and we will be back! Clean, great location, spacious and always responsive.

Perfect! Family trip to Niagara Falls. Didn’t want to stay in the city so we chose this place. Glad we did. Very peaceful. Beautiful views of the lake. Plenty of space for kids. Clean and comfortable. Would recommend!

From the moment we signed on to rent Teri's place, we felt welcomed.  She is a manager who goes beyond her duties- making herself accessible at all times.  Teri is so very accommodating- from allowing us to check in early and checking out late.  She made our annual girls' weekend getaway perfect from beginning to end.

Had a great weekend here! Check in was a breeze. The house has great views, is clean, and well-appointed. Good for families. Convenient location with a great little park and playground area within a very short walk. My kids loved it. Would stay again!  Thank you!

description.summary: Our newly renovated waterfront cottage offers three bedrooms, 1.5 baths and sleeping for up to 8 people.  Lovely views of Lake Erie and the Crystal Beach Waterfront Park and Boat Launch from the large deck make this an amazing vacation spot.
description.space:
Everything you need is provided including dinnerware, cookware, linens and towels, propane BBQ, and a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher and washer/dryer.  Complimentary WiFi is available and we have a nice, warm electric fireplace for cooler nights in the fall or winter.  We have a small bonfire pit for marshmallows, board games, dice and cards, and parking for 4-5 cars or enough space to bring your truck and boat trailer.  

Crystal Beach Waterfront Park is two doors down with children’s playground, live concerts in summertime, a well maintained boat launch and new beach area.  Walk another 10 minutes to the main public beach entrance for a day of fun in the sun.  

We are bungalow style living all on one floor and bedroom layouts are as follows:

Bedroom 1 – queen bed (sleeps 2)
Bedroom 2 – double and twin (sleeps 3)
Bedroom 3 – queen and twin (sleeps 3)
New mattresses on the 2 queens and the double in 2022.  

BBQ is offered seasonally from May through October.  You are welcome to swim and wade out front, but we do recommend water shoes, as our stretch of the shoreline is shale and not sand.  

Dogs are considered, but please ask first to make sure we are a great fit for your furry friend.  

This home is best enjoyed by traveling families and we do not make considerations for large group of young adults.  

TOTAL Maximum Occupancy is 8 guests with a maximum of 6 adults. Please note this home cannot accommodate more than 8 guests due to Town of Fort Erie rules in the approved rental licence. 

Town of Fort Erie Licence No. STR-2020-0005

Longer term monthly pricing in the off season is also available for relocation, short term work assignments and other temporary real estate needs.
description.notes:
Upon confirming your booking, you will be emailed a rental agreement for review and signature. Highlights of the agreement include:

- The Town of Fort Erie Bi-Law requires the owner or operator shall maintain a register that contains the name and address of the Renter(s) and the names of any other Person or Persons who occupy the Premises overnight
- We respectfully ask that you treat our home with respect and consider it as your home away from home and remain considerate of the neighbours always.
- Our cottage is in a residential area and local bylaws require quiet between the hours of 11pm to 8am.
- The Renter whose name the reservation is made is responsible for the conduct of all those using or occupying the vacation property and/or its grounds throughout the duration of their stay.
- When you are not in the house and upon final departure, guests must close and lock all windows and doors. In addition, upon final departure, the Renter must ensure that all food and beverages are removed from the rental property including cabinets, refrigerators and freezers. Failure to remove these items may result in additional cleaning fees
- Renters are liable for all damages and/or loss to the rental property caused by them or as a result of their negligence or caused by or as a result of negligence by anyone permitted on the property during their stay.
- Smoking is not permitted inside
- Small, outdoor fires are permitted in the provided fire pit area seasonally (May-October).
- The BBQ is available for your use seasonally (May-October) and runs on propane. Please do not move the BBQ to another location on the property and please always double check to make sure it is turned off after every use.
- Please note that absolutely no other items other than bathroom tissue are to be flushed down the toilet. ANYTHING other than bathroom tissue should be placed in the garbage. Any misuse could result in plumbing issues and service calls or repairs will be charged back to the client.
description.neighborhood:
In town, we have many activities to enjoy like several public beach areas, Farmer’s Markets, live thoroughbred racing at Fort Erie Race Track, historic sites such as Old Fort Erie and the Ridgeway Battlefield, Safari Niagara and local dining and shopping.  

Take a 25 minute drive up into downtown Niagara Falls to check out the mighty Falls!  Families should check out Clifton Hill, The Bird Kingdom, Fallsview Indoor Waterpark, and Niagara Hornblower Boat Cruises (formally Maid of the Mist) to get up close and personal to the roaring Falls.  We highly recommend taking some extra time to cruise up the Niagara Parkway to the Falls to enjoy one of the most beautiful drives in the province.  

The region also boasts countless golf courses such as Thundering Waters, Legends on the Niagara and Whirlpool.  Tour historic Niagara-on-the-Lake and their many wineries like Jackson Triggs, Chateau des Charmes or Inniskillin.

recent.comments:
This is a lovely place in a great location! Right by the river and within walking distance to some little stores and cafes. Niagara Falls is also a short drive away for something else to do. The hot tub was amazing, and the full kitchen including a dishwasher was wonderful! 
There were some things missed with the cleaning, but overall we really enjoyed this place. Our stay was full of fun and relaxation!

items.comments:
This is a lovely place in a great location! Right by the river and within walking distance to some little stores and cafes. Niagara Falls is also a short drive away for something else to do. The hot tub was amazing, and the full kitchen including a dishwasher was wonderful! 
There were some things missed with the cleaning, but overall we really enjoyed this place. Our stay was full of fun and relaxation!

Amazing value for the price and location! We had 5 people in our group which was perfect for this stay. Beautiful home in a great spot, close to the lake. Spacious and cozy, with good sized bedrooms. The house itself was built in the 1840s so it was charming and cozy. Loved the decor and furniture was great for the space.
The hosts were super responsive and helpful. We had some issues with the hot tub (wasn’t reheating for the second night) and the hosts gave us troubleshooting instructions to try and resolve the issue. When that didn’t work, they compensated us fairly for our trouble. 
The kitchen could use a few more pots and pans. More containers would have been helpful too, as there wasn’t any tinfoil or Saran wrap. There was only instant coffee, but there was a coffee machine so luckily we had brought grinds. Overall we had all the kitchen necessities but could have used a few more functional items. Dishwasher, washer and dryer all worked well - it was nice to have these appliances!
Overall we had an amazing stay and the hosts were excellent. Would definitely recommend and would stay again!

Had a wonderful stay - the kitchen was surprisingly well stocked with everything we needed.  The house is as described in the listing.  The beds were very comfortable, the house was very clean and everything we needed was clearly labeled or left out for us.  A bottle of wine was waiting for us which was a nice welcome.  The hosts were easy and wonderful to communicate with - would return in the future.
Great location, very clean and responsive.
It was a really cute Airbnb, the amenities make it worth it even when everything else was shut down due to Covid restrictions. The hosts were kind and quick to respond always. Great stay!
Great place. Friendly hosts who are very accommodating and easy to communicate with. We loved our stay.
Friendly hosts. Great Communication. Clean Home

description.summary: Relax with the whole family at our peaceful home in Fort Erie, Ontario, Canada. Our 3 bedroom home can sleep 8 guests comfortably and has everything you need for an incredible stay. Our property comes with a hot tub, large backyard, BBQ, fire pit, patio, board games, & much more. Our home has been thoughtfully decorated and is set up specifically for hosting guests. Our home is a quick 3 minute walk to Instinct Park and the Niagara River; a popular spot for fishing. We look forward to hosting you!
description.space: Our property has 3 bedrooms with comfortable beds, a large kitchen for cooking great meals, a full sized dining room and a spacious living room. Our property also  has a large fenced in backyard with a fire pit, hot tub, BBQ, patio set, and more.
description.access: There is free parking at our home for 4 vehicles and there is also some free street parking nearby. Our home is a 3 minute walk to a local river side park, a common fishing spot on the Niagara River, and just a 5 minute walk to a few local restaurants. Crystal Beach is just a 15 minute drive away and Niagara Falls is only a 20-25 minute drive away. Our home is great for weekend getaways or longer term stays. We provide an onsite washer and dryer for guests use.
description.notes:
Our property is ideal for families and small groups of friends. We allow self check-in for guests and they can use the electronic lock to enter the home. The backyard can be accessed through a sliding door on the main floor which goes out to the wooden deck which is equipped with a BBQ, outdoor dining set up, and a hot tub just next to the deck. Our property has 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and a large indoor living area.

Some pets may be allowed on a case by case basis for an additional charge. Please ask/inquire about your pet PRIOR to booking.
description.neighborhood: Our thoughtfully decorated home near the Niagara River is located on a quiet street walking distance to a local park which is right on the river with views of the USA. Our home is just a short walk or drive to many local shops and restaurants.
description.transit: For getting around town we recommend either driving, walking, bring a bike, or using shared sharing service like Uber or Lift.
description.interaction: While our home is fully equipped to ensure a great stay, there can sometimes be needs for you to contact us. We're always available if you have questions or need recommendations.

recent.comments: Wonderful stay with a few girlfriends. Great location and such a beautiful fun home. Highly recommend!

items.comments: Wonderful stay with a few girlfriends. Great location and such a beautiful fun home. Highly recommend!

The Rose House is the ULTIMATE bachelorette or girls weekend getaway. The house is STUNNING. Tracey and John were amazing- super communicative, friendly and just overall lovely hosts. The location is a 10 minute (beautiful) walk to Queen St where you can explore all the great shops and restaurants. It’s also close to several wineries!
I loved this house so much I didn’t want to leave!!!
Such a great stay! Celebrated my birthday with a Barbie theme and this house was perfect for it. Will definitely be back!

Beautiful  spacious home in the perfect location within a breezy short walk from the lake and Old Town. The well appointed home is filled with all the luxury finishes, state of the art home technology and elegant feminine decor. Beyond the home itself, she’s curated the perfect menu of vendors for add on services to take your experience up a notch. If you’re not thinking about having a dinner with Mel, you should be! Not only was the food fantastic but so was she. Very kind and personable. Kim over at Sara’s Sweets curated a dessert bar for me and the balloons vendor was on point! None of this would not have been possible to coordinate so simply without the Rose’ House. Gratitude of thanks from our group to you!

Tracey was an incredible host, she was responsive and very helpful when needed. The Airbnb had a perfect aesthetic for a Bachelorette weekend. The kitchen was well stocked and had so much space to socialize and eat together. The home offers great privacy and is in walking distance to Old Town NOTL. I would recommend booking The Rose House for your Girls weekend or Bachelorette celebration!
A beautiful, classy space perfect for a girls getaway!

Beautiful home, great location. Excellent customer service and host provides amazing local recommendations that were the highlight of our vacation. ex: Yoga with Jess and catered meal by Chef Melissa (Seeds Dinner). 10/10

description.summary:
Welcome to the The Rosé House located in the heart of NOTL. This newly renovated 3100sqft home is the perfect to celebrate a mature Girl's Getaway! Bring your friends/family to enjoy everything NOTL has to offer! 

Steps to wineries, the Pedal Pub,  golf courses, the lavender farm, Ice Wine Festival, restaurants, shopping, Shaw Festival Theatre and more! Niagara Falls is also within easy reach!
description.space:
IG/TikTok @therosehousenotl

Max occupancy is 8 people.

We welcome mature groups to come and celebrate a celebration for any occasion that will respect the house rules and neighbourhood as they would in their own home. 

What you'll love 
✔	4 queen beds to sleep 8 people 
✔	1 bedroom is on the main level of the home 
✔	Parking for up to 5 standard cars 
✔    14 ft vaulted ceilings in the kitchen and living room  
✔	Luxury custom built chef's kitchen with 2 oversized islands! 
✔    Double sided gas fireplace 
✔    quartz countertops and backsplash
✔    48 inch gas range  
✔	70 inch Smart TV 
✔    Board games 
✔    A large A-frame arch 
✔	Glam room with 4 stations to get ready for a day out touring wineries 
✔	Large mature trees surrounding the home to give a sense of privacy in the oversized backyard! 
✔	Patio seating and a picnic table 
✔	All amenities are private and for your exclusive use. No sharing! 
✔	More outdoor amenities coming in Spring/Summer 2023! Stay tuned~ 


SLEEPING ARRANGEMENT 
• 	Bdrm 1: one queen bed on the second floor 
• 	Bdrm 2: one queen bed on the second floor 
• 	Bdrm 3: two queen beds on the main level
description.access: The entire home is for your exclusive use except for the garage. The garage is used for waste management and not available for parking inside.
description.notes:
We provide one bath towel and washcloth per registered guest. If you require more please plan accordingly.

We provide limited quantities of basic items to get your stay started, including toilet paper, paper towel, soap, salt and pepper, sugar, tea, and coffee. Should you require more, please plan accordingly. 

We will be onsite for outdoor property maintenance. This includes snow clearing and general groundskeeping/property maintenance.

Upon booking all guests will be required to provide the full names of all the guests staying and the details of all cars that will be parked on the property. This is a requirement of the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake.

Short Term Rental License No. 128-2022
description.neighborhood:
Niagara-on-the-Lake is situated in the Niagara Peninsula which is the largest wine region in Ontario, and the only place in the world that’s warm enough in summer to make red wine and cold enough in winter to make ice wine. 

The town of Niagara-on-the-Lake is filled with small-town Victorian charm. Walk in Old Town for it's boutique shops, horse-drawn carriages, Shaw Festival Theatre, and incredible restaurants!
description.house_rules:
1) No disruptive parties at any time. The guests will be evicted without any refund if there is a noise complaint. This is consistent with the good-neighbour by-laws of the town. 

2) The neighborhood observes quiet hours from 11PM - 8AM. We kindly request that your celebration continues indoors during these hours. Please also refrain from playing music outdoors, this is to uphold the good-neighbour by-laws of the town. 

3) No unregistered guests are permitted in the unit at any time during your stay and we allow up to 8 guests. Per the town by-laws, you will be asked to provide full names, home address and telephone number as well as the vehicle make/license plate number and province or state for any cars that will be parked at the property upon booking.

4) No outdoor shoes in the house

5) No smoking (vaping or marijuana) on the property. If we find evidence of smoking in the unit, a $200 fee will be charged 

6) Guests must return the unit in a reasonably neat and clean condition

7) Do not disconnect the wifi router and security bridge from the outlet. We will be charging a $50 fee if we have to enter the unit to restore the connection

8) Please note that the checkout time is 10 AM, and a late checkout fee may apply if you have not vacated the unit by then. 

A violation of any of the rules above may result in an eviction without refund and/or penalties.

gallery.caption: Sunset views from the spacious back deck of Woodcliff Cottage.
Woodcliff Cottage is nestled on a quiet piece of wooded, Lake Ontario shoreline.
Patio grill area below the big deck along the back of Woodcliff Cottage.
Stairs leading down to the pebble beach at Woodcliff. Large boulders protect the shoreline and make for great spots to sit and soak in the lake views or go for a swim.
Enjoy a sunset campfire at Woodcliff Cottage.
Spacious living room with gas fireplace and spectacular views of Lake Ontario.
Dining area with Lake Ontario backdrop!
Beautifully remodeled kitchen.
Kitchen island and raised bar counter provide additional seating.

Woodcliff Cottage sits next to our second property listed on AirBnB: Shell Cottage.

recent.comments: Beautiful place to stay! Quaint villages of Youngstown and Lewiston are close by with a good variety of restaurants.   Quick scenic drive to Niagara Falls.   The views at the cottage are amazing! Both sunrises and gorgeous sunsets from the deck can be seen. With a clear sky, the Toronto skyline can be seen from the distance.  The kitchen was stocked with a variety of cooking seasonings and spices, a nice treat.  Host Eric is wonderful and is easy to get in touch with if anything arises.

items.comments: Beautiful place to stay! Quaint villages of Youngstown and Lewiston are close by with a good variety of restaurants.   Quick scenic drive to Niagara Falls.   The views at the cottage are amazing! Both sunrises and gorgeous sunsets from the deck can be seen. With a clear sky, the Toronto skyline can be seen from the distance.  The kitchen was stocked with a variety of cooking seasonings and spices, a nice treat.  Host Eric is wonderful and is easy to get in touch with if anything arises.
منزل رائع و عرف نوم و حمامات نظيفة و مطل على البحيرة  مباشرة معه حديقة واسعة و جميلة  و شرفة و مكان للنار و للشوي ..  يحتاج صيانة بسيطة و طلاء الاثاث الخارجي   ..

For this vacation, finding an affordable, safe, and aesthetically pleasing home was imperative; thus, Woodcliff Cottage's pictures and description were the deciding factors in making Youngstown our hub. The pluses: sunrise and sunset from the same deck; lake access; floor to ceiling windows that afforded natural light and views of the lake and landscape; simple, retro-modern interior design; comfortable beds; location to food, shopping, history, recreation, entertainment; the kindness and accessibility of our host, Eric. 
We chose to eat most dinners at the cottage so as not to miss a sunset and found that there was much beauty and lake life to experience right from the deckchair (and with the host-provided binoculars) or from the shallows. This made "staying home" just as worthwhile. 
Beautiful place. Attentive host. Note to revisit/recommend.

The location of the cottage is outstanding.  The lake is beautiful, and we saw fireflies for the first time in years!  The Toronto skyline is visible from the deck.  We enjoyed just sitting and looking at the water.  The big freighters were coming and going as well.

The house is gorgeous, the lake view stunning. Eric is very responsive, and reached out to let us know he was available if we needed anything, making us feel comfortable in the house. This is probably the first place I've stayed that actually seemed MORE spacious in person than in the photos. We had a very peaceful and enjoyable stay, and so will you!

We loved staying at this beautiful lakeside cottage. The view is just amazing and the cottage itself is comfortable and beautifully maintained. Eric stopped by to check in and was available if we needed, but truthfully we had everything we needed. We would definitely love to stay here again!
this place and especially Eric deserves more than 5 stars, we had a great time incl. BBQ and chill time, but also close to must-see locations - thank you so much!!!

description.summary: Woodcliff Cottage has been fully renovated. A new kitchen features granite countertops, high-end range, island/bar and spectacular views. The kitchen opens into a spacious living room with gas fireplace and more windows looking out over the new deck and Lake Ontario. Enjoy a sunset campfire at the fire pit with stairs leading down to Lake Ontario. 2 Bedrooms, 2 baths with walk-in shower and shower with full bathtub. We also rent Shell Cottage next door.
description.space: The deck and views are breathtaking.
description.access: Guests may use all areas of Woodcliff Cottage.
description.notes: Niagara Falls is 20 minutes away. Fort Niagara is 4 minutes away. Numerous wineries, restaurants, and shopping is nearby in beautiful Lewiston, NY.
description.neighborhood: The Woodcliff neighborhood is quiet and secluded.  Our other AirBnB rental is Shell Cottage right next door. There are nice hiking trails with old growth oaks and fishing at 4 mile creek .
description.transit: Please park in the driveway or the parking space next to the garage. Please don’t block the east-west lane, which is old Woodcliff lane. Please do not drive on the grass or walk.
description.interaction: We live minutes away, and are very responsive but not intrusive. Kindly read our reviews
description.house_rules: Please treat our home like your own. Some rules to follow are no smoking, turn down heat/a-c when leaving or with windows open, don’t drive on the grass, don’t leave fireplace or outdoor fire pit lit when unattended, turn off lights, and leave the cottage neat and tidy. Guests who exceed 4 persons will be charged $100/night per extra guest.

Every detail of the decoration is impeccable, beautiful and useful kitchen and incredible bedrooms. The hot tub was  extremely fun and relaxing. Thank you very much for the great experience.

Great stay!!
This was our first stay at an Airbnb and outside of our home country at that. The Blue Beach House was near perfection and Caitlin & Mike were immediate available to answer questions.

Caitlin’s place was perfect for a quick family vacation. Very short drive to the beach, there were beach passes available. Great back patio, beautiful kitchen and bathrooms. We felt right at home and would definitely stay again.

Beautiful home ! Felt very beach like . Neighbourhood in Crystal beach was more run down than I would have expected but they seem to be revitalizing the area . If I was travelling back to this area I would definitely stay at this Airbnb again !
Great spot! Stayed here a few times and keep coming back.

description.summary: Brew Keurig coffee in the updated kitchen, then spread out in an open interior designed for easy socializing. Dine on grills from the gas BBQ in the private fenced backyard, which comes with shower and hot tub. End the day soaking in a spa bath.
description.space:
The "Blue Beach House" offers modern updates with a cottage feel. It is the perfect entertainers getaway, with an open concept space and ample seating areas. There are 2 TVs both with Netflix capabilities, board games, playing cards and WIFI throughout the entire place.

The kitchen has high end appliances and is stocked with pots, pans, dishes, cups, utensils and cooking ware. The large kitchen island is a chef's dream!

There are 2 luxurious full baths and 1 half bath. Modern spa like features, such as rain shower and large spa tub will have you relaxed in minutes. Shampoo, conditioner, body wash is provided as well as bath salts and bubble bath to provide ultimate relaxation during your stay.

Cottage has central air throughout to keep you cool after spending the day at the beach. 

Towels, bed sheets, duvets, pillows and plush blankets are provided for your stay. All that's left for you to bring is food and your bathing suit!

We are excited to share our beautiful piece of Crystal Beach. We hope our "happy place" will become yours.

Caitlin and Mike
description.neighborhood: Crystal Beach offers sparkling sands and safe swimming. Stroll to the South Coast Cookhouse for probably the best wings in town, plus live music. Pick up souvenirs at many local shops, while ZOOZ is a short drive and Niagara Falls under a half hour.
description.transit: Local bus stop is across from your front door. Although everything you need for your stay is within walking distance.
description.interaction: We are available as needed for any questions or concerns at your convenience.
description.house_rules: - Minimum 7 night stay during peak months: May 19 - September 8

Excellent.  Very clean and quiet neighbourhood.   It was a very relaxing stay. We went on a wine tour and relaxed in the backyard   The house had a lot of room and very clean  Andrew and Claudia were very accommodating. I would recommend this AirBnB
Andrew and Claudia’s house very nice and spacious! We enjoyed our time there and would definitely recommend staying there.

Myself and my family had a wonderful stay, it truly added to our visit to Niagara on the Lake and we felt right at home.
The attention to detail was fantastic and everything was pristine and all instructions were clear and easy to follow.
We truly had the best experience and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. 
Would highly recommend as a first class stay to enhance your visit to niagara on the lake or to just get a nice relaxing break away.
Beautiful place, clean and comfortable. Would visit again!

What a beautiful stay! Andrew and Claudia thought of absolutely everything. The house was spotless, welcoming, and a wonderful base for our NOTL trip. It’s close to the main strip of the wineries but tucked away enough to feel peaceful and private. We couldn’t have been happier with our stay and will be back for sure. Thank you!

We totally enjoyed our stay at TheRetreat home! The house was extremely clean! The kitchen is outstanding and has everything you need to cook a meal or bake. The large island is impressive! The backyard is very quiet and private. We enjoyed the hot tub that was very clean. The hosts are very responsive and we arrived to snacks and a wonderful bottle of wine. We would definitely recommend it to family and friends! Thank you Andrew and Claudia!

description.summary: Relax with the whole family or friends at this peaceful place to stay.
description.space:
Welcome to the Retreat Home in NOTL, Located in a beautiful quiet neighborhood, 4 mins driving to Queen St, the heart of Old Town of Niagara-on-the-lake and very close to Niagara-on-the-lake Golf Club, steps away of a tennis court. There are many wineries and a lavender farm close by.  This is a renovated house,  with a new gorgeous kitchen, new appliances, new furniture, new floors, new bathroom.  In the main level you will find the porch, living room, kitchen with dedicated workspace, and kitchen's deck to access the relaxing private backyard with Hot Tub, BBQ with natural gas and patio furniture, the second level have 3 bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms,  1 bedroom with 2 double beds, 1 bedroom with  2 single beds and the master bedroom with 1 queen bed and it's own bathroom. There is a family room with 3rd full bathroom downstairs  and game boards, and the recreation room with pool table and Air hockey table are in the basement, beside the laundry room.
The kitchen is fully equipped. We offer complimentary coffee and tea.  Professional cleaning services are engaged.
description.access: Guests will have access to the entire house during their stay, excluding the storage room and furnace room located in the basement. Guests are allowed to a free Parking and EV charge station in the driveway
description.notes:
SINGLE NIGHT BOOKINGS: 
May be requested and are subject to approval by the owner**

GYM: 
In partnership with the F45 training facility in Niagara On The Lake, a 50% discount is offered to our guests for daily or weekly passes. F45 is a 45 minute guided and fun training workout. There are morning and evening classes. The facility is located 6 minutes driving from our place. Ask us for the promo code and instructions. 

SECURITY CAMERAS:
There are 3 exterior security cameras, one in the driveway, one ring doorbell in main door and one in the backyard’s door (far away from the hot tub area, around 600 ft away), they will be on during your stay for everyone safety and security

NUMBER OF GUESTS:
The number of guests at the property is limited to the number of guests on the reservation
description.neighborhood: Located in a beautiful quiet neighborhood
description.house_rules:
Thank you for choosing The Retreat Homes to be your host during your stay in Niagara-on-the-lake. It is our pleasure to host you. 

Please review and accept terms and conditions listed below by replying to this email. We also require you to fill out the names of those staying at the house overnight and we also need the license plate number of any vehicle parking on the premises

Please note this vacation home is licensed by the Town of Niagara-on-the-lake with Short Term Rental License No. 101-2022. All vacations rentals must be licensed by the town of Niagara-on-the-lake, and we are restricted by the number of people that can stay overnight (including children) and the number of cars to be parked on the property. Please ensure that this vacation home fits your criteria.

Note:  By-laws prohibit overnight street parking. Please Park in the driveway of the property

Check in time is after 4:00 PM.
Check out time is before 11:00 AM.

Supplies:

All bed linens and towels shall be provided. We also provide coffee and tea station with variety of teas, coffee, stevia, brown sugar, and we start you off with salt, and basic supply of paper towels, toilet paper, hand soap, body shower, shampoo and conditioner, dish/dishwasher soap, laundry and fabric softener and cleaning supplies. You are responsible for any additional requirements during your stay

There maybe Pantry items left from other guests, however it is up to your discretion and only decision to use them, No responsibility can be accepted by the house owners if you decide to use these pantry items 

Housekeeping is not included in your rental. Arrangement can be made for an additional charge.

Terms and Conditions of Occupancy:

1.	The primary guest making the booking must be at least 25 years of age to rent a vacations home. We require the names of those staying at the house overnight and we also require license plate number of any vehicle parking on the premises.

2.	Reservations are not transferable. The person who made the reservation must stay for the full duration of the booking.

3.	This is a private home in a residential neighborhood and not venues for parties or events are permitted, including but not limited commercial functions, weddings, bachelor/bachelorette parties, graduation parties, rehearsal dinners or BBQ/grill for large gatherings. Each house has a cap on number of people permitted to be on the property at one time, the number of people at the property is limited to the number of guests on the booking, if there is any unauthorized guest, there will be a minimal charge of at least $200 per guest, per night. There are exterior security cameras to monitor and verify the number of guests

4.	Only registered guests are permitted to use any of the amenities of the vacation home. If not adhered to you and your traveling group will be asked to vacate the property without a refund.

5.	Non-smoking: No guest or visitor shall smoke Marijuana or other tobacco cigarettes, cigars, electronic cigarette, or nay similar product whose use generate smoke or vapors within the house. This prohibition includes porch, kitchen deck, backyard, enclosed common areas, as well outside within 9 meters of doorways and windows. There will be a minimum surcharge of $500 for any smoke related clean-up

6.	Pets:  We love animals, but unfortunately pets are not allowed in our home due to allergies. Owners use this house as their vacation home, There will be a minimum surcharge of $500 for any pets related clean-up in addition to damages caused by pets

7.	Parking: The number of vehicles that can be parked on the driveway is up to 4 cars. By-laws prohibits over night street parking. Please always park on the driveway of the house

8.	The person booking accepts full responsibility for any an all damages or losses inflicted upon the house, its contents and/or property

9.	The decision to rent accommodations and use of all facilities/appliances/ (including the use of Internet, electrical appliances, Hot Tub, BBQ) are entirely at the renter's risk.

10.	No responsibility can be accepted by the house owners for any event resulting in death, injury, loss of personal effects, or damage whatsoever to the renter or his/her guests' personal property. Guests are solely responsible for the safety and security of all persons in the house, including children, always during their rental period.

11.	In case of an uncontrollable situation (power failure, Internet interruption, water shortage, sewers failure), no refund will be processed.

12.	Quiet enjoyment: No person shall make noise to cause disturbance or conduct themselves in a way that is likely to disturb area residents. The noise by-law prohibits sound or vibration at any time, which is likely to disturb the quiet, peace, rest, enjoyment, comfort, or convenience of the inhabitants of the town. Noise By-law 4588-12

13.	In case of personal injury, emergency, or fire call 911. Address of the home is on the welcome guest book. During fire, use fire extinguishers, if possible, without harm to yourself. If you doubt about health or injuries, call tele-health which is a free service

14.	Garbage cans are located inside the backyard, blue is for recycling, green is for organic and grey/black bags is garbage. We take the garbage and recyclable to roadside before 7:00 am on Monday

15.	House Maintenance: your home is professionally cleaned and disinfected prior to your arrival, while we don’t expect you to dust, scrub toilets or vacuum on your holiday, we would ask you to please keep the house clean and tidy (as it was when you arrived). Cleaning up spills immediately protects the finish and keeping the kitchen clean prevents little critters from feasting on your leftovers. Only use appliances for their intended uses. If requires more than normal cleaning after your stay, you will be assessed the additional cost.

Please help us maintain the home in a good and clean condition by following these simple procedures during your stay and at departure:

a.	Leave the soiled towels in the bathtub
b.	Run dishwasher with soiled dishes prior to check out
c.	Dispose all waste material into specific bins outside
d.	Please clean countertops and stove of spills or sticky residue
e.	Please do not rearrange furniture in the house, outdoor furniture stays outside, indoor furniture stays inside. You may be assessed an additional cost to your stay if furniture is damaged from being inappropriately treated or the additional time to put furniture back in its designated spot.
f.	Odors – please refrain from cooking foods or creating aromas that linger beyond your stay. If the odors remain and result in relocating the guests coming in after your same day departure, you will be assessed the cost to relocate for one night. Strong aromatic foods can be cooked outside on the grill/BBQ
g.	Report all maintenance issues promptly. Just as might happen at your own well-maintained home, mechanical failures, disruption of services and other breakdowns can occur. Every effort will be made to correct the situation; however, no refunds or rate adjustments will be made for mechanical and service failures that are beyond our control

16.	 Damages found by inspection crews upon departure will be billed and full payment for repairs will be collected via credit card

17.	No Foods on the bedrooms please. If bedding and or towels are stained, please do not attempt to clean, this may set the stain. Please let us know as soon as possible and before your departure

18.	Storage room are not included in your rental (if found unlocked, please refrain from taking out additional items or supplies). Garages do not have guarantee access for guests. Most are for owner usage only and are not included in your short-term rental

19.	The Gas fireplace is not available for usage as the gas line is closed for safety reasons, only electric fireplace is available.

20. The BBQ is connected to the house natural gas line and is for authorized guests to use during their stay,  you will find it clean on your arrival with the understanding it will be left without food after use to avoid bacteria and critters issues,  if BBQ is found left dirty with leftover food and requires extra deep cleaning, an extra cleaning fee may be required.  BBQ utensils are provided and left in the kitchen's drawer close to the dishwasher.  Please turn off the gas after BBQ use. 

21.	Absolutely no fireworks or outdoor fires are permitted on the premises

22.	Loss or damage: We reserve the right to charge for any loss or damage etc. assessed upon departure. If extra cleaning or sanitizing is required over and above that would be considered normal wear and tear, a minim fee of $500 will be charged to cover these extra costs.

23.	Hot Tub: 

a.	Your hot tub has been disinfected and the water was balanced with high quality products in accordance with regulations.
b.	Extra charge for excessive or inappropriate use of hot tub.
c.	A picture of the water quality has been taken before your arrival and following charges may apply in case of improper use.
d.	Service asked, necessary choc treatment and/or if extra water is required: From $50.00
e.	If water must be changed (unsafe): From $80.00
f.	Closure of hot tub and/or complete clean: From $100.00
g.	*** Our technician can close your hot tub at any time if he finds it to be no longer safe due to improper use. ***

24.	During your stay we may have some maintenance work done on the outside of the home such as mowing, trimming, cleaning BBQ/grill, tidying up patio and hot tub maintenance (if applicable).

25.	Guest must be aware of an adhere to all Niagara-on-the-Lake by-laws, including Noise (By-law 4583-12) and Public Nuisances (By-law 4397-10 and 4397A-11). Any fines levies because of a complaint during your stay will be charged to the primary guest.

We understand you are on vacation and realize that the above may seem strict, but many of these policies are meant to ensure safe enjoyment for yourself and your group, but also to reduce wear and tear on the home and ensure the quiet enjoyment of neighbors. Failure to comply with any of the above will result in you and your group immediately vacating the vacation home. If you are requested to vacate before your scheduled departure date because of not complying with the Terms and Conditions of Occupancy, you are not entitled to any refunds.

Check in Process: Check in time is after 4:00 PM. There are no keys for pick up. The door code for your stay is confirmed 3- 2 days prior of arrival by email

Check out Process: Check out time is before 11:00 AM. Please follow this check lists:
•	Leave the property reasonably clean and in reasonably order (Additional cleaning charge may apply
•	Leave kitchen items (dishes, cookware, etc.) clean and dishwasher on
•	Dispose of all trash and recyclables in proper outside containers, located inside backyard, close to the backyard door
•	Lock all doors and windows
•	Leave all beds unmade and towels in the bathroom
•	Turn off all lights, fireplace, TV and PS4
•	Notify host on your departure
•	Before leaving, double check that you have not left any personal items behind. Call us if you have forgotten something and you want it shipped back to you
