name: Niagara-on-the-Lake/Niagara Grapeview Cottage
title: Niagara-on-the-Lake, Canada

hosts.about:
Welcome!! My name is Margarita and I’m a wife and mom to 2 beautiful kids. 
We love to stay active, travel/explore new places. 

Hope to host you soon!

recent.comments: Great stay. Beautiful property. Highly recommend

items.comments: Great stay. Beautiful property. Highly recommend

We, a group of 3 couples, had an amazing stay at GrapeView Cottage! Location was perfect, centrally located to many of the vineyards in the area. House seems recently renovated, modern appliances and fully stocked with all the amenities we needed. We have stayed in quite a few AirBnBs and this was most clean and well maintained by far!
Having 3 bedrooms with queen size beds was the main factor for us. This offset the downside of the single, but large and very nice bathroom. It was a bit inconvenient but manageable.
We took advantage of the hot tub and the sauna during our stay, what a great bonus. 

The highlight of our stay was renting bikes to cycle around to 5 wineries. Most of the streets have wide bike lanes/sidewalks to travel on as well as the Niagara Parkway Recreational Trail that skirts many of the wineries.

We would highly recommend to anyone looking for a getaway in the heart of wine country. We can't wait to return here!

Fantastic host. The place was spotless, instructions were super clear, and such a beautiful property! Location was perfect for visiting local wineries, it was also close enough to anything you might need but tucked away on a beautiful piece of land. Thanks for having us :)

This was the perfect base to soak in the wineries, NOTL restaurants & StCatherines’ beaches.  A home away from home,  we enjoyed our new wines looking out over the vineyard while our kids played in the huge perfectly shaded backyard. Every winery big and small felt 5 minutes away  or less. The quiet night in was stone oven pizza and the hot tub. The newly renovated kitchen made the fresh egg’s taste that much better with the fresh fruit from the stand just 2 doors down. Need I say more?
We had such a great time and will definitely be back to this air bnb !
Our stay was wonderful! Your home had everything we needed. Most of all we loved to sit in the back area and relax in the hot tub.
Thanks for opening your beautiful home to us. It was the perfect weekend!

description.summary: Welcome to the grapeview 4 season cottage! Beautifully renovated, backing on to the Konzelman vineyard!! Only 2 minute drive to Old Town. Far enough to enjoy the farm life with unforgettable views, in the heart of the wine country. Take advantage of the farm life, pick your own fresh eggs for breakfast and enjoy our brand new hot tub and cedar wood burning barrel sauna with a breathtaking view of the vineyard. Rent bikes only short drive down the road and experience all Niagara on the Lake has .
description.space:
This house has been fully renovated and consists of 3 bedrooms (3 queens sized beds) and a 4 piece bathroom. Our brand new kitchen is loaded with all the cookware you are going to need along with the condiments!! As you go down to the basement you will find a gas fireplace and a large TV! You will also see a foosball table and many boardgames to keep yourself busy on a rainy night. There’s a table with 6 chairs on the back porch as well as a loveseat and a brand new Webber BBQ (Hooked up to natural gas).
The barn that you see in the pictures is locked for storage.
description.notes:
*THIS IS NOT A PARTY HOUSE!! ABSOLUTELY NO PARTIES!!! 
*NO SMOKING/VAPING ETC...
*NO LOUD MUSIC
*NO EXTRA GUESTS OTHER THAN ONES THAT ARE REGISTERED 
*NO MOVING FURNITURE AROUND
*RESPECT THE HOT TUB/SAUNA RULES
NOTE: you MUST bring your own firewood for the sauna
*You will receive check in details along with 
with the door pin a few days before your arrival.
*Check out is 11AM SHARP. Please respect this as we need time to prepare for next guests. 
*There’s an exterior security camera (1), in front of the house, that records only when there’s motion, to monitor for any potential damage, intruders, and the number of guests.
*We are licensed by the town of Niagara on the Lake.

hosts.about:
Hello Airbnb Community! 

I am a very proud Canadian, raised in Niagara-on-the-Lake, Ontario, where I now live with my husband on our second generation family fruit farm with our children and our Great Bernese dog Oswin. I am a devout Roger Federer fan and in my free time love playing cards with my daughters, cooking, and taking Oswin on long walks. 

My family has always been in the hotel business so therefore I have naturally felt drawn to working in the Hospitality sector.  Meeting new people is something I love and feels organic to me!  My education is in Business and in my late teens I was fortunate enough to partake in an International Management Program at Walt Disney World, studying their world-renowned training and hotel divisions. 

Whether I meet you as a host or a guest, I will always aim to make it a mutual 5 Star experience!

recent.comments: Great place to stay in Niagara on the Lake! Perfect for a family! Beautifully designed and well thought out. Spacious! The views of the vineyards across the way are stunning ! Great communicative host and ease of stay. Would love to come again!

items.comments: Great place to stay in Niagara on the Lake! Perfect for a family! Beautifully designed and well thought out. Spacious! The views of the vineyards across the way are stunning ! Great communicative host and ease of stay. Would love to come again!
We were looking for a quiet, peaceful, comfortable spot and definitely found it here. We hope to stay here again if we're in the area again.
The Airbnb was amazing. The location was perfect, set right amidst the vineyards. The home itself was spectacular. I would 100% recommend staying here.

What a beautiful stay! The house was immaculate upon check-in. The whole process was very simple. Beautifully decorated retreat for our little group in a perfect location-- great for a relaxing stay & amazing proximity to wineries and downtown Niagara on the Lake. Comfortable beds, kitchen was stocked well with anything you would need to prepare a meal & the backyard was your own private retreat. We will definitely be back!
Beautiful location and beautiful home!!! It was a perfect getaway in Niagara and Erica is an incredible host! Quick to respond and very accommodating. We loved it and can’t wait to come back!

Erica’s place was set in a most beautiful location and was very private.  We felt right at home.  Absolutely Charming!  
Thank you.
A wonderful stay in Niagara on the lake!  Peaceful and serene, beautifully decorated.  We will be back!

description.summary:
Welcome to Vineyard Views, a modern farmhouse nestled on half an acre in Niagara wine country! Renovated in 2022, this raised bungalow is a quick five minute drive to Old Town NOTL. 

We are within minutes to numerous wineries and all that Niagara-on-the-Lake has to offer. Our beautiful home is set up for watching stunning sunsets, hosting guests and is perfect for both families & friends. 

A backyard oasis with a sauna, conversational circle, patio dining set, large lawn, BBQ, privacy & more!
description.space:
IG @vineyardviews_notl

The home features two bedrooms, a stylish bathroom, open kitchen and large living room.  Relax and unwind with luxury amenities including a wood burning sauna and stunning vineyard views. 

The house includes:

- Two bedrooms to comfortably sleep up to 6 
- Two queen beds and one quality pull out sofa in living room (extra person fee applies)
- Gorgeous chef's kitchen with stainless steel appliances and gas range
- Dining room seats 8 with gorgeous views of the vineyards
- Large, light filled living room with beautiful gas fireplace and smart TV
- Reading nook, overlooking the vineyards
- Dedicated workspace
- In home Wifi
- Laundry room
- Wood burning cedar sauna for 6 guests (wood not included)
- Patio dining on back deck and outdoor conversation circle with muskoka chairs (seasonal)
- BBQ (gas)
- Outdoor painted feature wall 
- Parking for up to 4 cars
- Lawn games (Yardzee, oversized Jenga, croquet)
- Family friendly (Pack N Play, highchair, kids toys and games)

Distance to some popular wineries, breweries and attractions:

- Ferox Winery (1 min drive, 7 min walk)
- Pilliteri Estate Winery / BarrellHead Restaurant (2 min drive, 15 min walk)
- Stratus Vineyards (3 min drive, 15 min walk)
- Niagara Oast House Brewers (3 min drive, 15 min walk)
- Jackson-Triggs (3 min drive, 15 min walk)
- Silversmith Brewing Company (3 min drive)
- Ironwood Cider House (4 min drive)
- Hinterbrook Estate Winery (4 min drive)
- Peller Estates (5 min drive)
- Trius Winery (5 min drive)
- Wayne Gretzkys (5 min drive)
- Konzelmann Estate Winery (5 min drive)
- Caroline Cellars (5 min drive)
- Lailey Winery (5 min drive)
- Palatine Hills Estate Winery (6 min drive)
- Two Sisters Vineyards (7 min drive)
- Inniskillin Wines (7 min drive)
- Big Head Wines (7 min drive)

- Old Town Niagara-on-the Lake: 2.8 km
- Shaw Festival Theatre: 4.8 km
- Outlet Collection at Niagara: 12 km
- Niagara Falls: 19 km
- Casino Niagara: 20 km

We are a 5 min drive to Old Town Niagara-on-the-Lake and 3 min drive to the heart of Virgil.
description.access: Guest has access to the entire home. Parking is included and free for up to 4 cars.
description.notes:
Please bring your own wood for the sauna. We provide an axe for chopping up firewood and it is located inside the sauna. Wood can be purchased from many local gas stations and hardware stores.

*We will consider small dogs for a $100 fee. Please inquire with us.

** We DO NOT allow weddings, wedding events, wedding parties or bachelorette or bachelor parties on this property and have exterior cameras in place to ensure no events as per our town requirements. No parking of trailers, campers, or tents of any kind allowed ***

- WIFI in rural areas can be slow at times
- In summer season there can be "bird bangers" which are loud booms from the vineyards. This happens only in daytime hours.
- Exterior cameras are in place
- We only accept guests who have their Government ID verified with Airbnb
- We will ask ALL guests before booking a few questions about 
their stay, to ensure we are community minded hosts that care for our neighbours.
- Check in is SELF entry and we will not meet you on arrival. 
- We provide one towel and pillow per guest, a hand towel for each washroom.
- Lawn mowing in season happens once per week. This may happen during your stay.
description.neighborhood:
Niagara-on-the-Lake is situated in the Niagara Peninsula which is the largest wine region in Ontario, and the only place in the world that’s warm enough in summer to make red wine and cold enough in winter to make ice wine.

The town of Niagara-on-the-Lake is filled with small-town Victorian charm. Old Town NOTL has boutique shops, horse-drawn carriages, the Shaw Festival Theatre, Fort George and incredible restaurants!
description.transit:
Walk or bike to some closer wineries and breweries or we are able to give recommendations on wine tour companies. Many local bike companies offer complimentary delivery and pick up (please inquire).

Uber and Lyft are available in Niagara-on-the-Lake. We are 5 minute drive to Queen Street (the main street in Old Town Niagara-on-the-Lake) and a 20 minute drive to Niagara Falls. Approximately 1.5 hours from Toronto Pearson Airport and 45 minutes from Buffalo Airport.
description.interaction: Our local property manager is available for emergencies and questions during your stay and can be reached by phone and the Airbnb platform.
description.house_rules:
- In accordance with Municipality By-Laws, which states the quiet time for the town is 11:00 PM - 7:00 AM.
- No confetti, rice or banners taped to the walls or hung on any fixtures. 
- ONLY guests staying at the cottage may be on the premises.  6 guests MAXIMUM ADULTS, CHILDREN, BABIES all together. 
- Please note times. Check in 4 pm, check out 11 am. 
- No shoes or boots inside the cottage please.
- No out door tents, campers of any kind etc.

hosts.about: Upholstery shop owner, dog snuggler, Gardner, collector of house projects.

I grew up just south of Buffalo and now live in the Finger Lakes area.  I’m a holistic healer and founder of Alchemy Healing Arts in Skaneateles, NY.

I love hosting guests at my former home and helping folks enjoy all that Buffalo/Niagara has to offer.

I’m blessed to have an incredible team of artists & intuitives managing the spaces.

We are here to help so please don’t hesitate to reach out.  Please makes yourselves at home and enjoy!

recent.comments: Beautiful home! Only complaint is that the sauna doesn’t look as advertised and was difficult to get started. Thanks for opening your home to us!!

items.comments: Beautiful home! Only complaint is that the sauna doesn’t look as advertised and was difficult to get started. Thanks for opening your home to us!!

I’ll list the negatives first. I have much that is positive. The neighborhood feels clean and safe, but is filled with decay on wooden porches, trim and balconies (not this house. Don’t worry). The sky lights inside can make it difficult to sleep after sunrise but  sleep masks are thoughtfully provided. We couldn’t get the sauna to heat. Be aware the upstairs sleeping spaces are divided but open to the stair cases. The light switches are also a bit confusing. 

Stunning and quirky spaces abound here. Wonderful items to admire and look at. Unexpected layout and built in features make the space cozy and entertaining.

The plants are a wonderful feature above the kitchen/in the art room. 

The courtyard is a lovely oasis, but be mindful that there can be small buds on the ground that track inside easily. 

The photo series showing the home’s transformation was very fascinating to see! 

All the beds were very comfortable and we loved our stay! Would definitely stay here again.

We had a lovely stay at Eliza's place. It was perfect for our family's visit to Buffalo for my son's wedding. The place was delightfully creative and and comfortable. It was well appointed with everything we needed. The instruction booklet had very clear information and instructions about the space. We very much enjoyed the courtyard area where we spent a good bit of our time. The neighborhood was refreshingly diverse, and we had lovely neighbors. My favorite Airbnb so far.. We would love to stay here again on our next trip. Certainly all five stars.
Such a fun and quirky place that’s full of character! I absolutely loved staying here! Very clean, local suggestions, amazing architecture. A must stay!!

We loved Eliza's house. Such a cool use of space. Check in was straightforward. Air conditioning was effective. Great amenties. A short distance from Allentown, we recommend Allentown Burger and Betty's. Eliza was a friendly and extremely responsive host. We wouldn't hesitate to stay again. Thanks Eliza

This place was absolutely beautiful, I loved the location. It was incredible to have so much relaxation within the bustle of the city! I really appreciated the outdoor space and the blackout room was a thoughtful touch as there is so much natural lighting. Would definitely come back!
Good

description.summary:
An architectural gem, this home was renovated in the 90s by Buffalo architect David Stieglitz.  You’re sure to enjoy the open floor plan with plenty of skylights, plants, and lush vibes.   

Since acquiring the property in 2012, I have added my own artistic touch, and I love sharing this incredible space with others.  

***This is a dog-friendly space and we welcome your to bring your pup however it is an extra $50 cleaning fee.
description.space:
This open-concept house features a kitchen with great layout for cooking & entertaining, a living room with a library wall and ladder, wood burning fireplace, master bedroom with claw foot bath, and a built-in SAUNA! There are two full bathrooms with showers. 

The first floor bedroom (queen) adjoins with the downstairs bath.  A second bedroom features a tempur pedicure queen mattress.  A third full sized bed is set up in the upstairs "art room" as well. An outdoor enclosed courtyard features lots of plants and Adirondack chairs in the summer.

*In the summer it can get hot. We install 3  air conditioning window units into the sleeping areas.  (Both bedrooms and the artroom).

This neighborhood houses mostly Puerto Rican families who are friendly neighbors, and in rear of the house I also host guests in the carriage house.  (The patio is shared between guests at both spaces)

The house is walkable distance to TOPS (grocery store 2 blocks away) &  Allentown bars, galleries, and restaurants.  There are severals parks nearby and LaSalle Park just a 10 minute walk, right along the water.

Uber & Lyft are your best options for public transport, however, there are buses and one metro line that can get you to University of Buffalo area.

If you are traveling with a car street parking is alternating, but there are always plenty of spots available .

Street parking alternates Monday-Wednesday on the right side between 9-4, Thursday & Friday on the left between 9 & 4.  You can park on both sides evenings & weekends

This home is unique, comfortable, filled with natural light and quiet.  You'll feel like royalty!
description.access: Entire house is yours.  Courtyard is shared with the carriage house guests.
description.notes:
Check in is after 4pm, check out before 11am*

*We need to get in to clean at 11 for future guests, so unless otherwise specified you will be charged $10/hour cash for every hour you are late checking out.

Dogs are welcome at these spaces, so it may not be great for a person with dog-allergies.

We welcome you to bring your dog, however there is an extra $50 cleaning fee for dogs.

We do not accept cats.
description.neighborhood:
Tops grocery store is around a block and a half away for all of your basic needs. 

Khari's cafe is just a two block walk (at Jersey & Fargo). They have lovely coffee and breakfast foods. 

If you want to go for a longer walk or drive check out Breadhive Bakery on Connecticut Ave for homemade breakfast and lunch sandwiches. 

I love strolling to LaSalle park -- just a couple blocks down Hudson, you walk over a pedestrian bridge and then you’re along the waterfront.

We are close to Allentown, Canalside, Downtown, and Elmwood Village. You can rent bikes in Elmwood or just walk around. The architecture in Buffalo is incredible.  

The parks systems developed by Fredrick Law Olmstead are gorgeous and world renowned!!

We are located:
7 minute drive to KeyBank Center
30 minutes from Niagara Falls
5 minutes to Allentown
10 minutes to Elmwood Village/Buff State
description.transit:
There are Metro buses you can take, but I recommend using Uber or Lyft.  You can also rent Reddy Bikes by the hour which is a fun and healthy way to get around!

Parking is free.  As Prospect Ave is a one-way street there is alternate street parking during the day and parking on either side of the street at night. 

*Monday-Wednesday 9am-4pm cars can only park on the right

*Thursday-Friday 9am-4pm cars can only park on the left

*Weekends you are free to park on both sides between Fridays at 4pm until Monday at 9am
description.interaction: Guests check-in with keypad at their convenience.
description.house_rules:
Please be respectful of my things.  No smoking inside.   Please take your shoes off in the house.

Please keep the outdoor patio area clean after using because it is a shared area with my carriage house tenant.  

Please keep an eye on the fireplace if lit at all times & Follow safety guidelines listed inside sauna.

Thank you and have a wonderful stay!

recent.comments: Great place to stay with everything in walking distance and nice outdoor patio.

items.comments: Great place to stay with everything in walking distance and nice outdoor patio.
We had a lovely stay! The home is located so close to the centre of niagara on the lake. Perfect location for walking to grab dinner, coffee, etc…

Do not hesitate to book this charming house! You really cannot beat this location—it is right in the middle of downtown. The shower head and water pressure are divine. The sheets are so soft and the beds are comfortable. We chose the queen bed  in the second bedroom which was a little softer, but there’s a firmer mattress in the master if you prefer. We were just there over night on our way to Toronto, but this place would definitely be great for a longer stay! The host was so nice and responsive to messages. Thanks for a lovely stay!
Rigoberto’s Airbnb was clean, comfortable and centrally located. My group and I enjoyed our stay very much.
We love it

Beautiful surroundings , beautiful home . We had a lovely stay! The only suggestions would be ice in freezer available or the ability to make ice .  Another suggestion would be more towels /washcloths in bathrooms . Overall a gorgeous location ( Enjoyed front porch !)  and a perfect get away .

description.summary:
Historic main street home with gorgeous veranda 3 Bedrooms 2 Bath. This historic grand home is located in the heart of Old Town Niagara on the Lake’s main street and offers travelers a very special experience. It boasts with two queen bedrooms and third bedroom with two twin beds and two full baths.

Note: Our NOTL Short Term Rental License Number is 096-2018.
description.space:
This historic grand home located in the heart of Old Town Niagara on the Lake’s main street and offers travelers a very special experience. It boasts with two queen bedrooms and third bedroom with two twin beds and two full baths.

The attention to detail, quality workmanship and material is evident throughout the house, from the restored custom cabinetry to the hardwood floors and the restored ornate radiators.

The veranda and its intricate original trim are still intact and make it a very special place to enjoy a glass of local wine or a BBQ in the heart of the Old Town. Relax anb take in the glorious gardens that surround the property.

Lake Ontario is only blocks away, as are the Niagara on the Lake’s Queen Street, Niagara Golf Club, many restaurants, and the Shaw Festival Theatre. The home is situated next the Prince of Wales Hotel. On a warm summer day, horse-drawn carriages can be seen parading by from the veranda.

Original doors with glass open to the home’s foyer, which features a dramatic grand wooden staircase.

The spacious formal living room with hardwood floors, large windows is adjacent to he formal dining room has also has hardwood floors, double entrance doors at the site of the family room and kitchen lead to the gorgeous garden with multiple seating areas and a natural gas BBQ.

On the second floor, three bedrooms feature hardwood floors and a large bathroom. The master bedroom has queen bed and a walk-in closet. The second and third bedrooms have a queen bed and the third with two twins. In addition to the three bedrooms the second level offers an office space that is ideal for the business traveler.

Lake Ontario is only a block away, as are the Niagara on the Lake’s Queen Street, Niagara Golf Club, many restaurants, and the Shaw Festival Theatre. The home is situated next to the Prince of Wales Hotel. On a warm summer day, horse-drawn carriages can be seen parading by from the veranda.

This beautifully decorated and well-located home is the perfect place to get away from it all. Your host, Mark, is happy to suggest activities and help you explore to make the best of your visit...including recommendations for local pubs and restaurants.
description.access: Full home, veranda, BBQ, free wifi, free onsite parking

description.space:
Welcome to the Beachside Abode located in the heart of Crystal Beach. This newly renovated home is the perfect home for family and friends to enjoy a beautiful beach and enjoy everything Historic Crystal Beach has to offer!

Steps to gorgeous Bay Beach, restaurants, shopping, and  Niagara Falls is 20 minutes away!
The space

Max occupancy is 8 people. At no point during your stay should the occupancy of the home exceed 8 people please.

We welcome mature groups and families to come  visit our Abode that will respect the house rules and neighbourhood as they would in their own home.

What you'll love
✔ 2 queen beds and 2 sets of twin bunkbeds to sleep 8 people
✔ House is 1 floor, no stairs inside
✔ Beach passes and beach towels for your stay
✔ Large playground and iconic Crystal Beach sign directly across the street
✔ Parking for up to 2 standard cars
✔ Every room has been fully renovated by professional designer
✔ Luxury custom built chef's kitchen with oversized island
✔ Double sided gas fireplace
✔ Board games
✔ Patio seating and a picnic table
✔ Restaurants and shops all within walking distance
✔ All amenities are private and for your exclusive use. No sharing!
✔ More outdoor amenities coming in Spring/Summer 2023! Stay tuned~


SLEEPING ARRANGEMENT
• Bdrm 1: one queen bed 
• Bdrm 2: one queen bed 
• Bdrm 3: two single bunk beds
description.access:
Guest access
The entire home is for your exclusive use except for the backyard shed. 
We provide one bath towel and washcloth per registered guest. If you require more please plan accordingly.

We provide limited quantities of basic items to get your stay started, including toilet paper, paper towel, soap, salt and pepper, sugar, tea, and coffee. Should you require more, please plan accordingly.

We will be onsite for outdoor property maintenance. This includes snow clearing, grass cutting and general grounds keeping/property maintenance.

We have a Minut noise sensor inside the home. The noise sensor does NOT record any audio/video, or store any information. The neighbors in Crystal Beach are quite sensitive to noise and having a sensor allows us as the hosts and you as the guests uphold the quiet and quaint values of this neighborhood. Should your group set off the noise monitor, you'll get a quick note from us letting you know. We want to avoid any issues that might escalate and risk losing our license

Upon booking all guests will be required to provide the full names and ages of all the guests staying staying on the property as well as the name and address of the person booking the property as per the Town of Fort Erie Short Term Rental Bylaws.
description.neighborhood: Beach is located directly across the street from this bright, completely renovated cottage in a friendly neighborhood. Sit on the front porch and watch the children at the playground with an unobstructive view of the brand new Crystal Beach illuminated sign. Perfect for pictures!
description.transit: Beaches, restaurants, shops all within walking distance. Grocery and incidental shopping just a short drive away
description.interaction: We will be available 24 hours a day through Airbnb messaging app
description.house_rules:
• Check in 3pm – Check out 11am 
• No Smoking/vaping in the house. Failure to abide will result in a $500 additional cleaning fee 
• Outdoor smoking must be a minimum of 10 feet away from the entire house. No illegal substances permitted on property 
• We respectfully ask that you treat our home with respect and consider it as your home away from home and remain considerate of the neighbours always. 
• Our cottage is in a residential area and local bylaws require quiet between the hours of 11pm to 8am. Any neighbor complaints will be addressed and any fines will be charged to the guest. 
 •The Renter whose name the reservation is made is responsible for the conduct of all those using or occupying the vacation property and/or its grounds throughout the duration of their stay. 
• No unregistered guests allowed. Any guests over the 8 registered guests must leave the property by 11pm. Failure to abide by this local bylaw will result in additional charges up to $1000 
• Please do not eat or drink in the bedrooms 
• Please pick up after your pets. Failure to comply will result in an additional $100 cleaning fee 
• Pets are not permitted on furniture or on beds. Additional cleaning fees will apply 
• Please take extra care of your Beach Passes. Lost Beach passes incurs a $100 replacement cost 
• Please take care of all furniture and furnishings. Guests will be charged for any replacement or damages to the property 
• No confetti or sparkles are permitted indoors or outdoors 
• Please clean up all your dishes. Dishwasher is available for guests use 
• Please leave all used towels in bathroom. Sheets and blankets can stay on bed
• Please leave all garbage outside the back at the end of your stay. Recycle and compost must all be in its proper containers outside. 
• Unfortunately cooking with curry is prohibited. This is a courtesy to the next guest coming in. 
• As part of the by-law, Fort Erie residents and visitors can burn recreational fires between 4pm and 11 p.m. only - this is strictly enforced 
• Please do not remove anything belonging to the home from property. Replacement costs will be charged for all or any missing items 
• Please report any damages or incidents as soon as possible through the Air BNB app 
Please contact us through Air BNB messaging app if you need anything at all during your stay!
Most importantly: RELAX AND ENJOY OUR BEACHSIDE ABODE!

recent.comments: We had a wonderful stay here! The place was stunning and clean, the location was great, and Nayem was communicative and helpful. Highly recommended. Would love to stay here again!

items.comments: We had a wonderful stay here! The place was stunning and clean, the location was great, and Nayem was communicative and helpful. Highly recommended. Would love to stay here again!

We had a great weekend stay at Nayem's place. Check-in was a breeze and we were even able to check in early. The house was spacious and well-maintained with modern decor. The bedrooms were big and we chose this place because the beds were either king- or queen-sized. Keep in mind the rooms in the basement can be a bit chilly given the size of the house. Nayem was very quick to respond whenever we had questions, which we really appreciated.

It was easy to switch into vacation mode upon entering the front foyer. We really loved and appreciated the fresh and minimalistic decorating and modern touches in the living room and bedrooms. A really relaxed, zen feel. The entire house was so well appointed, exceptionally clean, and spacious. Peaceful and private property, which was very well maintained, with a lovely manicured garden. Loved sitting under the maple trees, catching the warm breeze. Loved the hammock! The barbecue was in great shape - spotless. Nayem was a fabulous host who responded promptly to any questions that I had. He was very accommodating. We are already booking for another memorable stay! Highly recommended.
Beautiful place

Nayem was great always quick at responding and very flexible with our sitaution. The place was amazing my in-laws loved it. If you are looking for a wonderful place with lots of space for a  peaceful family getaway to enjoy I strongly recommend. I would love to book this space again in the future.

It was a gorgeous property for our group of 10 people.  Very clean and spacious.  The main floor bedroom arrangement worked very well for elderly members of our group.  The beds were very comfortable.
The house and property met all of our expectations.  The kitchen was spacious enough for all of us and the outdoor deck was a lovely space to sit and admire the surrounding orchards. 
We really enjoyed our stay!

We stayed at the Orchard Villa with 2 kids and 8 adults for the weekend. The listing was just as described and was very spacious inside and out, with lots of room for everyone. The location was close to the bench wineries and we also visited Niagara on the Lake while staying there. Nayem was very responsive and accommodating. We had a great time and would recommend the place to others!
Ariella

description.summary: Our Newly Updated, Prestigious Waterfront Estate with 2 houses on the property overlooks our sand beach on one of the nicest shorelines in Southern Ontario. The breathtaking lake views will help you forget your worries & truly disconnect. We can rent both houses to one group to accomodate all of your guests, with a maximum of 12 people. Some amenities include- high quality linens, comfortable mattresses, high speed internet, gas BBQ, paddle boards, & fully equipped Chef's kitchen. Pet friendly!
description.space:
When you walk into our home, you will be put at ease. It's open concept, clean and inviting. We updated the entire interior in June 2023 and it is now the perfect getaway. 
We have two fireplaces. One in the living space, and another in the lower bar area. The fireplace in the bunk house is just for decoration. 
Cozy up with a glass of wine and read a book while taking in the view of the lake.
We do have a fourth bedroom with 2 twin beds. Please inquire for further details on its availability.
description.access:
The driveway has parking for 4+ cars. 
You will have full, private access to the house. It is keyless and contactless entry. If you need anything during your stay, we will locally and are available to help in any way possible.
description.notes:
This home is a licensed short term rental and we look forward to hosting you and your family.
Licence # STR-000154 & STR-000172
No smoking inside the house. HST excluded in price.  

Minimum age requirement is 25 years old. 
We are happy to host your pet as well. Additional $75 fee for pets will be charged. 
Please  contact for other inquiries.
description.neighborhood: Our Waterfront property has lovely neighbours who tend to keep to themselves. Many of them have lived here happily for many years and are very friendly. It is a very quiet area. We are tucked back toward the waterfront, far from the road.
description.transit:
You can walk to almost everywhere, but biking and driving would be the fastest way to get around. 
We are minutes from the Friendship Trail, which is a long paved trail for walking, running, cycling, or rollerblading. Very close to the fun! Minutes from restaurants, shops & the beach!
description.interaction: We are only a message or call away. If you need anything before, during or after your stay, we pride ourselves on being very accessible, as we live locally.
description.house_rules: Please respect the home, neighbours and local rules. Quiet time for outside is after 10pm. Absolutely no parties allowed. There is an additional fee for pets to be approved in advance of $75. Damage and or theft to property, sheets, covers and furniture will be billed back; extra cleaning requirements, and garbage may also be billed. Please use the cabana towels for the hot tub. Do not use white indoor towels. If you have questions on how to operate the gas BBQ, please let me know. Thank you.

The kitchen & bathroom is modern, appointed with necessary supplies & CLEAN! Easy checkin, spacious, did I say CLEAN?, and a balcony with table & chairs for morning coffee or evening cocktails. I would highly recommend this wonderful place once again. Thank you Pamela & Gerard. See you in December!

description.summary: Just a few steps away from one of Buffalo’s liveliest neighborhoods, this newly renovated apartment has a retro-feel and modern amenities. Buffalo 180 is sophisticated with a hint of whimsy, combining  a craftsman style with fun, mid-century modern décor and vintage furniture. You’ll be tempted to linger but soon you'll be drawn to explore the wide array of unique restaurants, coffee shops, bars and boutiques, as well as the famous North Park Theatre. It’s the perfect buffalo getaway!
description.space:
Completely renovated in 2019, Buffalo 180’s modern conveniences and brand-new appliances are presented amid dozens of small and large touches that celebrate the craftsman home tradition, all the while giving homage to the much celebrated mid-century design movement. There is true-to-period craftsman trim on windows and doors throughout the apartment, including the bedrooms. Vintage furniture is a major attraction of this apartment, which features pieces from the 1950’s and 60’s including a stunning Montreal dresser, rosewood dining set, comfortable Morris chair, restored mid-century sofa, and classic nesting tables. Art also features prominently, with works by Joan Miro and Charles Birchfield, interesting pottery, knick-knacks and accents recalling the early to mid-twentieth century. 

From start to finish, we hope to make your stay at Buffalo 180 a journey of delight, touched by history, art and ease. When you arrive, a designated parking spot and keypad makes arrival simple. Then the stairs leading up the private entrance will take the guest past a series of photos celebrating Buffalo’s wonderful, historic landmarks. A replica of the once-celebrated Eames “hang-it-all” is available for your convenience – to hang your coat, hat or scarf.

Once within the apartment you will have a living room, dining room, kitchen and bathroom for all guests to share. Then there are two bedrooms with queen beds and a third room which can either be a bedroom or a quiet place to read or work. 

The living room is graced with a cross-beam ceiling and built-in bookcases around a fireplace (non-working).  An eclectic set of knick-knacks and pottery grace the shelves, with a few books and games mixed in for when you need a diversion. The Miro prints grace the walls along with a colorful midcentury-style clock inspired by designer A. Cerco. The furniture is stylish yet practical for leaning back and enjoying a movie on the flat-screen smart tv mounted above the fireplace. The tv is set up for you to easily access free Netflix movies, or you can access a wide number of other apps for which you might have an account.  

The dining room also presents a mixture of stylish elegance and comfort, featuring a gorgeous, vintage mid-century modern dining table in rosewood paired with a matching serving table. The dining table is surrounded by a set of 6 upholstered chairs in an not-often-seen floral design. The three walls feature wainscoting that match the door and window trim, and a Sputnik chandelier is the grand centerpiece. As if to add some humor, in the corner sits a ceramic vase converted into a floor lamp, adding both an artsy flair and a bit more illumination. 

Black-and-white mosaic tile provides the exclamation mark to a bright kitchen with a peninsula, white cabinets, brass designer handles, a granite countertop, and two distinctive craftsman-style light fixtures. Aesthetics aside, this cozy kitchen has ample, quality cooking tools and equipment, basic ingredients, spices, serving-wear and more all within easy reach, making cooking a delight. Brand-new high quality appliances include a double-oven, glass cooktop, full-size refrigerator with water and ice dispenser, and ultra-quiet dishwasher. A microwave and Keurig coffee maker are also available for your convenience. A teapot and drip coffee maker are also stored with a range of other small appliances, including a blender.

The bathroom is larger than typical for houses of this period and features a modern walk-in shower. A custom barn-door can be securely closed for privacy with a matching, custom-made door lock. A teak spa stool and plenty of shelving to store your toiletries make this a comfortable and functional space.

Bedrooms are comfortable and inviting, each simply decorated with art pieces and plump, colorful pillows. Each bedroom has ample storage, and all the bedroom doors can be locked.  Bedroom 1 has a walk-in closet and contains the vintage Montreal dresser. On the walls of the bedroom there are two locally-produced, limited edition prints of sketches of prominent Buffalo landmarks. Bedroom 2 has prints of Charles Birchfield, a famous Western New York artist. If you like his works, be sure to check out the Birchfield Penny Art Gallery on the Buffalo State College Campus. 

The third bedroom has a comfy day bed and mid-century modern desk that can also be used as a vanity. The bookshelf contains typical office supplies as well as diversions from work, like entertaining books and puzzles to feed the minds of guest both young and more mature! (A bigger selection of board games is stored in the living room cabinets.)

In warmer weather, a large balcony provides a birds-eye view of the street and a relaxing place to socialize or have a drink.
description.access: There is one parking space reserved for guests on the left side of the driveway.
description.neighborhood:
Buffalo 180 is located in the heart of the Hertel Avenue district, and the neighborhood begs to be explored. You don’t need a car to reach dozens of unique restaurants, coffee shops, bar or boutiques – many are within a 5-10 minute walk. A wide range of dining options are available, and to help you choose, we have put together our own collection of original restaurant reviews which will be available when you arrive! 

Right in the neighborhood is the North Park Theatre, considered to be the crown jewel of Hertel Avenue. This 100 year-old movie house has been restored to its former glory. With its elegant neoclassic foyer and auditorium, along with six Art Nouveau murals, North Park Theatre’s interior rivals some of America’s best opera houses. Current releases stand alongside art films and classics.

Other cultural and historic gems are just over a mile away from Buffalo 180, including not just one, but two houses designed by the iconic architect Frank Lloyd Wright: the Walter Davidson House and the Darwin Martin House (tours available). You can also visit the latest exhibits of the Buffalo Zoo, the third oldest zoo in the United States, and stroll through nearby Delaware Park, designed by the renowned landscape architect Frederick Law Olmsted.

Other amenities within walking distance:
Two locally-owned grocery markets
Pharmacy
Gym
description.transit:
Walking:
It's easy to leave your car in the driveway for days at a time and just walk when you want food, entertainment and recreation. 

Car:
There is an array of car services, including taxis as well as Uber and Lyft. Taxis are plentiful at the airport but not on the city streets nearby Buffalo 180, so you would have to call one of many services available.

By car you can reach downtown Buffalo and Canalside, our newly developed waterfront district, in less than 20 minutes. Reach Niagara Falls State Park in 30 minutes. 

Public Transportation: 
NFTA Metro Bus and Rail (NFTA stands for Niagara Frontier Transit Authority). 

Airport:
The Buffalo Niagara International Airport is conveniently located, connected mostly be thruway.
For traveling to or from Buffalo 180:
- via car, it can be less than a 20 minute drive if traffic is light.
- via public transportation, it will take just over an hour.
description.interaction: Something amiss? Let us know. Text or call!
description.house_rules:
Thank you for taking the time to read the House Rules. Please share with all adults who will be staying in the apartment. 

Overall, we ask that you please be gentle and respectful of the apartment as well as the neighborhood around you.  Please remember someone lives downstairs and that this is a residential neighborhood. We have put a lot of care and attention to making this a wonderful place to stay, and hope to keep it that way for all future guests. 

Don'ts
- No parties or events allowed. 
- No candles or open flames
- No trash should ever go in the toilet, including feminine products, wipes, condoms, and wrappers. The toilet is a terrible trash can because if it doesn't like what you flush, it may give it back to you. Use the bathroom trash can instead. 

Do's
- Close doors and doors gently (especially the sliding barn door)
- Use the coasters we have provided for your glasses and mugs. 
- Use the towel racks and hooks for your wet towels. (Basically, do not put anything wet on furniture or beds. )
- Put trash and recycling in the designated bins, which are in a pull-drawer net to the sink in the kitchen. 
- When using the shower, curtains should cover the window to prevent water damage.  
- Please observe quiet hours after 9 pm.
- When checking out, please follow the check-list (See below).

When to contact us:
- Let us know as soon as possible of any spills, breakage, problems, etc. so that we can get things back in order as soon as possible.  
- Please let us know if there is any exposure or symptoms of Covid-19, or any other sickness, so that I may also notify my tenants and we may practice appropriate social distancing, etc. 

You will find other helpful information about the apartment, including some of its "quirks", in the house manual located in the kitchen.  (For example, learn how not to get sprayed by water when using the fridge dispenser, how not to get burned on the stovetop!) 

Check out procedures:
- Used towels may be left on hooks or racks, or put in the laundry basket in the walk-in closet. Please do not leave damp towels laying on bed or furniture. 
- If you used the kitchen, please clean up any dirty dishes and start the dishwasher or leave to dry in drying rack. Discard any food that may spoil.  
- General tidying is appreciated.    
- If you were using the heating system, please return the thermostat to 60 degrees. If you were using the cooling system, please put the thermostat to 75. 
- If you opened any windows, please close them.
- Turn off lights. 
- Return both apartment keys to key hook.

recent.comments: Such a great place for families! Beautiful surroundings, plenty of room for everyone. Close enough to explore  but private enough to relax! Definitely a 10/10 stay!

items.comments: Such a great place for families! Beautiful surroundings, plenty of room for everyone. Close enough to explore  but private enough to relax! Definitely a 10/10 stay!

The house has 6 bedrooms with beds that sleep 2 and 1 room with bunk beds. A lot of space and great deck and comfortable outdoor furniture. The green egg grill is an added bonus. We didn’t have a need for the kids play room but there was a sunroom with kids’ toys and high chairs available. 
The house has it’s own challenges but you get to experience a 200 year old house with modern twist. If you are into historical dwellings this house should give you a kick. The hosts make everything possible to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Given that it’s an old house be prepared to see AC units in the windows but we stayed at the end of July and only needed to use them one night. The bedding looks new and clean. Plenty of towels and the kitchen is fully stocked. 
The house rules are strict but fare in my opinion. Since it is located on an active farm the hosts do need to make sure that their property is protected and guests respect their labor.

The farmhouse was PERFECT for our family of 9!  We had plenty of space to all be together, and plenty of space to also have some time apart. There were more than enough towels, dishes, and silverware for our large group. The kitchen was great for us to cook in. We even were able to add an extra chair so we could all fit at the table for family meals. 

I loved being on the farm. It was so peaceful and quiet and having coffee on the back deck was one of my favorite things to do each morning while enjoying the scenery and wildlife. 

Everything we needed was within 15-20 minutes, including making it to the Falls. It was a great vacation and the farmhouse played a major role in that. Thank you, Jacque!

We enjoyed our stay here.  Everything was as described and the location was well placed for dinner in Lewiston, hikes on the U.S. side, Canadian falls, and Porter park nearby.  It was a good time hanging out on the patio, grilling on the green egg, and the everyone enjoyed having the chickens on the property.

Thanks!

description.space: We can accommodate a maximum of 14; beds for additional kids are for kids/infants- please inquire before your stay.  We have 7 bedrooms, one of which is located on the first floor along with one full bathroom, our large family room and attached sunroom.   The other 6 are located on the second floor with the second full bathroom. There are 2 staircases to the second floor, one off the kitchen (narrow) and the other in the foyer (spiral). There are also steps coming into the house through the side door and the patio to access the back of the house.
description.access:
Farmhouse- Entire home
You may park in front of the garage (on the side of the house). Upon arrival you will notice that Farmhouse Gardens is located next to our family farm. Please be sure to only park next to the house.  The driveway leading to Cornerstone Farm is off limits. This is a working farm and there are trucks moving around daily.  We appreciate your cooperation!
There will be a keypad on the side door to access the house. The code will be given 24hrs before arrival. 
This house is not wheelchair accessible.
Since our home is located on a fully working farm, we ask you keep to the house and immediate backyard. 

Check in/out:
-check in 11am
-check out 3pm sharp
-guests are required to bring all bedding down to the laundry room when leaving and empty out the fridge and freezer.  Please take anything that you brought upon your arrival. 
-When leaving please turn off all electronics, the AC units and turn down the heat to 65 degrees and lock all the doors.
-Please take out all trash upon departure.
description.notes:
Heat: There 2 thermostats one in the family room (operates the first floor) and one in the master bedroom (which controls the upstairs). There is also a wood burning fireplace that requires wood. (wood is located across the fireplace in the family room) The instructions are located next to the unit on how to start it. If you do decide to use the wood fireplace, please don’t use the thermostats. If you have questions, please contact us.

Cool: Each bedroom is fitted with an AC unit. You may adjust each room to your liking. We ask that you don’t turn the units too low and please don’t keep them running while you are away from the house. 
Please feel free to use our patio and firepit during your stay. The wood for the firepit is located next to the black building off the porch and matches are in the kitchen. We ask that you please use caution while using the firepit and don’t leave a fire unattended. 

Refrigerator & Dishwasher: 
The refrigerator will be empty and clean for your arrival.  We ask that you please take or throw away anything when you depart.  You’re welcome to use the dishwasher.  The pods and other cleaning supplies are located under the sink. 

Coffee Machine:
We have a Kureig for your use. There are also some K-cups for your enjoyment. 

Big Green Egg:
Feel free to use our egg.  Directions on how to use will be in our guestbook.  We will not provide any charcoal, there will be wood available.

House rules:
- no smoking
- no pets allowed
- do not touch or feed chickens
-please respect our home and the employees working
-do not wander the property without our consent 
-our septic system is very old, please do not flush anything that is not human waste or toilet paper.
-Do not eat or drink in the bedrooms.
-Don’t touch any heavy machinery- Tractors, trucks, fruit bins or any other farm equipment.
-Don’t go on the left side of the property where the Conerstone farm buildings are located.
-Don’t pick any fruit
-Do not have any parties with any unregistered quests.
-Do not take anything that does not belong to you.
-Please leave the house in the same condition you found it.

Security: 
We do have cameras on our property for our safety and for yours.

Security deposit:
- A security deposit will be made when you book with us. This will not be a part of the price or your stay and will be returned to you after your checkout to make sure there wasn't any damage to the property. 

Trash and recycling:
 -Bins are located outside by the garage. The trash is picked up weekly on Thursdays and every other week for the recycling on Thursdays.  We ask that you dispose of all your trash and recycling (from the kitchen and bathrooms) in their bins upon your departure.
description.neighborhood: rural country
description.transit: This is a fully working farm.  We are on a large piece of land and we ask that you do not wonder past the fire pit and greenhouse. There will always be employees working on the property.  We ask you leave them to their work and do not pick any fruit with out our consent.
description.interaction: please feel free to contact me, Jacque, with any questions or concerns.
description.house_rules:
Other things to note: 
House Rules- Please feel free to share these house rules with all of the guests on this reservation. 
1. Shoes- Please remove shoes when entering the house in our mudroom.
2. Garbage- please take all trash outside to the cans. Please do not leave excessive garbage outside or in the house.
3. Food/Beverage- Do not food or drinks into the bedrooms.  We do allow you to bring any food or beverages you would like, but everything brought into the house must be taken upon departure. 
4. Luggage- Please use caution when bringing in bags, carry them instead of dragging across the wood flooring. 
5. Mail- Please do not touch any mail that is delivered to the property and do not have any mail delivered to property. 
6. Noise- Please be respectful of our neighbors and workers on the property.  This is also a fully working farm.
7. Check- in- 3pm check out is a firm 11am.  Unfortunately, due to new covid cleaning protocols, we can not accommodate late checkout requests. (if there is an unknown circumstance that pops up, please contact us immediately) if this is not respected, we will charge a late check out fee of $50 every 30 minuets past 11am.
8. Lock the house- Please be sure to leave all the doors locked upon departure. 
9. Drugs & Alcohol- NO drugs are allowed on the property.  Any drugs found will result immediate termination of your stay without a refund. If alcohol is brought onto the property the guest(s) consuming the alcohol must be 21 years old or older.  Any guest(s) caught drinking under age on our property will be asked to leave immediately without a refund. 
10. Parties- No parties are allowed on the proterty Only guests of the booking are allowed on the property. If additional guests are at the house, we will immediately terminate your reservation without a refund. 
11. Children/infants- This is a family home and kids are always welcome.  Please let the host know if you will need a pack n play or highchair for your stay.
12. Smoking- This is a NO smoking house, but is permitted outside. 
13. Animals- No pets are allowed on the property.  We do have chickens and don't want any unfortunate accidents. 
14. Cleaning- Please clean up after yourself and leave all spaces exactly as you found them.  Please do not rearrange furniture, art, or anything else.  You may incur an extra cleaning fee if the house is left dirty or in disarray.  We would also like all the towels and sheets to be brought down to the laundry room before you leave the premises. 
15. Toilets- Please do not flush anything down the toilets, aside from toilet paper. We have a sensitive septic system. If you cause a plumbing issue, you will incur the cost. 
16. Decorating- Please avoid taping or pinning anything to the walls and or ceiling. 
17. This is a farm- As you can tell from our photos, this is a working farm.  We do ask that if you walk around the property that you are respectful to our staff and our trees.  Please do not pick or climb any of our trees.  
18. External sheds- Please do not enter any of the sheds on the property.  They contain heavy machinery.  Any trespassing will result in immediate termination of trip without a refund.  
19. Chickens- Please do not touch or feed any of the chickens on the property.  
They will be let out to graze throughout the day and will put back at the end of each day by our farm staff.
20. Extra guests: We are usually do not like more than 12 guests per visit, unless you have children, then we are more flexible.  If you have a larger group that needs to be accommodated, there will be an extra fee involved. If extra guests are found on the property that haven't been verified by us, you will asked to leave immediately without a refund.

hosts.about:
Meet your local hosts: Jason and Elsie Mae at Niagara Holiday Rentals

Niagara-on-the-lake (NOTL) was voted one of Canada’s prettiest little towns and is located just a short drive from Niagara Falls, along the scenic Niagara River Parkway. Niagara Holiday Rentals is a local short-term vacation rental management company exclusive to Old Town Niagara-on-the-Lake!

-Outstanding scenery
-Distinct charm of a heritage district
-Unique shopping
-Award-winning wineries and restaurants
-World-class performances at the Shaw Festival Theatre

Niagara-on-the-Lake is an idyllic place to gather and connect or make a new memory or tradition.

Niagara Holiday Rentals has outstanding vacation rentals to suit every visitor, from one to up to 10 guests. We want all of our guests to feel like locals and love it just as much as we do. Come and stay with us and love the NOTL experience!

Jason and Elsie Mae own and run Niagara Holiday Rentals that manages 25 vacation rental properties in Niagara-on-the-Lake, since 2004. All our vacation homes and cottages are in Old Town, minutes from Queen Street.

We have been coming to Niagara-on-the-Lake since our honeymoon. A lot has changed, but we love it now more than ever. Jason is a real estate salesperson specializing in vacation, second home and investment properties. Elsie Mae is an accredited sommelier. She can let you know about the local wineries and wine industry. 

We enjoy a variety of activities in Niagara-on-the-Lake, from the local wineries and craft breweries to the Shaw Festival, as well as the parks and outdoor activities that the region has to offer.

We love finding new and exciting things to do in and around town, send us a message, we'd love to chat about your holiday plans!

All of the Niagara Holiday Rentals properties are licenced and insured as vacation rentals in the Town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. Niagara Holiday Rentals is registered with the Travel Industry Council of Ontario and complies with the Ontario Travel Regulations.

recent.comments: Great location. Great house. We had everything we needed just a short walk from town. Would definitely recommend for families or groups who want to be near to NOTL.

items.comments: Great location. Great house. We had everything we needed just a short walk from town. Would definitely recommend for families or groups who want to be near to NOTL.

All was quite nice and as advertised. If I had a negative it was the over communication and what seemed like duplicate emails. I think you should share info with Niagara rentals or whoever as it became confusing until I was told info wasn’t shared.

I mentioned to somebody about small issues with trying to unlock the front door. We ended up mainly using the garage and the code. If the front door isn’t fixed, the handle will eventually pull off. 

All in all it is a wonderful place and we had a great visit. I’m sure we will return.
 
WH Spadafora
Great stay but the 10AM checkout is difficult!!

This vacation property is in the heart of NOTL with a beautiful open concept living area. Modern, spacious with the bedrooms in a quieter area of the home. Loved the kitchen and fireplace. Well appointed decor. We were able to walk to the main shopping area and restaurants. Lots of parking for our 3 vehicles. Would stay here again and recommend to others.
Went here for a girls getaway and it was a fantastic location. Very close distance to shops and restaurants. Cute neighbourhood and great house over all. Highly recommend!
Great property! The location is a 10. It was very clean and well equipped and the whole process was seamless.
Loved this Airbnb! It's gorgeous, clean, close to town. I'm so glad we booked here!

description.summary: Open Concept Living at its Best
description.space:
Peaks on Gate is a modern home that isn't out of place in the heritage and charm of Niagara-on-the-Lake. It features a unique peaked tower in the centre of the main living area. Prices are subject to change daily.

-3 Bedrooms – 3 Queen beds
-5 Bathrooms – Walk-in shower ensuite, tub shower combination ensuites, and 2 half baths
-Hosts up to 6 guests (including infants and children)
-Private parking for up to 4 vehicles, contactless check in
-Gas fireplace, central heating, and air conditioning
-High speed WiFi and TV with cable and access to streaming services

The great room includes the large kitchen with large island for prep:

-Drip-coffee maker and kettle with enough coffee, tea, and sugar to get you started
-Stove, oven, fridge, microwave, toaster, and dishwasher
-Dishes, pots and pans, silverware and glasses (including wine glasses)  
-Non-stick spray, paper towels, dish soap, tea towels, dish cloths
-Salt and pepper

The living room and dining room are also in the space with a gas fireplace and cable TV. Everyone can gather during meal prep, help out, talk and spend time together with family and friends.

The grand foyer showcases a desk with pamphlets and free wine tasting coupons to plan your stay.

The first floor includes a bedroom with queen sized bed, flat screen tv, walk-in closet and glass shower ensuite.

The outdoor area is conveniently located on a deck off the kitchen and is a great gathering space to enjoy and relax. Backyard is fully fenced with lots of space for children to play and there is an additional deck off the foyer.

Upstairs has 2 more queen bedrooms with ensuites and a games room/TV room separating the two bedrooms for privacy. A bonus room in the basement is an ideal playroom for the kids while you relax.

Laundry is on site stocked with:

-Laundry soap, stain remover and dryer sheets
 
Bedding, towels, hair dryer, facial and toilet tissue, shampoo, and hand soap are also provided.
The neighbourhood is in the Old Town on the edge of the historic district. You can park your cars and stroll to Queen St or the Waterfront, then kick back and relax for a nice meal then walk home.

The architect that inspired this home is Hugh Newel Jacobsen. This vacation home is a modern nod to minimalist living and ensuring the convenience of easy living. Open spaces, good acoustics, and easy maintenance.

Peaks on Gate Street Cottage is a licensed short-term rental in the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. Lic # 040-2022.

We have a high standard for our homes and the housekeeping staff.
 
-Hand sanitizer pump at each property (70% alcohol)
-Disinfecting of soft surfaces with an alcohol-based disinfectant
-Additional attention to disinfecting frequently touched surfaces
-Disinfecting of the mattress, mattress cover, pillows, and pillow protectors with alcohol-based disinfectant

Fine Print:
- The person who booked and paid is the primary guest and is responsible for the actions of other house guests. The primary guest must be staying for every night of the booking.
- For insurance purposes the primary guest must be 25 years or older.
- No more than 6 people including all children. Names of every house guest (including children) must be provided. This information is required to comply with the town by-laws.
- No overnight street parking is allowed in the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake.
- No smoking or vaping of tobacco, marijuana or any similar product whose use generates smoke or vapors within the house. Any lingering aromas or smells after your stay will result in additional cleaning charges.
- No pets allowed.
description.access: This property features self-check-in, no keys required.  Guests have access to the whole house.

description.neighborhood:
Peaks on Gate Street Cottage is located in the heart of Niagara-on-the-Lake HIstoric Old Town, just a short walk to Queen Street.  As the first capital of Upper Canada, Niagara-on-the Lake has lots of history.  We have beautiful scenery and historic homes.  Located at the mouth of the Niagara River we have both riverfront and lakefront trails, parks and beaches and water sports.  If you love theatre, you have come to the right place!  The Shaw Festival runs from April to October plus the Christmas productions in November and December.

Our The community pool is located a 10 min walk away and is open from mid-June to Labour Day weekend weather permitting. (Note there is a daily fee, paid upon entry, for the pool.)
description.transit: On-site parking for 4 cars is included.  The house is short walk from Niagara-on-the-Lake's main street - Queen Street.
description.interaction: We live close by and are available if needed.  An emergency contact number will be provided at check-in.
description.house_rules:
It is the responsibility of the guest making the booking to read and understand the following terms and conditions and to ensure that all other guests are also aware of and adhere to these terms. 

If you have any questions in regard to these policies, please contact one of our travel specialists Niagara Holiday Rentals, prior to booking.

Check-in time is after 4:00 PM and Check-out time is by 10:30 AM

-If there are any issues, breaks or malfunctions let us know as soon as possible so that we may address the issue during your stay.

-Bed linens and towels are provided.

-For your added convenience, we start you off with coffee, tea, sugar, salt & pepper, cooking spray and a basic supply of foil, paper towels, toilet tissue, hand soap, dish/dishwasher soap, laundry and fabric softener and cleaning supplies. You are responsible for any additional requirements during your stay. (There is a drip coffee maker in the house.)

-Housekeeping is not included during your stay. Arrangements may be made in advance for an additional charge.

Travel Documents and Insurance

Additional Information for travelers from outside Ontario

Documentation Requirements

-Canadians living outside of Ontario may require out of province health coverage. 
-Non-Canadians traveling to Ontario require travel documents. Entry into Canada could be denied without the appropriate travel documents, which could include passports and visas.
-Due to the COVID-19 Pandemic, additional documentation and testing may be required to enter Canada, please see the Government of Canada website for further details prior to departure. 
-Please note that entry into Canada may be refused even if the required information and travel documents are complete.

Although we do not sell insurance, we highly recommend the purchase of trip cancellation insurance and travel health insurance for any travel. Please contact your insurance provider.


Terms and Conditions of Occupancy

1. The primary guest making the booking must be at least 25 years of age to rent a vacation home. We require the full name of those staying at the house overnight and we also require vehicle information for any vehicles parking on the premises. Please note that there are restrictions on the number of guests and vehicles allowed at each property and all vehicles must only park in designated areas.

2. Reservations are not transferable. The person who made the reservation must stay for the full duration of the booking.
 
3. These are private homes in residential neighbourhoods and not venues for large parties, commercial functions, weddings, bachelor / bachelorette parties, graduation parties, rehearsal dinners or BBQ/grill for large gatherings. Each house has a cap on number of people permitted to be on the property at one time.

4. Only registered guests are permitted to use any of the amenities of the vacation home. If not adhered to, you and your traveling companions will be asked to vacate the property without a refund.

5. No-smoking: No guest or visitor shall smoke Marijuana or other tobacco cigarettes, cigars, electronic cigarettes, or any similar product whose use generates smoke or vapors within the house. This prohibition includes all balconies and patios, enclosed common areas, as well as outside within 9 meters of doorways, operable windows, and air intakes. There will be a minimum surcharge of $500.00 for any smoke related clean-up.
 
6. Parking: Number of vehicles is limited to the parking spaces available at each vacation home. Please park only in designated parking areas on the property. Over night street parking is not allowed. 
 
7. Only guests registered to the house at time of booking are permitted to stay and use any amenities of the vacation home.
 
8. The person booking accepts full responsibility for any and all damages or losses inflicted upon the house, its contents and/or property.

9. The Property Owners and Management are not responsible nor liable for accidents, injury or illness to guests, or damage to or loss of personal property of any kind. Guests are solely responsible for the safety and security of all persons in the house, including children, and pets, at all times during the rental period.

10. Quiet Enjoyment: No person shall make noise so as to cause a disturbance or conduct themselves in a way that is likely to disturb area residents. The noise by-law prohibits sound or vibration at any time, which is likely to disturb the quiet, peace, rest, enjoyment, comfort, or convenience of the inhabitants of the Town.  

11. In case of personal injury, emergency, or fire call 911 on house phone (if available). Address of home is on the blue welcome card. During a fire, use fire extinguishers if possible, without harm to yourself.

12. Garbage cans are located outside, as well as blue and grey boxes for recycling. We take the garbage and recyclables to roadside before 7:00 am on Friday. Please ensure garbage and recycling is sorted and taken to the outside storage bins on Thursday evening and prior to your departure.

13. Before leaving, double check that you have not left any personal items behind. Call us if you have forgotten something and you want it shipped back to you at your expense. 

14. House Maintenance: Your home is professionally cleaned and disinfected prior to your arrival.

- While we don’t expect you to dust, scrub toilets or vacuum on your holiday, we would ask you to please keep the house clean and tidy (as it was when you arrived). Cleaning up spills immediately protects the finish, and keeping the kitchen clean prevents little critters from feasting on your leftovers. Only use appliances for their intended uses. If the vacation home requires more than normal cleaning after your stay, you will be assessed the additional cost.

- Please help us maintain the home in a good and clean condition by following these simple procedures during your stay and at departure:

     -Place all soiled towels in the bathtub or shower
     -Run the dishwasher with soiled dishes prior to checking out
     -Dispose of all waste materials into specific bins outside as instructed upon arrival.
     -Please clean countertops and stove top of any spills or sticky residue
     -Please do not rearrange furniture in the house. Outdoor furniture stays outside, Indoor furniture stays inside! You may be assessed an additional cost to your stay if furniture is damaged from being inappropriately treated or the additional time to put furniture back in its designated spot.

15. Odours - Please refrain from cooking foods or creating aromas that linger beyond your stay. If the odours remain and result in relocating the guests coming in after your same day departure, you will be assessed the cost to relocate for one night. Strong aromatic foods can be cooked outside on the grill/BBQ.
Niagara Holiday Rentals reserves the right to enter the premises to perform maintenance and ensure the vacation home is kept in good repair.

16. Report all maintenance issues promptly. Just as might happen at your own well-maintained home, mechanical failures, disruption of services and other breakdowns can occur. Every effort will be made to correct the situation; however, no refunds or rate adjustments will be made for mechanical and service failures that are beyond our control. Report any damage or breakage upon occurrence so the matter can be settled before departure. Damages found by inspection crews upon departure will be billed and full payment for repairs will be collected via credit card.

17. If bedding and or towels are stained, please do not attempt to clean, this may set the stain. Please let us know as soon as possible and definitely before your departure.  

18. Locked owners' closets are not included in your rental. (If found unlocked, please refrain from taking out additional items or supplies.) Garages do not have guaranteed access for guests. Most are for owner usage only and are not included in your rental.

19. If you are in a vacation home with a sofa sleeper, these are best suited for children and may be uncomfortable for adults.  

20. Slipper Policy (if slippers are provided): To protect the floors & carpets, guests are asked to please remove their shoes inside the house. Slippers are provided. (Persons with disabilities are exempt). 

21. If pet friendly, we allow one small dog with prior confirmation at time of booking. No additional animals are allowed on the property at any time. Pets should not be allowed to be on the beds or furniture. Please do not leave pets unattended for long periods and do not allow your dog to keep bark continuously inside or out.
-There is an additional pet fee of $100 that will be added to your reservation after booking
-Only one small dog allowed.
-Pets must be at least 1 year old.
-If damage is caused, the cost of the damage or additional cleaning required will be taken from your damage deposit and/or charged to your credit card.
-Please pick up after your pet. Any pet waste not picked up will incur an additional clean up charge.

22. If the home has a wood burning fireplace, only fabricated fire logs are permitted. Use only one log at a time, it will last 2 to 3 hours. Do not use wood even if available. Do not use twigs or scrub brush. Chimney fires are always a concern. Fabricated logs burn cleanly, and the cleaners do not have to worry about hot coals when they come in after you depart. Some fireplaces have been labeled do not use. These have chimney’s that have been blocked off.

23. Absolutely no fireworks or outdoor fires are permitted on the premises.

24. Loss or damage: We reserve the right to charge for any loss or damage etc. assessed upon departure. If extra cleaning or sanitizing is required over and above what would be considered normal wear and tear, a minimum fee of $500 fee will be charged to cover these extra costs.

25. During your stay we may have some maintenance work done on the outside of the home such as mowing, trimming, cleaning BBQ/grill, tidying up patio and pool/pond maintenance (if applicable). 

26. The continued growth of our area is evidenced by new construction that may be adjacent to or near existing vacation rental properties. We regret any inconvenience but cannot control these situations. Refunds or relocations cannot be considered 

27. Telephone (if available) International calls outside North America, made during your visit will be charged to the credit card number provided at the time of your reservation. Any additional pay per view or cable TV charges will also be charged.  

28. Guests must be aware of and adhere to all Niagara-on-the-Lake by-laws, including Noise (By-law 4588-12) and Public Nuisances (By-law 4397-10 &4397A-11). Any fines levied as a result of a complaint during your stay will be charged to the primary guest. You must also ensure that every person being accommodated is complying with any applicable restrictions on the size of social gatherings and organized public events. 

We understand that you are on vacation and realize that the above may seem strict, but many of these policies are meant to ensure safe enjoyment for yourself and your guests, but also to reduce wear and tear on the home and ensure the quiet enjoyment of neighbours.
Failure to comply with any of the above or for any reason determined by Niagara Holiday Rentals, will result in you and your guests immediately vacating the vacation home. If you are requested to vacate before your scheduled departure date as a result of not complying with the Terms and Conditions of Occupancy, you are not entitled to any refunds.

Your vacation rental home is privately owned by a Homeowner and managed by Niagara Holiday Rentals,
