recent.comments: Amazing stay.

items.comments: Amazing stay.
Great place. Beautiful seclusion. We appreciated the quality and effort Tom went to put this together. He was very responsive when we had any questions. Thank you Tom.

This was a wonderful getaway!  The house was very quiet and peaceful!  The hot tub was just what the Dr ordered after a day on the slopes!  We had fun playing pool and  there is even a sauna and darts.  I would recommend the Labrador Lodge!
Tom did a great job with initial walk through. Great location for all ages, perfect for large family gathering. Thanks Tom.

Had my birthday weekend here and it was absolutely perfect. Just what we wanted, secluded and relaxing. The pond was super clean, the property itself had so much to do and the hottub was a great add on along with the game room. Tom showed us how to use everything, wood burning fireplaces, hottub settings, etc. He let us check in early so we could spend the whole day there too. Highly recommend this spot for a good get away
gorgeous cabin in a great location, the pond is beautiful + very blue, plus adorable farm animals!

description.summary: Lab Lodge as we call it, is also knows as Labrador Lodge Arcade, is an upscale log home and hunting lodge great for gatherings, small weddings. Close to ski resorts and snowmobile trails, Golf courses . Good for family with children to enjoy the pond for a swim or just lay on the grass for some sun, play games outdoors and enjoy the outdoors. Firewood  for outdoor fires  is available for purchase.
description.space:
Pool room, gourmet kitchen, hot tub room, horse shoes games, basketball net,  fire pits, front deck area with plenty of space to hang out. 

Large pond area good for swimming, laying down in the sun, play games outdoors, walking trails.

Staff is usually on property doing maintenance on other near by property if you need anything, But privacy assured.
description.access: Main house, outside hot tub room, pond area, walking trails. outside perimeter of barn where sheep, roosters and chickens reside.
description.notes: Pond for swimming and fishing, lots of hiking trails. Also great for small to med size weddings.
description.neighborhood: Property is very secluded, neighbors are far from the log home, Property is far into the woods, NOT visible from the road, long driveway is unique that takes you to the back through the wood area then opens up to a beautiful log home.
description.transit:
Close to  town for grocery shopping, golf and ski resorts.

It is recommended for guest to do a google search on the area to locate groceries stores and other point of interests before booking.
description.interaction: Privacy assured,  Someone on call to answer any questions and some times on property grounds doing maintenance and working on the gardens.
description.house_rules:
Host or Co-host will give you a tour of the house as well as a brief reminder of the house rules and some guidelines to follow.

SMOKING: No Smoking inside Lodge. Use ash trays to dispose of cigarette butts or other substances properly and not on property grounds.

HOT TUB: No glass allow. Additional fee will be charge If need to be empty out due to broken glass, foreign substance, etc. Or if extra maintenance is needed.

CANS AND BOTTLES: New York state law allows for bottle and cans to be returned, is is recommended that all guest separate all plastic bottles and aluminum cans in separate bags.
In the summer time there are garbage cans labelled for returnable an garbage. 

BEDS/LINENS: Leave as is after use, they are changed with fresh clean sheets for next guest.

TOWELS: All used towels leave in laundry room for cleaning crew. 

WINTER SEASON: Fire places will keep and maintain home warm once is up to temperature, all windows and doors need to be maintain close at all times for temperature to stay levelled. 

SUMMER: Same rules apply for doors and windows as in Winter season, portable A/C unit is installed during warmer days during the summer, basement is cool and comfortable all summer long.

BARN AREA: The property houses two Sheep, Gloria and Herman as well as a few roosters and chickens, the inside of the barn is off limits but the animals can be pet or watch from outside the fenced area, sheep love apples an the chickens love bread. 

PARTIES AND EVENTS RULES: Small gatherings only, larger events is a the discretion of owner, amount of guests allow only for what it was book for and no extra or un-authorized guest, unless pay the extra guest fee accordingly and is approve by host.

Any heavy equipment or motorize machine is off limits, that includes the golf cart which is housed in the barn.

Certain cabinets are off limits, hence locks on them, laundry room is accessible if any wash needs to be done, anything else in that room is off limits.

hosts.about: I am a mother of 3. My husband and I love to travel. We are always looking for new adventures. We are relaxed and only require a comfy bed a shower and coffee in the morning. We do not smoke and will treat your home like our own. Just give us instructions and we will follow them.

recent.comments: I loved Samantha’s  house. master bedroom, bath we’re great… pool and hot tub water clean and it was peaceful… thx for having us.

items.comments: I loved Samantha’s  house. master bedroom, bath we’re great… pool and hot tub water clean and it was peaceful… thx for having us.
The pictures do not do this hime and property justice. It is gorgeous, quite and relaxing. We had 8 adults and it worked perfectly. I highly recommend

Family (7 adults/3 young adults) reunited/stayed at Samantha’s awesome home for our 50th Wedding Anniversary at The Country Cottage in Darien. While our party was memorable, Samantha’s house capped off the weekend. Something to do for everyone, pool table/table tennis, heated swimming pool, fire pits, outside lounging & coffee on the deck in the mornings. Perfect number of beds & baths. Definitely coming back next for family reunion.

Well designed layout. Their home is more impressive in person than the pictures show. Samantha was easy to work with. Clear instructions. Great size rooms along with comfortable beds. I now have finished basement envy and my wife has kitchen 'walk in pantry' envy...lol. 

Plenty of room for visiting family to sit and relax. The patio hot tub was easy to use and at the perfect temperature. 2 washing machines and 2 dryers...couldn't ask for anything more. The deer were walking right up to the house and almost looking in the windows. Plenty of wild life to see. I would love to return in the summer and walk the trails.
Great house
This house is absolutely beautiful and did not disappoint, Samantha was an amazing host as well! Would definitely recommend this house to anyone looking to stay in the Buffalo / Alden area.
Absolutely beautiful home.....a nice secluded place for a reunion.  The home was very clean and owner responded well to anything we needed. Only drawback was bees and/or wasps on the back patio

description.space: This house is very unique as it is on world famous spring creek. Comes with 47 acres to hike and explore. Also The quaint little village of Alden, home of the black water bath. There are many restaurants and shops to explore in the village. A short dive away from Darien lake and Niagara Falls. The surrounding area has so much to explore.
description.access: Guests have full access to the house. The pool and attached hot tub are seasonal. Hot tub on porch is available all year long!
description.notes: The garage and barn are not accessible.
description.neighborhood: A great little get away any time of year. This house is located right in the village of Alden. So many shops within walking distance, but the long driveway brings you back to a wooded oasis looking down at spring creek. There are restaurants and shops playgrounds and parks all a short walk away. Or you can go in the back woods for a nature walk, or down to the creek and find fossils. So many things to do.
description.transit: Walking or car are the best way to get around. There is plenty of parking onsite.
description.interaction: I will always be available for questions via phone call or text.
description.house_rules:
Pet rules. Dog Only No Cats. Must message to get pet approval before booking. Dogs are not allowed downstairs as there is wall to wall carpeting. If dogs go downstairs there is an additional cleaning fee of $1,500.00. If there is excessive cleaning caused by pet (hair, dirt, mud) there will be an extra $1,500.00 cleaning fee. Dog must be well behaved and potty trained. Owner will be held liable for any damages caused by pet. 
Guests are expected to leave the house with the same cleanliness they found it. If there is excessive cleaning there will be a charge of $1,500.00.
No parties, if a party is thrown an additional $2,000.00 fee will be charged.

The location is also superb, you wouldn’t feel like going out only anywhere coz the property itself is so nice and beautiful.
The host is also very sweet and helpful.

Lovely home on the river! Plenty of rooms and a very quiet place to relax. Great access to Buffalo NY and Niagara, but removed enough to enjoy peace and quiet mornings. Beds are comfortable and we had most everything we needed to prepare meals. The Tim Horton K cups were a nice touch!
Had a great time and experience
Super lovely, clean and very well equipped house! Amazing view and stunning River Niagara beside the house. Great for our big group - everyone enjoyed their time!

This gorgeous property "Serenity" was more than what we expected. The view was so breathtakingly beautiful... even spectacular sunrises!
So spacious and quiert and serene.
All ten of us had a great time. There was more space for another 4 people. Two kids and 2 adults.
Vasi the host kindly allowed us to check in earlier when requested. Her responses were almost instant. Every thing needed was provided. 
Immaculately & beautifully maintIned property in  and out... extreamly clean and comfortable! Easy keyless entry and exit! The view from each and every room was great! The neighbours were helpful and friendly. Great place to relax, unwind and enjoy as a family or eith ftiends! Would love to visit this gorgeous place again. Didn't want to leave this place!
Enjoyed every minute of it....even sleep time with comfy beds!
Every one must experience this place you will not be disappointed!
An amazing place to stay for a large group! Less than 30 mins from Niagara Falls. A beautiful view! Lots of space and very clean - huge backyard.

description.summary: Welcome to a 3300 square feet home. It over looks the Niagara river. You can view Buffalo, New York from the house. We are located 15 mins from Niagara Falls and American border is 5 minutes from the house. Niagara on the Lake is 25 minutes away and Toronto is one and a half hour away. We have a large kitchen and lots of living space. recreational room has a table tennis, foozball table, a reading nook and movie collections. We also have a rooftop patio over looking the River. No STR-000068
description.space:
Our house is located on Niagara River Parkway. The living room is spacious and over looks the Niagara River. The kitchen is modern and functional. There are 3 bedrooms on the second level and three bathrooms. You can park eight cars on the driveway. Smart TV and wifi are provided for our guests. 

There’s a patio area in the backyard with outdoor dining tables. Gas Bbq is also available for the guests. We also have a fire pit for guest’s use. There’s also a furnished roof top patio overlooking the Niagara River.
description.access: DVD collection and books are available to use. There are bicycles in the garage. Helmets are provided as well.
description.neighborhood: Our neighbourhood is very quiet. The water view is spectacular. There are bikes and walking trails. US border is 5 mins away. There are great shopping at Fashion outlet in Niagara Falls, New York. Outlet Collections of Niagara is 25 mins away in Niagara on the Lake. Crystal beach is 18 mins away.
description.transit: Car is necessary
description.interaction: level of interaction is up to the guests. Typically no interaction unless service call is required or assistance with local activities and events.
description.house_rules:
- NO SMOKING PLEASE! No parties or events. Check in is 4 pm or later. Check out is 11 am. You must be at least 25 years of age. Please remove your shoes at the door. 
- DO NOT USE THE FIREPLACE. ITS DECORATIVE ONLY. Please don’t move the furniture. Any 'extras' we supply are use at your own risk (ex bicycles). Please list all members of your group with ages in a message to me. All persons listed will be bound by the terms of agreement. Only persons listed on this agreement may occupy the property at any time.
- Please collect all the garbage from the kitchen  and  bathrooms put it in the black garage bags provided and leave it in the garage. Please leave the house in reasonably good condition. Excessive mess will occur additional charges.  
- Quiet hour starts at 9 pm. Please be respectful to the neighbors. PLEASE NO EATING IN THE BEDROOMS OR THE LIVING ROOM.

recent.comments: Jamie was a awesome host. She responds immediately and is willing to make your stay great. Great for families with children

items.comments: Jamie was a awesome host. She responds immediately and is willing to make your stay great. Great for families with children
Great home and location. Provided everything we needed for our stay.
Jamie’s house was amazing.  Fun toys and chairs to take to the beautiful private beach across the street.  More than we expected or could have asked for.  Perfect place for a relaxing getaway!
This was our second time staying here for our annual trip to visit family. The house is equipped with everything that we needed, the beds are comfortable, and Jamie is super easy to work with!
Everything was great! Highly recommend!

What a wonderful way of making memories this past week at Jamie's cottage.  Everything you need is right at your finger tips.   Kids loved playing in the yard and then taking a quick walk to the beach.  The cottage is conveniently located near grocery stores and not far for a quick trip into the Village of Angola.   We loved going to the bakery and the juicery and made a quick stop even at the library.  The cottage is great for a big family with lots of room to spread out.  Thank you Jamie!

This was our 2nd stay here and we are already looking forward to our next. Jamie is a wonderful host. The property is very clean,  family friendly with tons of space, a fenced in yard and a beautiful quiet beach right across the street! What more could you ask for.

description.summary: Large and recently renovated beach home with brand new furniture throughout. Great location in Grand View Bay, just 300 steps away from the beach. Newly decorated house features 4 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, large kitchen and living room, and wrap around deck for additional outdoor space. Enjoy breathtaking sunsets and a bonfire on the beach in the evening.  Sleeps 10 comfortably, but could accommodate up to 13 guests. Smart TVs in 2 bedrooms & living room.  Three night minimum stay.
description.space: Close to parks and bike trails, Mickey Rats Restaurant/Beach Bar, Bennett Beach, Village of Angola (restaurants, movie theater, library, antique shops) and Sturgeon Point Marina.
description.access: Entire house and fenced in yard including grill, parking for 4 cars,  beach chairs & beach toys for the kids too!
description.notes: Must be 25 to rent the property.
description.interaction: Available by phone or email for questions.

hosts.about:
Meet your local hosts: Jason and Elsie Mae at Niagara Holiday Rentals

Niagara-on-the-lake (NOTL) was voted one of Canada’s prettiest little towns and is located just a short drive from Niagara Falls, along the scenic Niagara River Parkway. Niagara Holiday Rentals is a local short-term vacation rental management company exclusive to Old Town Niagara-on-the-Lake!

-Outstanding scenery
-Distinct charm of a heritage district
-Unique shopping
-Award-winning wineries and restaurants
-World-class performances at the Shaw Festival Theatre

Niagara-on-the-Lake is an idyllic place to gather and connect or make a new memory or tradition.

Niagara Holiday Rentals has outstanding vacation rentals to suit every visitor, from one to up to 10 guests. We want all of our guests to feel like locals and love it just as much as we do. Come and stay with us and love the NOTL experience!

Jason and Elsie Mae own and run Niagara Holiday Rentals that manages 25 vacation rental properties in Niagara-on-the-Lake, since 2004. All our vacation homes and cottages are in Old Town, minutes from Queen Street.

We have been coming to Niagara-on-the-Lake since our honeymoon. A lot has changed, but we love it now more than ever. Jason is a real estate salesperson specializing in vacation, second home and investment properties. Elsie Mae is an accredited sommelier. She can let you know about the local wineries and wine industry. 

We enjoy a variety of activities in Niagara-on-the-Lake, from the local wineries and craft breweries to the Shaw Festival, as well as the parks and outdoor activities that the region has to offer.

We love finding new and exciting things to do in and around town, send us a message, we'd love to chat about your holiday plans!

All of the Niagara Holiday Rentals properties are licenced and insured as vacation rentals in the Town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. Niagara Holiday Rentals is registered with the Travel Industry Council of Ontario and complies with the Ontario Travel Regulations.

recent.comments: This charming and cozy house felt like “home away from home” for us at Niagara-on-the-Lake! Great for families. The location is excellent, a block from Queen St and across the street from Balzac’s Coffee Shop. Our toddler thoroughly enjoyed going up and down the carpeted stairs (a million times) and waking up to watch the squirrels and birds from the upper front porch and backyard. The basement’s air hockey table was also a nice added bonus! Grandparents and us enjoyed having our own private ensuites, with baby in his own room for naps and nighttime. Despite proximity to shop and restaurants, and a pub across the street, it was a super peaceful and quiet home. Our only issue was with cleaning upon arrival and some inflexibility regarding requests for early check-in and late check-out, but, other than that, we had an excellent stay and would stay here again!

items.comments: This charming and cozy house felt like “home away from home” for us at Niagara-on-the-Lake! Great for families. The location is excellent, a block from Queen St and across the street from Balzac’s Coffee Shop. Our toddler thoroughly enjoyed going up and down the carpeted stairs (a million times) and waking up to watch the squirrels and birds from the upper front porch and backyard. The basement’s air hockey table was also a nice added bonus! Grandparents and us enjoyed having our own private ensuites, with baby in his own room for naps and nighttime. Despite proximity to shop and restaurants, and a pub across the street, it was a super peaceful and quiet home. Our only issue was with cleaning upon arrival and some inflexibility regarding requests for early check-in and late check-out, but, other than that, we had an excellent stay and would stay here again!

We really enjoyed our stay. This was a family trip with kids 19 and 21 and the location is absolutely the best. I loved walking across the street to Balzacs for coffee or a 2 minute walk from the Angel Inn after an amazing evening of live music. Would definitely stay again!

Location, location, location. You could not find a better place to stay if you like to walk. There is a coffee shop across the street and a Starbucks several blocks away. Also a grocery store within walking distance and an unlimited amount of restaurants and shops. It was lovely too to take a walk to the lake/gazebo. The front porches, especially the upper level, are amazing. We loved to sit there with some charcuterie from the cheese shop a block away and relax. The 3 bed 3 bath is the perfect set up for a family to stay. Note the bathrooms have pedestal sinks with no counter space - small tables have been added which were very helpful. We had a minor issue with the back shower on the first morning and they promptly came over to address the issue. The kitchen/dining space is perfectly equipped and we made breakfast each day before heading out. There are TVs in every room though we spent our relaxation time on the upper porch. Many wineries within a few miles. We loved it!

As central as possible in NOTL. 3 Ensuite bedrooms make it great for three couples.  Large downstairs kitchen and living room - very comfortable.  Quaint exterior - modern interior.  Exactly as described.
Excellent location, great 3 bedroom with on-suite washrooms off each bedroom.

Delightful, charming, convenient and spacious. We absolutely loved our stay in the spacious Summerhill home! The three bedrooms all with their own full bathroom was a wonderful find for three couples. The house is very spacious and the location is perfect. You are minutes to the lake and all the town favorites.
We listened to a wonderful band called the Feverish Lemons at the Irish Pub across the street. We woke up every morning to a fresh cup of coffee from Balzac's coffee shop across the street. I would highly recommend dinner at Ginger's Restaurant, it was our favorite! 
We  are already planning a return trip next fall!!!
Wonderful stay at Summer Hill House. Perfect location, lovely house, great for 3 couples. Would definitely stay again!

description.summary: Next to Queen Street
description.space:
Located in the very heart of Old Town, literally steps from Queen Street with its shops, restaurants, and theatres! Note, prices are subject to change daily. 
 
This is a spacious charming house for families or a group of friends to relax on the front porch and watch the horse and carriage stroll by. Or let loose and have some fun in the generous sized games room with foosball table and air hockey!
 
-3 Bedrooms – 1 King bed, 2 Queen beds
-3.5 Bathrooms – Tub shower combination ensuite and 2 Walk-in shower ensuites (every bedroom has its own TV and ensuite!)
-Hosts up to 6 guests (including infants and children)
-Private parking for up to 2-3 vehicles, contactless check in
-Central heating and air conditioning
-High speed WiFi and 5 Samsung Smart TVs with access to streaming services, including a live TV app.
 
Summerhill House is one of the top rated and most sought-after vacation homes in Niagara! It is a historic home with renovations and updates to add all the luxury and comfort of a modern home. Exposed wooden beams throughout provide some of the architecture that gives the old-world charm.

Walk up to the inviting front porch that has Adirondack chairs (or Muskoka chairs if you are Canadian), a great place to sit with your morning coffee or an evening glass of wine.

The foyer spills into the living area with a big cozy 'L' shaped couch and a sitting chair, with a TV. A charming round dining table perfect for gathering, playing a good old fashioned board game. There is a two-piece bath on the main level for your convenience.

Continuing to the rear of the home is a spacious, fully equipped open kitchen and dining room, with a larger dining table. Kitchen includes: 

-Drip-coffee maker and kettle with enough coffee and tea to get you started
-Sugar packets, salt, and pepper
-Microwave, stove, fridge, toaster, and dishwasher
-Dishes, pots and pans, silverware and glasses (including wine glasses)  
-Non-stick spray, paper towels, dish soap, tea towels, dish cloths
 
This is a wonderful place to watch that cook in your family or for everyone to help out. Patio doors lead out to the back yard with a deck that has seating for all your guests, gas BBQ/grill, and a garden area.

A flight of carpeted stairs leads you to the 2nd level to all 3 bedrooms. The first two bedrooms have queen beds with luxurious bed linens. The front queen bedroom has a walk out to the large, covered balcony that has comfortable seating overlooking King Street. The third bedroom has a king bed and is located at the back of the house overlooking the backyard.

The lower level has a generous sized games room with foosball table, air hockey, and another TV. 

Laundry area is tucked away in the corner of the games room behind closet doors:

-Laundry soap, stain remover and dryer sheets
 
Bedding, towels, hair dryer, facial and toilet tissue, shampoo and hand soap are also provided.
 
Located just steps away from the corner of King St and Queen St, Summerhill House is across the street to Balzac's Coffee shop and The Irish Harp Pub. 

Location has so much to do with making a holiday really something special. Walk to any of the Shaw Festival's theatres, shops, and restaurants on Queen St.

If you'd prefer nature walks over walking on Queen St, the trails are just steps away! 

So, if you are looking for a vacation rental, look no further than Summerhill House.

Summerhill House is a licensed short-term rental in the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. Lic #095-2021

Enhanced Cleaning and Safety Protocols

We have a high standard for our homes and the housekeeping staff.
 
-Hand sanitizer pump at each property (70% alcohol)
-Disinfecting of soft surfaces with an alcohol based disinfectant
-Additional attention to disinfecting frequently touched surfaces
-Disinfecting of the mattress, mattress cover, pillows and pillow protectors with alcohol-based disinfectant


Fine Print:
- The person who booked and paid is the primary guest and is responsible for the actions of other house guests. The primary guest must be staying for every night of the booking.
- For insurance purposes the primary guest must be 25 years or older.
- No more than 6 people including all children. Names of every house guest (including children) must be provided. This information is required to comply with the town by-laws.
- No overnight street parking is allowed in the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake.
- No smoking or vaping of tobacco, marijuana or any similar product whose use generates smoke or vapors within the house. Any lingering aromas or smells after your stay will result in additional cleaning charges.
- No pets allowed.
description.access: This property features self-check-in, no keys required.  Guests have access to the whole house.

description.neighborhood:
Summerhill House is located in the heart of Niagara-on-the-Lake Historic Old Town, just steps off Queen Street.  As the first capital of Upper Canada, Niagara-on-the Lake has lots of history.  We have beautiful scenery and historic homes.  Located at the mouth of the Niagara River we have both riverfront and lakefront trails, parks and beaches and water sports.  If you love theatre, you have come to the right place!  The Shaw Festival runs from April to October plus the Christmas productions in November and December.
 
Our community pool is located a 10 min walk away and is open from mid-June to Labour Day weekend weather permitting. (Note there is a daily fee, paid upon entry, for the pool.)
description.transit: On-site parking for 2-3 cars is included.  The house is steps away from Niagara-on-the-Lake's main street - Queen Street.
description.interaction: We live close by and are available if needed.  An emergency contact number will be provided at check-in.
description.house_rules:
It is the responsibility of the guest making the booking to read and understand the following terms and conditions and to ensure that all other guests are also aware of and adhere to these terms. 

If you have any questions in regard to these policies, please contact one of our travel specialists Niagara Holiday Rentals, prior to booking.

Check-in time is after 4:00 PM and Check-out time is by 10:30 AM

-If there are any issues, breaks or malfunctions let us know as soon as possible so that we may address the issue during your stay.

-Bed linens and towels are provided.

-For your added convenience, we start you off with coffee, tea, sugar, salt & pepper, cooking spray and a basic supply of foil, paper towels, toilet tissue, hand soap, dish/dishwasher soap, laundry and fabric softener and cleaning supplies. You are responsible for any additional requirements during your stay. (There is a drip coffee maker in the house.)

-Housekeeping is not included during your stay. Arrangements may be made in advance for an additional charge.

Travel Documents and Insurance

Additional Information for travelers from outside Ontario

Documentation Requirements

-Canadians living outside of Ontario may require out of province health coverage. 
-Non-Canadians traveling to Ontario require travel documents. Entry into Canada could be denied without the appropriate travel documents, which could include passports and visas.
-Due to the COVID-19 Pandemic, additional documentation and testing may be required to enter Canada, please see the Government of Canada website for further details prior to departure. 
-Please note that entry into Canada may be refused even if the required information and travel documents are complete.

Although we do not sell insurance, we highly recommend the purchase of trip cancellation insurance and travel health insurance for any travel. Please contact your insurance provider.


Terms and Conditions of Occupancy

1. The primary guest making the booking must be at least 25 years of age to rent a vacation home. We require the full name of those staying at the house overnight and we also require vehicle information for any vehicles parking on the premises. Please note that there are restrictions on the number of guests and vehicles allowed at each property and all vehicles must only park in designated areas.

2. Reservations are not transferable. The person who made the reservation must stay for the full duration of the booking.
 
3. These are private homes in residential neighbourhoods and not venues for large parties, commercial functions, weddings, bachelor / bachelorette parties, graduation parties, rehearsal dinners or BBQ/grill for large gatherings. Each house has a cap on number of people permitted to be on the property at one time.

4. Only registered guests are permitted to use any of the amenities of the vacation home. If not adhered to, you and your traveling companions will be asked to vacate the property without a refund.

5. No-smoking: No guest or visitor shall smoke Marijuana or other tobacco cigarettes, cigars, electronic cigarettes, or any similar product whose use generates smoke or vapors within the house. This prohibition includes all balconies and patios, enclosed common areas, as well as outside within 9 meters of doorways, operable windows, and air intakes. There will be a minimum surcharge of $500.00 for any smoke related clean-up.
 
6. Parking: Number of vehicles is limited to the parking spaces available at each vacation home. Please park only in designated parking areas on the property. Over night street parking is not allowed. 
 
7. Only guests registered to the house at time of booking are permitted to stay and use any amenities of the vacation home.
 
8. The person booking accepts full responsibility for any and all damages or losses inflicted upon the house, its contents and/or property.

9. The Property Owners and Management are not responsible nor liable for accidents, injury or illness to guests, or damage to or loss of personal property of any kind. Guests are solely responsible for the safety and security of all persons in the house, including children, and pets, at all times during the rental period.

10. Quiet Enjoyment: No person shall make noise so as to cause a disturbance or conduct themselves in a way that is likely to disturb area residents. The noise by-law prohibits sound or vibration at any time, which is likely to disturb the quiet, peace, rest, enjoyment, comfort, or convenience of the inhabitants of the Town.  

11. In case of personal injury, emergency, or fire call 911 on house phone (if available). Address of home is on the blue welcome card. During a fire, use fire extinguishers if possible, without harm to yourself.

12. Garbage cans are located outside, as well as blue and grey boxes for recycling. We take the garbage and recyclables to roadside before 7:00 am on Friday. Please ensure garbage and recycling is sorted and taken to the outside storage bins on Thursday evening and prior to your departure.

13. Before leaving, double check that you have not left any personal items behind. Call us if you have forgotten something and you want it shipped back to you at your expense. 

14. House Maintenance: Your home is professionally cleaned and disinfected prior to your arrival.

- While we don’t expect you to dust, scrub toilets or vacuum on your holiday, we would ask you to please keep the house clean and tidy (as it was when you arrived). Cleaning up spills immediately protects the finish, and keeping the kitchen clean prevents little critters from feasting on your leftovers. Only use appliances for their intended uses. If the vacation home requires more than normal cleaning after your stay, you will be assessed the additional cost.

- Please help us maintain the home in a good and clean condition by following these simple procedures during your stay and at departure:

     -Place all soiled towels in the bathtub or shower
     -Run the dishwasher with soiled dishes prior to checking out
     -Dispose of all waste materials into specific bins outside as instructed upon arrival.
     -Please clean countertops and stove top of any spills or sticky residue
     -Please do not rearrange furniture in the house. Outdoor furniture stays outside, Indoor furniture stays inside! You may be assessed an additional cost to your stay if furniture is damaged from being inappropriately treated or the additional time to put furniture back in its designated spot.

15. Odours - Please refrain from cooking foods or creating aromas that linger beyond your stay. If the odours remain and result in relocating the guests coming in after your same day departure, you will be assessed the cost to relocate for one night. Strong aromatic foods can be cooked outside on the grill/BBQ.
Niagara Holiday Rentals reserves the right to enter the premises to perform maintenance and ensure the vacation home is kept in good repair.

16. Report all maintenance issues promptly. Just as might happen at your own well-maintained home, mechanical failures, disruption of services and other breakdowns can occur. Every effort will be made to correct the situation; however, no refunds or rate adjustments will be made for mechanical and service failures that are beyond our control. Report any damage or breakage upon occurrence so the matter can be settled before departure. Damages found by inspection crews upon departure will be billed and full payment for repairs will be collected via credit card.

17. If bedding and or towels are stained, please do not attempt to clean, this may set the stain. Please let us know as soon as possible and definitely before your departure.  

18. Locked owners' closets are not included in your rental. (If found unlocked, please refrain from taking out additional items or supplies.) Garages do not have guaranteed access for guests. Most are for owner usage only and are not included in your rental.

19. If you are in a vacation home with a sofa sleeper, these are best suited for children and may be uncomfortable for adults.  

20. Slipper Policy (if slippers are provided): To protect the floors & carpets, guests are asked to please remove their shoes inside the house. Slippers are provided. (Persons with disabilities are exempt). 

21. If pet friendly, we allow one small dog with prior confirmation at time of booking. No additional animals are allowed on the property at any time. Pets should not be allowed to be on the beds or furniture. Please do not leave pets unattended for long periods and do not allow your dog to keep bark continuously inside or out.
-There is an additional pet fee of $100 that will be added to your reservation after booking
-Only one small dog allowed.
-Pets must be at least 1 year old.
-If damage is caused, the cost of the damage or additional cleaning required will be taken from your damage deposit and/or charged to your credit card.
-Please pick up after your pet. Any pet waste not picked up will incur an additional clean up charge.

22. If the home has a wood burning fireplace, only fabricated fire logs are permitted. Use only one log at a time, it will last 2 to 3 hours. Do not use wood even if available. Do not use twigs or scrub brush. Chimney fires are always a concern. Fabricated logs burn cleanly, and the cleaners do not have to worry about hot coals when they come in after you depart. Some fireplaces have been labeled do not use. These have chimney’s that have been blocked off.

23. Absolutely no fireworks or outdoor fires are permitted on the premises.

24. Loss or damage: We reserve the right to charge for any loss or damage etc. assessed upon departure. If extra cleaning or sanitizing is required over and above what would be considered normal wear and tear, a minimum fee of $500 fee will be charged to cover these extra costs.

25. During your stay we may have some maintenance work done on the outside of the home such as mowing, trimming, cleaning BBQ/grill, tidying up patio and pool/pond maintenance (if applicable). 

26. The continued growth of our area is evidenced by new construction that may be adjacent to or near existing vacation rental properties. We regret any inconvenience but cannot control these situations. Refunds or relocations cannot be considered 

27. Telephone (if available) International calls outside North America, made during your visit will be charged to the credit card number provided at the time of your reservation. Any additional pay per view or cable TV charges will also be charged.  

28. Guests must be aware of and adhere to all Niagara-on-the-Lake by-laws, including Noise (By-law 4588-12) and Public Nuisances (By-law 4397-10 &4397A-11). Any fines levied as a result of a complaint during your stay will be charged to the primary guest. You must also ensure that every person being accommodated is complying with any applicable restrictions on the size of social gatherings and organized public events. 

We understand that you are on vacation and realize that the above may seem strict, but many of these policies are meant to ensure safe enjoyment for yourself and your guests, but also to reduce wear and tear on the home and ensure the quiet enjoyment of neighbours.
Failure to comply with any of the above or for any reason determined by Niagara Holiday Rentals, will result in you and your guests immediately vacating the vacation home. If you are requested to vacate before your scheduled departure date as a result of not complying with the Terms and Conditions of Occupancy, you are not entitled to any refunds.

Your vacation rental home is privately owned by a Homeowner and managed by Niagara Holiday Rentals,

hosts.about:
We would like to welcome you to the Vineyard Manor House located on the grounds of Freedom Run Winery,  just next door to the Vineyard Manor House.

We are open from 11-6 pm daily, and until 8 pm on Fridays during the summer months.

Once you get settled in, please feel free to walk across the lawn to Freedom Run Winery for a tasting…or two…or three.  

Don’t forget to ask about our quantity discount.  

Cheers!
Team Freedom

recent.comments: Traveling with the family was amazing. It is a very old home but really cool. There was lots to do. Being able to stay on the freedom run’s property was so cool. There was wine, a concert, yoga, and great food. The Niagara Falls are only 25 minutes away but the drive in was great. Thank you for having us for the weekend.

items.comments: Traveling with the family was amazing. It is a very old home but really cool. There was lots to do. Being able to stay on the freedom run’s property was so cool. There was wine, a concert, yoga, and great food. The Niagara Falls are only 25 minutes away but the drive in was great. Thank you for having us for the weekend.
מקום יפה מאוד, מאובזר ונקי. בית גדול שיושב על שטח ענק. יש יקב צמוד ואפשר לשתות גם בירה .

We liked our stay at Freedom Run! The house was beautiful, exactly like on pictures. We like our privacy, space to walk with a dog. The kitchen was equipped with everything one might need. This place is 30 min drive to Niagara Falls, which is not bad at all, but you stay in a very beautiful surroundings.

My family and I like the house - it's a very nice place for family reunion or wine tasting. The house appears to be George Washington's house with one maid bedroom on the first floor and three bedrooms on the second floor. Each room has distinctive features, some japanese style decorations. The only problem that bothered me is that we found a few dried stink bugs, probably because of not so many people living there.

Amazing location and super-unique home. We stayed as the first stop on a two-week road trip with kids and family. The location was peaceful with an eclectic and charming decor and comfortable rooms. Would also make a great quiet retreat for a weekend or week with friends!

I think the venue is decent for summer or fall, but winter was a little challenging.  I appreciated having a kitchen.  I work in lockport a lot and prefer an Airbnb to a hotel, but the wind and cold made for a few restless nights. Probably should have chosen a hotel. Live and learn.
Great for staying close to the wedding venue

description.summary:
The Vineyard Manor House built in 1826 with stone from the Erie Canal has been restored to its original grandeur.

Decor is ‘shabby chic’ yet elegant and comfy, and has a large foyer with curved wooden staircase, perfect for photo ops.  This 4 bedroom house offers accommodation year round.

We have an arrangement with a local caterer to provide a full service dinner party, or can deliver prepared food directly to your door.  For info about catering please contact Ava's Table at the Vineyard.
description.space:
The space includes:

Ground floor with 12' ceilings, cherrywood floors, chandeliers, windows with swagged drapes, Formal Living with adjoining Dining Room, Eat-in Kitchen, Powder Room, and there is a Queen Bedroom in the former Butlers Pantry.

Second floor has 3 Bedrooms with  a Private Master Bedroom with Ensuite, a Four Poster Bedroom and a Bedroom with 2 Twin Beds that share the Full Bathroom on the 2nd floor landing.  This is the bathroom for the ground floor bedroom as well.

The Grand Foyer entrance offers a flow through plan around a Curved Wooden Staircase that is perfect for that special photo op.  

Decor is ‘shabby chic’ yet elegant and comfy, and is the perfect place to stay if you are hosting or attending a Wedding or Event at Freedom Run Winery.  

Please note that this house does not have central A/C but there are electric units in bedroom and living room windows that are available for warmer days, and screens provide a nice breeze when A/C is not needed.

Think about gathering in this beautiful 4 bedroom house with friends & family for a mid week stay as weekends get booked quickly.

By booking through this Airbnb listing, you agree that you will have a temporary license agreement to occupy our property for a short term stay, as per the agreed dates booked, and that this  is not a lease, and not subject to landlord/tenant laws.
description.access: Guests have access to the entire Vineyard Manor House, and are free to walk through the vineyards and our 1000 tree apple orchard.   Please note that this beautiful stone house is located on the grounds of a busy working winery with equipment and crops being sprayed...which will be posted.  There may be a wedding or special event in our Rustic Barn and people outside on the great lawn between the house and the Tasting Room.  It would be wise to supervise children if they play outside.
description.notes:
Parties Policy:

There are no parties allowed in the Vineyard Manor House.  The house is meant as accommodation and can be booked in conduction with an event or wedding taking place at Freedom Run Winery.  A small dinner party can be arranged for guests who are staying in the Vineyard Manor House, with advanced notice to us and with permission given. 

Children:

Please be careful if you have children.  There are glass encased candles in the house which have matches with them.  Also, there are no child guards on the windows.  

Pet Policy:

Well behaved pets, to a maximum of 2, must be leashed if outside and must be crated if left alone indoors.  Pets are not permitted on the furniture or in beds.

Normal Airbnb Courtesy:

As we are usually booked most days in season, and so that housekeeping will have as much time as possible to sanitize and prepare for the next guests, we would appreciate if you would strip the beds and leave the linen in a bathroom,   and if you do use one of the air mattresses, please deflate it.  Please fill and turn on the dishwasher, and gather all trash and place in the receptacles provided outside to the right of the mudroom door, as leaving.   We thank you very much in advance.  

Cheers, Team Freedom
description.neighborhood:
Our beautiful Vineyard Manor House is situated on the grounds of our family run vineyard, with views overlooking acres of vineyards and fields planted with a rotating crop of corn, wheat and soy beans.  There is also a 1000 tree apple orchard, which produces our much sought after ‘Apple Jack'. 

You get the tranquility of country living at the Vineyard Manor House, yet you will see luxury buses and stretch limousines pulling up to the tasting room, which is located just next door.  Please feel free to walk around the  property, but be aware, especially with kids, that this is a working winery, with tractors in the fields and vineyards on a daily basis.  Pets must be kept on a leash.

The house is easily accessible to the town of Lockport for local shopping.  You may wish to take a tour boat up the Erie Canal, see the Lockport Underground Caves, visit the Erie Canal Discovery Center, and Lake Effect Ice Cream which offers unique flavors like Whiskey Brown Sugar and Frozen Hot Chocolate…yum! 

There is a thriving art and performing arts community in Lockport so be sure to check out The Palace Theater and The Kenan Center as well as local artists at the Market Street Art Studios.  

There is so much to do in the area, including weekly classic car shows, and open air farmers markets in season.   Not to be missed are the beautiful Tiffany stained glass windows at the First Presbyterian Church.

Check out the lineup of world class entertainment at the outdoor concerts at Art Park in Lewiston, where there is a wide variety of great restaurants.  There is also an amazing nature trail overlooking the Niagara River at Art Park in Lewiston.  

The Herschel Carrousel Factory Museum in nearby North Tonawanda is a historic carousel factory complex which was constructed in 1910-1915 and hosts a working carrousel with  36 hand carved horses and over 580 lights.

It is a short drive to Niagara Falls, one of the most beautiful natural wonders of the world, and the honeymoon capital of the world.   The locals park on 'Goat Island' and take a short stroll to see the Falls.  

While in Niagara Falls, be sure to check out The Niagara Falls Culinary Institute which is like visiting the kitchen of a five star restaurant, as they sell what the 'chef's in training' create, and they also feature the wine from  Freedom Run Winery.  

The city of Buffalo is approximately 45 minutes away, and is full of wonderful things to discover.  Take a tour of The Frank Lloyd Wright Martin House and the Albright-Knox Art Gallery of modern and contemporary art.  

Check the calendar at The Shea Preforming Arts Center and don’t miss having a wonderful meal at The Bijou Grill which is right across the street, or if you like an unusual menu, check out the The Black Sheep or our favorite The Billy Club.

While in Buffalo, check out the Darwin Martin House National Historic Landmark, which was designed by Frank Lloyd Wright and built between 1903 and 1905, and if you have time, also take in the Albright–Knox Art Gallery which is a major showplace for modern and contemporary art.

If touring the other wineries is what you are looking for, just pop into Freedom Run Winery and pick up a map, or go to the Niagara Wine Trail website for more information.  

You can also check out our Underground Railroad Freedom Art Walk to learn more about the history of this sacred land which features in the story of the Underground Railroad.  Or you could simply relax in the back yard overlooking the vineyard with a glass of wine on the covered patio!

We look forward to welcoming you to the Vineyard Manor House at Freedom Run Winery.
description.transit: You will need a car, and there is plenty of parking.
description.interaction:
Please contact us through the Airbnb app if you have any questions during your stay.  

Your primary contact during the day will be through the Tasting Room at Freedom Run Winery, which is just next door and is open from noon to 6 pm daily.  Don't be a stranger in the Tasting Room as there is always something interesting happening.

You will have as much privacy as you like at the Vineyard Manor House,  and please feel free to walk the grounds, but please be mindful that it is a working winery, with machinery in use.  

Cheers, Team Freedom
description.house_rules:
THESE ARE OUR RULES THAT YOU AGREE TO BY BOOKING A STAY WITH US REGARDING CHILDREN AND PETS.  

ANY DAMAGE WILL BE NOTED BY PHOTO IMMEDIATELY AFTER YOU LEAVE AND THE RESOLUTION CENTER WILL BE NOTIFIED TO HELP RECOUP COSTS OF REPAIR.  WE HOPE THIS WILL NOT BE NECESSARY.  IT WOULD BE CONSIDERATE IF YOU LEAVE A LITTLE EXTRA FOR OUR CLEANING STAFF TO DEAL WITH STAIN REMOVAL IN THE EVENT OF AN ACCIDENTAL 'LEAK OF FLUIDS'.

RULE #1
No parties or events allowed other than those arranged in advance and planned and approved in writing by Freedom Run Winery.  The Vineyard Manor House is for the purpose of short term accommodation and is primarily used for family and friends hosting or attending weddings at FRW.

RULE #2
Children of all ages are welcome, however please be respectful to future guests, and place a waterproof barrier under sheet to protect mattresses, as we are sure that you do at your own home.  You may also choose to use the air mattresses, with linen, found in the upstairs hall closet.  If you do so, please leave $15 per day, per mattress in cash for the extra work that our cleaning staff will incur.  PLEASE NOTE THAT WE DO NOT HAVE CHILDPROOF WINDOWS, SO PLEASE MONITOR YOUR CHILDREN AT ALL TIMES.

RULE #3
IN REGARDS TO PETS:
Well behaved dogs are always welcome to a maximum of 2...please check with us first if you have more.
Please be respectful to future guests who may have pet allergies, and please do not let your pet sit/sleep on our furniture or our beds.  
Please bring your own mat/bed for them to sleep on.  
They must be crated or put into the mud room if left unattended in the house.
When outside they must be on a lease on FRW property.

PLEASE NOTE THE FOLLOWING:
As the Vineyard Manor House is located on a working winery, there are many patrons coming and going, and weddings taking place with people parking along the driveway leading up to our Rustic Barn, so please be mindful.

By booking through this Airbnb listing, you agree that we will have a temporary license agreement to occupy our property for a short term stay, as per the agreed dates booked, and that this is not a lease, and not subject to landlord/tenant laws.
