hosts.about: We love to travel, family of fun loving outdoorsy explorers!

recent.comments: Always a 5 star stay! We come year after year for our favorite cottage in our favorite place!

items.comments: Always a 5 star stay! We come year after year for our favorite cottage in our favorite place!

Wonderful house in great summer community!  House is well equipped with plenty of linens, dishes, lawn games and beach toys. Back porch is wonderful, outdoor shower divine, and new fire pit was a bonus! Easy walk to the lake, close to all area attractions. Host graciously responded almost immediately to questions, and was concerned that our stay was stress-free. Would give more than 5 stars if possible.

We’ve been coming to Van Buren Point every summer for the past 40 years, and have stayed in a number of different cottages, and our stay at Valhalla was far  & away the best accommodations we’ve experienced. Kudos to John and his family for being such terrific hosts
Our family has stayed in this house the last few years and love it. Well kept and very clean.  John is great to work with and responds quickly.

Absolutely beautiful cottage with plenty of spaces to hangout. There were just enough bedrooms for all of us to sleep. 
It’s a close walk to the lake as well. After my kids had a messy/fun time playing in the sand, it was really nice having that separate entrance leading to the back deck, into the outdoor shower. The kids loved that! 
We had beautiful weather while we were there. Got to enjoy the lake, have a fire, grill out, go on the wine trails, go to the drive-in, play some really fun board games and just created long lasting memories there. 
This has been my 15th year going to Van Buren and my husband 30 +. VBP has such a special place in our hearts. We will be booking again for sure!

We had a wonderful and relaxing stay. was easy to access and the first floor bedrooms were handy and convenient. The back porch was amazing and we spent many early mornings and late evenings out there bug free. We enjoyed walking or biking to the beach each evening to watch the sun set on the water!

My family and I had a wonderful stay at John’s place! We immediately felt at home. We loved all the little nooks and crannies, especially the tiny room we called the “Harry Potter” room. My favorite was the loft bedroom with the sliding barn doors and cozy sitting area. Oh! And the enclosed front porch with the comfy chair/ottoman and afternoon sun pouring in was pure heaven. I could go on but I’m exhausted from our 7 hour drive back to Philly… but I’d do it all again because it was well worth it!

description.summary:
-Year round cottage, continuously upgraded, exceptionally maintained and equipped, with 4 bedrooms; 1.5 bathrooms, and sleeps 10
-Beautiful knotty pine interior with lots of light, wood and tile floors throughout (no carpeting) 
- Outdoor space includes a nice front yard, fenced-in back yard, two tiered deck, grill and private outdoor shower.
- Views of the Bay from 3 season front porch, living room and upstairs
- Please sign and return a rental agreement
- Security camera @ front and back door
description.space:
Leave it all behind and escape to the most wonderful place on earth; the charming historic "gated" community of Van Buren Point on Lake Erie. Here you will find many darling cottages, each cleverly named, well cared for and loved generation after generation. But you will find that there is only one cottage that will make your trip truly unforgettable and its our "Valhalla".

Valhalla is a beautifully upgraded, exceptionally maintained, and well equipped year-round cottage with 4 bedrooms and 1.5 bathrooms which can sleep 10. You will love the beautiful views of the bay which can be seen from the 3 season porch, living room, and the upstairs. 

As you enter Valhalla, you will discover the stunning knotty pine interior and hard wood floors that really make this cottage stand out. The vaulted ceilings and open loft give the tastefully furnished living room a warm and inviting feeling. Accenting the room is a beautiful gas fireplace for you to cozy up next to on those chilly nights.

On the first floor you will find 2 generously sized bedrooms, each with its own closet and queen bed, so you can make yourself right at home! Conveniently located right next to the bedrooms you will find the full bathroom with shower/bathtub.

Off the living room you will find the large well equipped eat-in kitchen with many nice features including a double oven, microwave, dish washer, garbage disposal and quartz countertops.

Just off the kitchen you will discover an additional newly remodeled living/dining area. Here you can relax on the comfy new pull-out couch and watch a movie. Gather around the dining room table with seating for 6+ for a good old fashion family game night or enjoy your home-cooked meal in front of the bay window with a view of the lake.

As you leave the kitchen you will find the washer and dryer as well as a half bath. Head up the stairs and you will see the loft and a large bedroom containing a double and two single beds. 

Step outside you will discover an over-sized private fenced-in yard and a large 2 tiered enclosed deck which features a private outdoor shower. Take advantage of the beautiful weather with a cook out on the large combo gas/charcoal grill and enjoy your meal on the picnic table. If you don't want to walk to the beach for a bonfire, relax in the Adirondack chairs and make your own in the backyard fire pit.

After a night in one of the comfy beds, wake refreshed and ready to seize the day. Head to the porch to relax and enjoy the tranquility of the morning as you sip your coffee and watch in awe as the sun slowly begins to rise over the lake. 

Head outside to enjoy all of the awesome amenities VBP has to offer. Walk or ride bikes to the beach to take a dip or do some boating. Bask in the sun and take in the gorgeous scenery as you walk the beach looking for sea glass or wood for a bonfire. When you have had enough of the beach jump on your bike and cruise to one of the many parks located in VBP. Play on the playground or play a game of tennis, basketball, sand volleyball, horseshoes, or bocce ball. After dinner take a stroll over to the beach in time to catch a spectacular sunset over the lake. 

If you are in the mood for a little excursion there are plenty of things to do in the surrounding area. Follow the Chautauqua Wine Trail to discover and enjoy western New York's local wineries. Lake and stream and ice fishing is available nearby! A short drive will get you to Buffalo, Niagara Falls or ski resorts and much, much more.
description.notes:
Van Buren Point has relaxed and quiet community feel. Young and old alike move throughout the community on bikes and on foot. Activities such as yoga, bike parades, arts and crafts, and games are provided at the community center across the street.

Water shoes, or sandals are great.  The beaches are sandy and pebbly.  The lake beach has a solid slate bottom where cracks can be sharp.  Again, we wear water shoes.

Kindly note 5% taxes are included in the price.

Upon making the reservation the guest is required to provide an email or physical address so we can send the short term rental agreement for review and signature.  Rental booking is not complete until the contract is signed and returned to the host.

Must be 25 years of age with a valid drivers license or state issued id to rent.
description.neighborhood: There is a ball field and multiple playgrounds (hours are dawn to dusk), in this bicycle friendly community. It is like stepping back in time to a simpler era.  Very relaxing.  Classic Schwinn's and other retro single and tandem bikes abound.
description.transit: No public transportation. Personal vehicles and possible Uber/Taxi are best option for exploring the local area.
description.interaction: We'll be available by phone or email and are very knowledgeable about the area attractions.   Our family has owned a cottage here since 1973.
description.house_rules:
5% local tax is included in price. 

Upon making the reservation the guest is required to provide an email or physical address so we can send the short term rental agreement for review and signature (this rental agreement is also located below for preview).  Rental booking is not complete until the contract is signed and returned to the host. 

We expect guests to treat the property, and community with respect.  

Fees and Rental Conditions:
Pet Fee = $100 + tax, Pets considered on case by case basis, Pets under 1 year old will not be considered.  
If accepted a non-refundable $100/pet fee will be assessed
RVs and mobile homes are not permitted and tents can not be used except for children's enjoyment.
Cleaning Fee = $100 + tax

Notes:
3 day minimum in the off-peak season
7 day minimum in peak season
Friday to Friday weekly rentals

Must be 25 years of age with a valid drivers license or state issued id.
We do not provide towels.  It is too difficult for the cleaning crew to get all towels and linens completed between guests, sorry!

*There are external actively recording security cameras at the front and back door pointing away from the door.

Motorcycles, mopeds, and motorized bicycles are limited to direct travel to and from the main gate to the owner's cottage.

Golf carts are limited to physically impaired persons. 
ATV’s are permitted on VBP roads to take compostable refuse to recycling areas and to launch watercraft ONLY.
Parking is prohibited on all roads in VBP.

Watercraft/Trailers:
Boat/Trailer parking is available near the dump.  Prior to parking, you must sign a waiver and pay a $75 fee.
No watercraft should be stored or left on an access way.
Small watercraft may be left on the beach at owner’s risk.
Motorized watercraft launched from VBP beaches must ride out in a straight line at a speed 5 mph or less, and remain outside of the buoys, or 500 feet from shore if buoys are not in.
Watercraft users must abide by U.S. Coast Guard and New York state rules and regulations.

Fireworks/Fires:
Fireworks are illegal in the State of New York.
Firearms are not to be discharged within Van Buren Point.

Fires: extreme caution when building a beach fire or fire in a personal fire pit.
Fires should not be left unattended.
No fires when we are experiencing high winds.
Beach fires must be totally extinguished prior to leaving the area.  This includes pouring water over the fire so that someone doesn’t accidentally get burned when on the beach without shoes.

VACATION PROPERTY RENTAL AGREEMENT (NEW YORK)
3.	Rental Period:
This lease shall commence at      3:00    p.m. on the X day of MONTH, YYYY (the “Check- In Time”) and shall terminate at 11:00 a.m. on the X day of MONTH, YYYY (the “Check-Out Time”), unless terminated at an earlier date in accordance with the provisions of this lease dealing with default.

Owner will use its commercially reasonable efforts to have the Rental Property ready for occupancy by the Renter at Check-In Time. If Renter is delayed for any reason and is unable to take possession at the Check-In Time, Renter is responsible for notifying the Owner of such delay so that special arrangements can be made for the Renter to pick up the keys.

At Check-In Time, the Renter will access the residence by keyless entry using the four (4) digit code provided by the owner in the guest information packet provided prior to arrival to enter the residence. In case of emergency or failure of the keyless entry, owner has a backup key that can be used by guest.

4.	Rent:

The Renter shall pay the Owner total rent in the sum of $ [see online booking detail], which includes all utilities, plus a non-refundable cleaning fee of $100.00, and any other applicable fees.   A $500.00 security deposit is also included and administered via Airbnb. 
Confirmation of the reservation will be mailed, faxed, or emailed to Renter upon receipt of the initial reservation deposit. It is Renter’s responsibility to review the confirmation for accuracy of dates, mailing address, number of adults and/or children and accommodations, and to notify Owner of any errors within    7      days of receipt.

5.	Description of Rental Property:

The Rental Property consists of a cottage located at 10374 Park Ave Blvd, Town of Van Buren Point, County of Chautauqua, State of New York. The Rental Property is comprised of the following rooms: 3 Three (3) bedrooms, one and a half (1.5) bathrooms, living room, kitchen w/ small eating area), and a family/dining room area. The master bedroom has a queen-sized bed, the other first floor bedroom has a full-sized bed, the upstairs bedroom has a full-sized bed and two (2) twin beds, and there is also a pullout couch located in the family room.

A full supply of bed linens are provided. Bed linens will not be changed during the Rental Period. Laundry facilities are provided, and it is up to the Renter and other registered occupants to wash the linen and towels during the Rental Period.] Owner will attempt to provide a sufficient supply of bath soap, toilet tissue and trash bags, based on the number of registered occupants, however, there is no guarantee that the supply of any of these items will be enough to last to the end of the Rental Period. Any additional items must be provided by Renter at Renter’s sole expense.

The Rental Property is fully furnished and equipped with a standing air-conditioning unit, a window unit, and a through-the-wall unit in the upstairs bedroom, as well as a washer & dryer, television, microwave oven, and all kitchen appliances, dishes & utensils. Certain areas in the Rental Property are locked for the Owner’s personal storage and are not included in this lease. These storage areas have been clearly marked with signs denoting them as private, and are strictly off-limits.

6.	Notice to Owner of Repairs Needed:

If the Rental Property or any of the contents are damaged, not working or otherwise in need of repair or replacement, the Renter must promptly notify the Owner. The Owner will have a reasonable amount of time to make repairs. If the Renter must vacate the premises because of damage not resulting from the Renter’s act or neglect, the Renter will be refunded the rent for such period of time that the Renter is unable to occupy the Rental Property, prorated on a per diem basis commencing on the date that the Renter was forced to vacate and calculated to the date on which the Renter was able to re-occupy the Rental Property or the end of the Rental Period, whichever comes first. If the Rental Property is totally destroyed, this Rental Agreement will terminate and the Renter will pay rent up to the date of destruction.

The Owner is not responsible for any inconvenience or interruption of services due to repairs, improvements, or any reason beyond the Owner’s control, and no refund will be given in this event. Renter understands and agrees that Owner may enter the Rental Property at any time for the purpose of making needed repairs.

7.	Cancellation:

As described in the Airbnb listing, cancelation policy is strict: 50% refund up until 1 week prior to arrival, except fees.
•	Cleaning fees are always refunded if the guest did not check in.
•	The Airbnb service fee is non-refundable.
•	Accommodation fees (the total nightly rate you're charged) are refundable in certain circumstances as outlined below.
•	If there is a complaint from either party, notice must be given to Airbnb within 24 hours of check-in.
•	Airbnb will mediate when necessary, and has the final say in all disputes.
•	A reservation is officially canceled when the guest clicks the cancellation button on the cancellation confirmation page, which they can find in Dashboard > Your Trips > Change or Cancel.
•	Cancellation policies may be superseded by the Guest Refund Policy, extenuating circumstances, or cancellations by Airbnb for any other reason permitted under the Terms of Service. Please review these exceptions.
•	Applicable taxes will be retained and remitted.

8.	Change of Reservation:

If Renter requests a change to the reservation altering the date(s) of the commencement and/or termination of the lease or a change in the premises being rented hereunder, such change will be subject to a non-refundable $50.00 rescheduling fee per change. All changes must be at least 60 days prior to the commencement of the Rental Period, and are subject to availability. Owner may, at its sole discretion, approve a change of reservation requested less than 60 days prior to the commencement of the Rental Period, however, an administration fee of  20  % of the initial reservation deposit will apply.

9.	No Show:

If the Renter does not show up within twenty-four (24) hours following the Check-In Time, and has failed to contact the Owner regarding any delay in arrival, the Renter will be considered a “no show” and shall be liable to the Owner for the total amount of the Rent and other charges as set out in Section 4 of this Agreement.

10.	Double Booking

In the event that Renter’s reservation for the Rental Property is double booked with the reservation of another Renter, Owner reserves the right to relocate Renter to a different rental property within the Owner’s rental program or that of another company. Every effort will be made to ensure that the replacement property is reasonably comparable to the original Rental Property. Owner shall have the sole right to select such replacement rental property. Owner agrees to pay any additional charges due in excess of the rental amount for the Rental Property, and refund any amounts paid by Renter in excess of the rental amount for the replacement property. Renter will have the option to (i) accept the replacement property or (ii) reject the replacement property and receive a refund of all rents and fees paid for the Rental Property. Renter agrees that Renter’s choice between these two options will be Renter’s sole remedy for any and all damages, liability, or inconvenience arising out of the double booking.

11.	TERMS AND CONDITIONS

It is understood and agreed between all parties that the Renter and permitted occupants of the Rental Property will abide by the following terms and conditions, and that any breach thereof will, at the Owner's option, give the Owner the right to declare this Rental Agreement null and void, and said term ended, and the Owner shall have the right to re-enter the Rental Property and remove or have removed all persons therefrom, and in such event, Renter agrees to forfeit all payments made on account of this Rental Agreement and all remedies and rights they may possess hereunder:

(a)	Guests: No other persons shall occupy the Rental Property at any time, except those registered in this Rental Agreement. Occupancy of the Rental Property is limited to _10   persons. Absolutely no overnight visitors are allowed. Violation of occupancy limits can and will result in all occupants being removed from the Rental Property, and forfeiture of Renter’s rent and security deposit.

(b)	Noise: The Renter shall not make or permit any excessive, disturbing or annoying noise in or on the grounds of the Rental Property by himself, his family, agents, servants or visitors, nor permit such persons to do anything that will interfere with the rights, comforts, or conveniences of neighbors or other persons in the surrounding area. No noise is permitted after 11:00 p.m. per VBP community rules.

(c)	Consumption of Alcohol: There shall be no consumption  of alcoholic beverages in or on the grounds of the Rental Property by any minor under twenty-one (21) years of age, and there shall be no congregation or drinking on the porches, steps, street or adjoining areas surrounding the Rental Property.

(d)	Smoking: There shall be no smoking in or on the grounds of the Rental Property.

(e)	Illegal Drugs: There shall be no use of any illegal drugs by any Renters, occupants or visitors in or on the grounds of the Rental Property.

(f)	Pets: Renter shall be allowed to bring _1  pet(s) on the premises. The pet fee is $100.00 per pet for the Rental Period. Prior permission must be granted. Within _14_ days of reservation, Renter must provide Owner with the following information regarding the pet(s), for Owner’s consent: (i) type of pet (including breed), (ii) size of pet, (iii) age of pet, and (iv) confirmation that pet is neutered or spayed. No pet which has not been neutered or spayed will be allowed in or on the Rental Property. Current veterinary certificates must be provided, as well as proof of a flea/tick preventative program. PETS ARE NOT ALLOWED ON FURNITURE OR BEDDING. Renter is responsible for cleaning up after the pet(s), both inside the Rental Property and on the grounds, and for paying for any damages to the Rental Property or its contents caused by the pet(s).

(g)	Complaints: Any complaints to the Police Department concerning the behavior of the Renter, Renter’s family, other occupants, guests or visitors while occupying the Rental Property shall, at the Owner’s sole option, result in immediate termination of this Rental Agreement.

(h)	Right of Access: Owner or the Owner’s agent shall have the right but not the obligation to enter into the Rental Property and upon the premises, at all reasonable hours, to investigate disturbances, check occupancy, check for damage, to make such repairs, alterations or improvements thereto as Owner may deem appropriate, but the Owner agrees not to exercise this right in such a way as to unreasonably interfere with the quiet enjoyment of the Renter.

(i)	Recycling: The Renters are responsible for the separation of recyclable materials according to local, state and federal regulations. If any fines are levied against the property address during the Term of this Lease, the Renter shall be responsible for such fines and these will be deducted from the security deposit.

(j)	Trash: Trash and recycling bins are located exterior of the cottage. Trash pick-up is on Monday. It is the Renter’s responsibility to ensure that the trash bin gets set out [at the curb or other location where trash pick-up occurs], and returned to its proper location after trash collection.

(k)	Parking: Parking is available only in the driveway. Renter is responsible for ensuring that all occupants and guests park their vehicles in such areas and in such a manner as to comply with municipal by-laws and to avoid causing a hazard or impediment to passing traffic or pedestrians.

(l)	Pay Per View / Programming Charges: The Renter is liable for ordering any pay per view or other programming charge plus an additional $25.00 charge per program or event, the costs of which will be billed to the guest.

(m)	Lock-Out Policy: In the event the Renter and/or other registered occupants are locked out of the premises, the Renter must contact the Owner or caretaker for a replacement key.

(n)	Damage to Rental Property and Contents: The Renter and all registered occupants of the Rental Property shall be liable for all damages caused during their occupancy. Cost of repairs and/or replacement shall be deductible from the security deposit and additional costs shall include attorney's fees and costs, if incurred in the collection.

(o)	Renter’s Personal Property: The Renter will remove all personal property belonging to the Renter or other occupants at the end of the Rental Period. Any property that is left on the premises becomes the property of the Owner and may be thrown out. Any expenses incurred for removal of Renter’s property will be deducted from the security deposit.

(p)	Indemnification: Renter agree to indemnify and save harmless the Owner from any liabilities, damages, costs or expenses whatsoever arising from or related to any claim or litigation which may arise out of or in connection with Renter’s use and occupancy of the Rental Property including but not limited to any claim or liability for personal injury or damage or theft of property which is made, incurred or sustained by Renter. The term “Owner” as used in this Agreement shall include Owner’s heirs, successors in interest, assigns, employees, managers, and representatives where the context requires or permits. The terms “Renter,” “You,” and “Your” as used in this Agreement shall include Renter’s heirs, successors, assigns, guests, invitees, representatives and other persons on the Rental Property during Renter’s occupancy (without regard to whether such persons have authority under this Agreement to be upon the Rental Property), where the context requires or permits.

12.	Breach of Lease, Default by Renter

Owner and Renter agree that every condition, covenant, and provision of this lease is material. A breach of any condition, covenant, or provision of this lease by Renter will constitute a material breach. For any material breach by Renter, Owner may provide Renter with a written 10-day notice that describes the breach and demands that Renter cure the default. If Renter does not cure the default within the 10days, or if a cure is not possible, this Lease will be terminated.

In the event of breach by Renter, Owner reserves all rights and remedies conferred under the laws of the State of New York, including the right to terminate the lease, the right to immediate possession of the premises, and the right to all damages. Additionally, the parties agree that the following provisions apply to a breach of this lease by Renter:

If Renter breaches this lease and abandons the property before the end of the term, or if Owner terminates Renter's right to possession because of Renter's breach of this lease, Owner may recover from Renter:

(a)	The worth at the time of award of the unpaid Rent that had been earned at the time of termination;

(b)	The worth at the time of the award of the amount by which the unpaid Rent that would have been earned after termination until the time of award exceeds the amount of the rental loss that Renter proves could have been reasonably avoided;

(c)	The worth at the time of award of the amount by which the unpaid Rent for the balance of the Rental Period after the time of award exceeds the amount of the rental loss for the period that Renter proves could be reasonably avoided; and

(d)	Any other amount necessary to compensate Owner for all the detriment proximately caused by Renter's failure to perform Renter's obligations under this lease, or that in the ordinary course of things would be likely to result from that failure.
 
13.	Registered Occupants:

All occupants of the Rental Property must be listed in this Rental Agreement and each occupant over the age of eighteen (18) years shall be equally responsible for observing the Terms and Conditions specified in this Rental Agreement. Each adult occupant will be jointly and severally financially responsible for damage done to the Rental Property beyond normal wear and tear. The Renter's signature certifies that Renter is over eighteen (18) years of age, has read this Agreement, and understands that breach of any terms can and will result in loss of the security deposit plus any additional costs.

Name	Address	18 years or older?
		
14.	Renter’s Responsibilities at Check-Out Time:

At Check-Out Time, the Renter shall give over possession of the Rental Property to the Owner in the same condition of cleanliness, order, and repair as it was when the Renter took possession at Check-In Time. Our housekeeper will be coming to clean after your departure, but we ask that you are courteous and respectful of her and please don’t leave the place trashed or a huge mess for her to have to cleanup. Renter shall ensure that all of the following items are taken care of:
(a)	appliances and work surfaces in the kitchen must be clean;
(b)	dishes, pots and pans and utensils must be clean and put away and dishwasher emptied;
(c)	floors should be swept or cleaned of any spills;
(d)	any food in the refrigerator must be removed and disposed of, and the refrigerator left in a clean condition;
(e)	any spills in stove burners must be cleaned up, and the range top and oven left in a clean condition;
(f)	the bathrooms should be tidied. Don’t forget to check behind the door for any swimsuits or other personal items that might be left behind;
(g)	Linens and towels must be deposited in the laundry hamper provided in and left in the laundry room. Guests are asked to wash/dry one load of towels before they leave as there is not enough time for the housekeeper to get everything laundered before the next guests arrive;
(h)	the furnishings and grounds shall also be left in the same state they were in at Check-In Time;
(i)	all trash must be bagged, taken out and placed in the trash bins provided;
(j)	Renter must ensure that all doors and windows are properly secured and locked.
(k)	All air conditioners and fans must be turned off or the heat left on 60˚, depending on the outside temperature;
(l)	all occupants must vacate the Rental Property by the Check-Out Time. A late check-out fee of $50.00 per hour (or portion of each hour) will be charged for all late check-outs.

In the event that the Renter fails to comply with this Section, the Owner may at his option, complete the work, clean or repair and deduct the cost from the security deposit held by the Owner. Nothing in this lease shall in any way prevent the Owner’s right to recover any sum due in excess of the security deposit.

15.	Acts of God:

Owner shall not be liable for events beyond Owner’s control which may interfere with Renter’s occupancy of the Rental Property, including but not limited to acts of God, acts of governmental agencies, fire, strikes, war, inclement weather or noise from nearby construction sites. NO REBATE OR REFUND will be offered in these circumstances.

16.	Assignment, Subletting, Amendments:

This Agreement can only be changed by an agreement in writing by both the Renter and the Owner. The Renter may not assign this Rental Agreement or sublet the Rental Property under any circumstances.

17.	Entire Agreement:

This document, including any attachments incorporated by reference herein, constitutes the entire and sole agreement between Owner and Renter with respect to the subject matter hereof, and correctly sets forth the obligations of Owner and Renter to each other as of the date hereof. Any agreements or representations by Owner to Renter with respect to the subject matter of this agreement not expressly set forth herein are null and void.

18.	Attorney’s Fees

In the event that it is necessary to retain an attorney to enforce the terms of this Lease, the prevailing party shall be entitled to reasonable attorney’s fees and court costs required to do so. All legal proceedings must take place in Chautauqua County, New York.

PET ADDENDUM
Any GUEST wishing to bring dogs to the Property must read, understand, and abide by the rules outlined in this Addendum, the primary purpose of which is to ensure that safe and sanitary surroundings are provided for all GUESTS, visitors and the OWNER or Owner’s employees, to protect the physical integrity of the property, and to protect and provide for the well-being of the dogs themselves.

AUTHORIZATION OF PET(S) AT PROPERTY LOCATION:
Vicious/dangerous dogs trained for dog fighting or with any tendency or disposition to attack any dog other domestic animals or humans without provocation, are not permitted at any time. Any dog with a recorded history of biting is strictly prohibited.
Homeowner grants permission to Guest(s) to keep the pet(s) described herein on the Premises (also referred to as "Property") subject to the terms and conditions of the Lease and this Addendum. Homeowner may revoke permission at any time if Guest(s) fails to comply with any of the terms of the Lease and this Addendum.

PET DESCRIPTION(S):
Guest(s) are permitted to keep the following pet(s) described herein on the Property (If requested by Homeowner, documentation may be required by an accredited veterinarian prior to stay)

Type of Pet(s): Name of Pet(s): Weight of Pet(s): Age of Pet:

Spayed Neutered Is Pet(s) Declawed: Yes  No

Is Pet(s) Licensed: Yes  No
Is Pet Housebroken: Yes  No
Has your Pet ever bitten or injured another person: Yes  No
If yes, please describe incident:

PET FEE:
In addition to any other fees, Guest will pay $100 per pet(s) for a total length of time that the pet(s) is/are on the Premises. This fee shall be payable according to the terms in the Lease agreement referred to in this Addendum. No more than 2 pets will be allowed on the premises.

PET CONTROL:
Homeowner agrees to comply with all the applicable statutes, ordinances, restrictions, homeowner's association rules, and other enforceable regulations regarding any pet(s), including licensing the pet(s), if applicable. Pets permitted in rental home only as arranged in advance. Addition of any other pet is prohibited without prior approval. You are solely responsible for any damaged or personal injury caused by your dog. To bring your pet(s), guest(s) must agree to the following terms:

Prior To Arrival
•	Guest must confirm that all pets are fully trained, well behaved, and obedient.
•	Guest must confirm that all pets are fully housebroken/potty trained.
•	Pets must be treated for fleas and ticks at least 2-3 days prior to guest arrival.
•	Pets must be up-to-date on all treatments, medications, and all immunizations.
•	Pets must be cleaned and groomed before your visit, particularly if it is a breed prone to shedding.  Pet hair can be difficult to remove, and the next renter in may not have a pet or may be allergic. Extra cleaning fees will be charged for furniture, blankets, comforters, etc. that have pet hair left behind.
•	Guests agree to pay any costs for damage done by pet(s) that exceeds the policy limit or is not covered under the damage insurance policy.
•	Guests must bring a pet crate or plan to keep pets in the gated off pet area designated by the homeowner when they will be leaving pets alone in the house to prevent damage while you are away.
•	Guest agrees to abide by all local, city, or state ordinances, licensing, and health requirements regarding pets, including vaccinations and other listed concerns

During Your Stay
•	Pets are NOT PERMITTED on any of the furniture, beds, or bedding at any time. Just because you allow your pets on your furniture and beds at your home does not mean it is allowed in our cottage. Extra cleaning fees will be charged for furniture, blankets, comforters, etc. that have pet hair left behind. Any evidence of pets on any of the furniture or beds may incur extra cleaning fees. It may be helpful to bring something (bed, blanket, etc.) on which you know your pet will be comfortable sleeping.
•	Please keep your dog groomed, particularly if it is a breed prone to shedding.
•	WET or DIRTY pets are not permitted inside of the cottage.  Please use the outdoor shower to rinse off or bath your pet and use a pet towel to dry off. Please wipe muddy paws with a pet towel before letting pets inside the cottage. Guest linens and towels should never be used on your pet!
•	Guest agrees to immediately clean up after the pet, both inside and outside the premises of and to dispose of any pet waste promptly and properly.
•	Please clean up after your dog, both in public areas and in the front and back yard of the property.
•	Guests agree to keep their dog under control at all times.
•	Guests agree to keep dog(s) from being noisy or aggressive, and from causing any annoyance or discomfort to others. Guests will remedy any complaints immediately.
•	Please do not allow your dog to bark excessively or to roam onto neighboring properties. Please respect the comfort and privacy of other residents. Complaints may lead to eviction without refund. This will be at the sole discretion of the homeowner.
•	Pet(s) are not to be left unattended anywhere on the premises inside or out. A crate is ideal for those situations in which you must leave or you may put your pet in the designated pet area that can be closed off. You are responsible for any damages your pet causes.
•	Guests agree to promptly report any damage caused by pet(s). If damages are not reported but are found by owners, it will be documented and necessary replacement or repair costs will be charged to guest(s) credit card on file or billed to guest.
•	Guests agree to adhere to local ordinances, leash laws and licensing requirements.
•	All excess dog hair will be swept, vacuumed or otherwise picked up and removed from the inside of the unit prior to departure. 
•	Guest agrees not to leave food or water for the pet outside the premises, where it may attract other animals.
•	Guests agree to immediately pay for any damage, loss, or expense caused by the pet. Any payment not made for such damage or expense will be considered as additional rent due.
•	Please follow the VBP rules which are stated as followed “Dogs are permitted on the beach from dawn to 10:00 am, and from 5:00 pm to 7:30 pm.  Dogs must be leashed (unless in the water), and under control at all times". 
 Dogs must be confined in yards, indoors, or on a restraint at all times. Dogs should not be allowed to defecate on private property or Association property, parks, or playgrounds. Dog owners are encouraged to have and use a “pooper scooper.”
•	Failure to comply with the terms of this addendum shall give Owner the right to revoke permission to keep the pet, and is also grounds for immediate termination of the rental agreement, and guests shall be liable for any damages caused by the pet and the deposit shall be applied to said damages.
•	Homeowner assumes no liability for injury or illness to pet(s) or humans while on the premises. Guest(s) are responsible for their pet(s) at all times while on the premises. Guest(s) shall take all reasonable action to insure that the pet(s) described herein do not violate the rights of other persons on the Property, and shall not permit the pet(s) to bark, howl, snarl, or otherwise create any noise at such a level, frequency, or time as to disturb other Guests or Homeowners.
•	Tenant agrees to indemnify, hold harmless, and defend owner against all loss, liability and judgments, expenses (including attorney fees), or claims by third parties for any injury to any person or damage to property of any kind whatsoever caused by the Tenant pet(s).

PET REMOVAL:
If Homeowner receives any written or verbal complaints from neighboring Homeowners or Guests regarding the Pet(s) staying on the Property and Guest(s) fails to come into compliance with the conditions described above, this may result in additional fees.

GUEST'S LIABILITIES:
Guest(s) shall be responsible for all damages to the Premises caused by the pet(s) described herein, including but not limited to carpets, doors, walls, drapes, wallpaper, windows, screens, furniture, appliances, sod, yards, fences, or landscaping. Upon termination of the Lease or removal of the pet(s) from the Premises, whichever occurs first, and if any part of the Premises leased by Guest were damaged or fouled by the pet(s) or infested with fleas/Ticks, Guest shall be responsible for the cost for professional carpet cleaning, treatment for flea/Tick infestation, and any other repair or replacement required and related to property damage caused by Guest's pet(s). These repair or replacement costs, and all additional costs must be paid by Guest(s) immediately upon demand by Homeowner.

ACCESS TO PREMISES:
Guest must remove or confine any pet(s) at any time that the pet(s) are likely to limit or to prohibit Homeowner or other authorized persons access to Premises as permitted by the Lease.

INDEMNIFICATION:
To the extent permitted by law, Guest(s) agrees to indemnify, hold harmless, and defend Homeowner, and Homeowners property manager (if there is one), and Homeowners agents from any and all damages, expenses, and reasonable attorney's fees, if any, which Homeowner may suffer or incur in connection with the act or acts of any pet(s) described herein.

DEFAULT:
If Guest(s) breaches any provision in this Addendum, Homeowner may exercise any or all of the remedies described in the lease.

This is a LEGALLY BINDING CONTRACT: IF ANY OF THE TERMS ARE UNCLEAR TO YOU, YOU ARE ADVISED TO SEEK INDEPENDENT LEGAL ADVICE FROM AN ATTORNEY.

IF YOU FEEL THAT YOU OR YOUR PET(S) ARE UNABLE TO COMPLY OR FAIL TO MEET THE REQUIREMENTS OF OUR PET POLICY AS STATED ABOVE PLEASE LET ME KNOW. IF YOU ARE NO LONGER ABLE TO BRING YOUR PET WE WILL REFUND ANY PET FEES YOU HAVE PAID.

hosts.about: My name s Dana. I am self employed as a Psychotherapist. I love to travel and spend time with family and friends.

recent.comments: A beautiful and peaceful place to stay.  Thank you!

items.comments: A beautiful and peaceful place to stay.  Thank you!

We had the most relaxing vacation at Dana’s house! The house was gorgeous and so clean. Dana provided so many extra I wasn’t expecting. It really made our stay so much easier. Dana was readily available to answer all of my questions and went out of her way to make sure we were comfortable. I can’t recommend staying here enough!
Lovely home.
So relaxing! We had a great time!

The house is lovely and the pool area so inviting. Everyone even did a little jumping on the trampoline. The location is perfect. We went to Niagara on the Lake several times, including for kayaking. We loved hiking in the Niagara Gorge—great views—and had some delicious meals at Tide and Vine and OddBird.   Sad to leave!
It is a beautiful home with great space and a great kitchen. The backyard is a great place to just hangout as well.
Amazing place for our family!

description.summary: Large home, just steps from Henley Island. Walking distance to Beaches in Port Dalhousie, as well as bars and restaurants.
description.space:
Please enjoy the entire house. There are 2 different living spaces on the main floor, if you have a large group. The backyard is large and private. Enjoy the fire pit with Adirondack chairs. There is also a sitting area in a pergola with fire table. The basement is private with 3 piece bathroom ( 5th bedroom). There is a queen bed, and queen air mattress, large sectional couch and oversized TV.
Beautiful backyard oasis with luxury oversized pool.

description.notes: Port Dalhousie is famous for the Henley Regatta. We are steps to Henley island. Niagara Falls and Niagara on the Lake are about 20 minutes by car.

The kids enjoyed playing in the basement and also outside on the large patio with a view.  The house was very clean and fully stocked with cooking utensils, spices and cleaning supplies. items.comments: My group and I enjoyed our stay at this AirBnB in Ellicottville.  Our group consisted of family- 6 adults and 3 kids under the age of 7.  The kids enjoyed playing in the basement and also outside on the large patio with a view.  The house was very clean and fully stocked with cooking utensils, spices and cleaning supplies. Absolutely enjoyed my stay!! Great Host, Great communication. The Airbnb was everything that was listed, and better! Spotless and beautiful, We will definitely be staying again! No complaints at all.

This house was beautiful inside and out. It was a great getaway for a group of girls. I enjoyed that it was secluded. The host was very friendly and responsive. You can tell they care about the properly. There was corn hole, a fire pit and other games to play. 10/10 recommend for a weekend away with friends or family.

We had an amazing time at the chalet! Words can’t describe how beautiful the house was. Looked even better than the pictures! The surroundings were beautiful and relaxing. The house was very clean and the master suite was very luxurious! Great space to entertain in the kitchen/living area and the outside patio was great! We spent most of our time at the fire pit and were provided with unlimited fire wood by our hosts. The only slight downfall was that the hot tub was not functioning properly on our arrival night. We contacted our host and she was very quick to respond and remedy the situation. We had a repairman arrive the next morning to fix the issue but unfortunately we did not have enough time to reheat and put it to use before we left. No worries though, because there was plenty to do in Ellicottville! We had a blast at the aerial park and riding the mountain coaster. We also spent a great day at Allegheny state park beach which was only a short drive away!
Jaclyn was a great host. We loved the place the amenities and the beautiful nature surrounding this cozy and well equipped house! This place is worth every penny!
very nice place to stay right down the road from town.  very secluded, just what we were looking for. plenty of space for a large family.
Great stay and great host!

description.summary:
Kick back and relax with friends & family in this calm, stylish space.

This custom built chalet is nestled on 7 private acres, with sweeping views of the valley.

Prepare a meal in the chef's kitchen, soak in the hot tub under the stars, have a bonfire after a day exploring or make a drink in the basement bar. There is so much for you to enjoy!
description.space:
CHEF'S KITCHEN & DINING AREA

The spacious open concept kitchen is a space to bring people together. Perch up at the huge island and watch the chef of the group whip a meal together with the top of the line appliances including a gas stove, sub-zero fridge/freezer, wine fridge, dishwasher & microwave.

The kitchen has pots, pans, dishware, cutlery, baking sheets, wine glasses, spices and most things you will need to enjoy lovely meals inside. We also provide BBQ utensils for grilling season.

We have both a Keurig and a regular drip coffee pot as well as an electric tea kettle. We provide ground coffee and tea bags to get your mornings started right! We also offer basic kitchen amenities such as olive oil, salt, pepper, aluminum foil and plastic wrap.

Next to the open kitchen is a spacious dining room with a table that accommodates up to 10 people. 

LIVING ROOM

The oversized stylish living room is a great spot for the group to sit and chat, or watch TV.  We provide board games and the TV has access to Spectrum cable as well as popular streaming sites such as Netflix. 

Turn the gas fireplace on to make it extra cozy!


MASTER BEDROOM & ENSUITE

The gorgeous master bedroom is situated on the main level and features a King bed, TV, an enormous walk in closet with custom cabinetry as well as a serene ensuite.

The ensuite has a huge double vanity, walk in shower and a soaker tub overlooking the vast forest. Light a candle and enjoy a book in this relaxing space.


GUEST BEDROOMS

On the main level, adjacent to the master bedroom is a guest bedroom with a queen and a twin bed.

The lower level has a second master bedroom with King bed, closet and views overlooking the valley. 

There are two other bedrooms in the lower level including a room with a Double bed and Twin trundle , TV, desk and closet, and a fifth bedroom with two twin beds. 

There are two twin blow up mattresses, a pack and play and a toddler cot for additional sleeping.


LOWER LEVEL LIVING ROOM & BAR

A custom built bar awaits downstairs to enjoy with family & friends!  Complete with a wine fridge, sink and bar stools so you can whip up cocktails or pour a glass of wine for the evening.

There is a huge wraparound comfy couch so you can gather and play board games or watch the game or a movie on the large Smart TV. 


BATHROOMS & LAUNDRY

In addition to the master ensuite, there is a powder room on the main level and a spacious bathroom in the lower level with a walk in shower. 

There is a laundry room with a washer/dryer on the lower level for your use. Detergent is provided.

Regular bath, face hand towels as well as hot tub towels are provided.


OUTDOOR SPACE / HOT TUB / FIREPIT

Step out of the kitchen and you will find an outdoor oasis to enjoy! There is a hot tub, BBQ, dining table, loungers, a hammock and sectional couch for you to bring the living outdoors. 

Light a fire and roast marshmallows at the bonfire pit, with gorgeous views over the valley.

Lawn games such as corn hole, croquet, Spike Ball and Jenga are there for you to enjoy.


LOCATION

Located on a beautiful piece of land, close to the local hills and attractions. Here are distances to local places:

HoliMont Ski Club: 2 miles
Downtown Ellicottville: 3 miles
Holiday Valley Ski Resort: 4 miles


OTHER ITEMS INCLUDED

- Free wifi
- High chair, pack and play, toddler cot and kids toys provided
- All linens and towels provided
- Free parking for unlimited cars
- 3 pairs of snowshoes are provided
- Indoor and outdoor games are provided
description.house_rules: Minimal noise levels after 10pm

We enjoyed a family reunion in this lovely house on Lake Ontario. The five bedrooms provided ample space for all of our group with the extra 'small' beds well-placed and comfortable. description.summary:
You will have 2-Floor rooms in the beautiful villa sitting in a 2/3 acre garden on the bank of Ontario Lake. Bed rooms -5 and 1/2 washrooms in a three-dwelling house.

Rooms/ Bed and Breakfast/ 1 month lease available. No Party or event is allowed in backyard according to the Grimsby bylaw.

- 1st and 2nd floor (3400 square feet) in the main house:
bedrooms, full kitchen, great room, formal living room, 5 1/2 bathrooms. B&B on request.

- Large sunroom with a heated exercise pool, Lake terrace
description.space:
A one of a kind private lakefront property (Bed and Breakfast) Stoney Creek/Hamilton/Grimsby area in southern Ontario, the gateway to Niagara Falls and in the heart of the wine region.

2 FLOORS IN THE MAIN HOUSE, SUNROOM, TERRACE
Features
- Beautiful large kitchen with breakfast table
- Octagonal formal living room.
- Great room (family room and dining room combination).
- A large sunroom with an indoor small heated exercise pool can be used as a 2-seated massage.
- Terrace (rooftop patio).
- Parking for 12 vehicles+ 
- Lower patio, sitting area by the lake  (from April 1 to December 1).
- The upper patio overlooks the lake is opened when it is clear of snow or ice.

Guest access
You'll have private access to:
- 1st and 2nd floor (3400 square feet) in the main house:
bedrooms with 5 1/2 washrooms, a full kitchen, a great room, a formal living room, a full backyard, a lake patio, and a backyard garden.

The structural division of the house consists of three dwellings.

The structural division of the house/bedrooms.
1st - Main floor - One queen bed, one twin bed, washroom. (Side View)
2nd - First floor - One queen bed, one twin bed, washroom. (Lake View)
3rd - First floor - One queen bed, one twin bed, washroom. (Lake View)
4th -First floor - One queen bed, one twin bed, washroom. (Front View)
5th - First floor - One queen bed, one twin bed, washroom. (Forest View)
Living Room - Facing the view of Ontaio Lake, powder room.
Kitchen - Facing the indoor pool area.
Indoor pool- Facing the back garden.
Basement and Studio

The owner occupies the other spaces of the house, Guest will get access to the three bedrooms. Even though the house has multiple dwellings, it will be rented to only one team of guests at a time. So guests can enjoy 100% privacy in backyard. Extra bedrooms are available on request for couples. As this is a big property the separate studio above the garage is occupied by owner. This studio is not connected with house and have a separate entrance and guest will not see us. Owner use one parking spot and will not access backyard or any other place. 

Attractions
- Large sunroom with a heated therapy pool, terrace
- Dine in the formal dining room
- 8000 sq/ft loan grass plain ground garden facing Ontario lake.
- Concrete Lake Patio with steps to the lake.
- Touch the water from the patio.
- Natural creek side waterfalls view from the patio.
- Picnic under the willow tree.
- Short drive to wonderful wineries.
- 21 acres for hiking Bruce Trail.
- Kayak/Canoe launch (on the backyard).

Not listed
- Garage and garage studio not listed
- Basement on separate request only (separate dwelling)
- Fireplace (on the main floor)
- Bath tub (main washroom)
- Breakfast upon request.

You have to bring
1) Bath towels
2) Face towels
3) Swimming towels

For more than six guests, we will charge $50 per guest per day. Fare will be automatically added on the final invoice. 

You can enjoy 100% privacy in the house, garden, and lakeside patio. (Basement is a separate dwelling and is connected with the house with a door).

Designated Waterfront Trail running in front of the house; also Bruce Trail on the ridge of the escarpment about 2 Km away. Public beaches in walking distance (600 meters away).

Free puplic boat launching park 2.1/2 minutes

No better way to feel off-the-grid than cozying up to a bonfire, under the stars and with the tall pines swaying around you.
Fantastic Skiing! Holiday Valley - also known as 'Aspen of the East' - was just ranked #2 by Ski Magazine for best skiing in eastern US (7-8 min)
6 minutes to the 20 lane tubing park (including 3 group lanes) that's 900 feet long with a 100 foot vertical drop!
Ellicottville's charming village that looks out of a hallmark movie - great restaurants & bars, shops, year round festivals & more! (4 min)
Golfing: The 'Double Black Diamond' course at Holiday Valley offers a great blend of a mountain and flat terrain, winding through the base of the mountains, with spectacular views.
Ellicottville is known for an awesome variety and lineup of year round festivals, concerts and events!  Mardi Gras, Fall Festival (Oktoberfest) & Summer Music Festival are some of our favorites!
Ski Flyer Mountain Coaster! Ride solo (or with a child) and you control your speed with levers. Open just before Christmas through late March (check online schedule).
EVL is one of the best cycling destinations in the east with extensive trail network through Alleghany State Forest, Holiday Valley and HoliMont
Alleghany State Park - one of the country's National Parks you don't want to miss - 64,800 acre park with hiking, biking, canoeing/kayaking, caves, camping, and a beautiful lake (~20 min from chalet)

We stayed with two other families (6 adults, 3 kids total) for 5 nights and couldn’t have had a more pleasurable vacation. Extreme clean and top notch. Almost every small thing needed for a stay was present. Beautiful property especially the hot tub and sauna. And mesmerising view from the 
.

Dean's place is very well equipped.  A chef's kitchen for those who like to cook.  Plenty of space and private areas.  A lot of thought was put into what guests might need or enjoy.  Our grand daughter loved the teepee!  Dean was very responsive and helpful with any questions or concerns we had.  Ellicottville is a quaint town with lots of great restaurants and bars.  And just down the road is Horn Hill pottery which is a great place to visit.  I highly recommend.
We had a fantastic friends weekend here! Plenty of space to hang out, hot tub/sauna/firepit all great additions. Beds were comfy, location was great. Would definitely come back!

description.summary:
Welcome to our luxe Après Chalet!

Beautifully renovated with design & comfort in mind, we're thrilled to welcome you to our gorgeous chalet featuring amazing views, luxe interior design and crowd-pleasing amenities (outdoor hot-tub, barrel sauna, fire-pit & more)

This beautiful & private lot is surrounded by mature pine trees with amazing views of EVL skiing. Easy access to the center Ellicottville (4 min) and skiing, hiking/mountain biking trails, tubing, golfing & more (4-8 min)
description.space:
After a day of outdoor fun, skiing or golfing, we can't wait to welcome you to enjoy the luxe design, amazing views and premium outdoor amenities (outdoor hot-tub, barrel sauna & fire-pit) of our Après Chalet!

Truly a cabin goer's dream, our spacious (3,000+ sf) chalet offers a private, off-the-grid feel with amazing views, while being just 4 minutes to the center of Ellicottville's beautiful village! The open concept design & A-frame great room ceiling provides a bright and comfy setting whether relaxing by the fireplace or mingling around the fully stocked chef's kitchen featuring a wine fridge, gas stove-top, and solid wood dining table for your group to gather. 

Fun for the who family: shuffleboard, air hockey, board & lawn games, 6x large SmartTVs (50-65"), DirectTV Satellite service, dart board, record player, and popcorn machine & kid's fort that'll make the kid's say OMG!

Working remotely & surfing streaming apps is a breeze with high-speed, fiber optic, WiFi throughout & an upstairs work area. Great cell signal. 

Bring your (fur)babies: pack n play, high chair, baby gate, and dog crate provided. Up to 2 pets (cats or dogs) are welcome, but please include them at the time of booking as we have a pet fee. See our 'House Rules' for dog breeds we're not able to accommodate. Please inquire if you have 3 pets and we may be able to make a special exception.

We can't wait to welcome you to our Après Chalet!


ADDITIONAL CHALET AMENITIES
* Full size washer/dryer
* Private driveway with ample parking 
* High quality linens & towels, and robes for the hot-tub & sauna 
* Mud room with skiing storage
* Seamless check-in with keyless entry

OUTDOOR FEATURES
* Hot-tub 
* Barrel sauna
* Bonfire with firewood provided
* BBQ
* Plenty of lawn games 
* Patio with amazing views & outdoor furniture outside of winter
* Lot surrounded by mature pine trees provides a serene, off-the grid feel

AREA ATTRACTIONS
* Ellicottville's charming village that looks out of a hallmark movie - great restaurants & bars, shops, year round festivals & more! (4 min)
* Fantastic Skiing! Holiday Valley - also known as 'Aspen of the East' - was just ranked #2 by Ski Magazine for best skiing in eastern US (7-8 min)
* Holiday Valley Tubing Park (4 min)
* Golfing & Holiday Valley Mountain Coaster (<10 min) 
* Alleghany State Park - one of the country's National Parks you don't want to miss - 64,800 acre park with hiking, biking, canoeing/kayaking, caves, camping, and a beautiful lake (~20 min)
* Vineyards & wineries of the Forestville area (~50 min)
description.access: All of it!
description.house_rules: Up to 2 pets (cats or dogs only) are permitted, with the exception of the following dogs that are prohibited: (1) Pit bull/pit bull mix including, but not limited to, American Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier, Staffordshire Bull Terrier and Bull Terrier; or (2) any dog with aggressive tendencies or prior bite history.

my bf and i had a wonderful stay at sue’s beautiful home for 10 days. the house was fully stocked with everything we needed and designed with lots of impeccable artwork and furniture. sue’s airbnb is in a great location in the leslieville community filled with yummy restaurants, groceries and even transit which was super convenient for us. sue was very communicative and helpful with any questions we had. her neighbours were very friendly and we enjoyed having a brief conversation with them. this is honestly one of the best airbnbs i’ve ever been to and i will definitely book again if available. with that being said, i strongly recommend sue’s lovely home to other guests!

Suzanne’s house is beautiful, and was the perfect space for me and my sister to meet up and share.  Well stocked but it is a used home so it has everything you would need.  Some lovely artwork and a plethora of lighting options! 

The adjoining neighbours do have small children and it was quite noisy at times when we were there during the day/early eve but thankfully not at night.

Plenty of food options in Leslieville itself (loved Chula) but so easy to get in and out of GTA on the streetcars and buses. You need a presto card first (we dodged a fare on our first use as we didn’t have a card and didn’t have any coins to purchase a ticket in the streetcar!) which you can buy in Stations or Shoppers Drug Mart.

The No.83 bus (Jones Ave and Sproat) will take you to Loblaws for all your food shopping needs, and back again).

We had a lovely stay and really enjoyed exploring Toronto.

My friends and I enjoyed spending a week in this beautiful home. The backyard is gorgeous, the house was spotless and well appointed, and our host was quick to respond if I had a question. (She also reached out a couple of times with additional helpful information.) We were a little surprised at how well sound carried throughout the house, but it wasn't an issue for us. The rooms were comfortable, and having a washer and drier available for our use was really helpful. The neighborhood was quiet, and the house is located in a low-traffic neighborhood. Our friend got married at the Royal Canadian Yacht Club, and the house was just a short Uber ride to the RCYC ferry.

I would definitely recommend this home to anyone looking for a place to stay in Toronto.
Great stay in a developing neighborhood. Home was perfect for a week long trip. Host was welcoming and communicated well.
What a beautiful home!
Great place. Great location. Highly recommended.

description.neighborhood: Safe and friendly Leslieville has so much to offer. The neighbourhood is full of good restaurants, bars and great shopping. It is 5 mins. up to the Danforth, Greektown and Little India,  and 5 minutes down to Queen St E., 10 Minutes down to the Beach and 20 mins to downtown Toronto. There are loads of bicycle paths along the streets and in the extensive nearby ravine system.

这是个极品的渡假胜地别墅，面临安大略湖可以游泳（夏季，你应该有很好的游泳水平），从别墅下湖，都是细细的沙滩，别墅内所有一切，不是你想不到，而是他比你想得更加完善，我们六位来自中国大陆、香港和新加坡，住了五天，非常难忘。主人极其负责，当我们遇到问题时，不仅第一时间回答，而且亲临别墅解决。我会非常推荐亲朋好友，如果我第二次光临多伦多，别无选择，就是这栋别墅！再次赞美别墅主人拥有如此捧的物业，并分享给全球喜欢旅游的客人。建议：1、应该修改下到草坪的台阶楼梯，的确走下去有点不安全，尤其是老人和儿童；2、备几条游泳救生衣，我入住温哥华的别墅，主人就配备了三件。

We had a really great time staying here for our trip. The home was laid out exactly as described and shown. Very spacious and comfortable. Highend fixtures with a wonderful master bath and closet. The neighborhood was full of people as it sits on a lake with a local park nearby. But it wasn't loud and we felt completely safe even with all of the foot traffic.  Communication with the host was easy and he was very responsive. The only minor issue was that the home wasn't as clean as I would have liked (towels were still drying upon arrival, some dishes still dirty) but I likened it to the fact that the last guest vacated earlier that day and the cleaning crew was pressed for time. Post-covid, I am extremely particular about cleanliness. I did inform the host and he addressed it. If I'm ever in town again, I would definitely stay here again! Hands down.
This house is clean and decorated very well. The view is fantastic. The beach and walking trail nearby is very nice and convenient. Kitchen is well equipped and has almost everything.

The house was spacious, and as described, with top end utilities (great bath with a wonderful view of the lake) comfortable beds and friendly wildlife. The only concern is that the garden leading down into the lake isn’t really child friendly, but we were aware of this before we booked. In summary, everything was thought of, and well planned. Thank you Jacob!
Amazing water view with 5 star accommodations! Great experience 🤩

description.summary:
Rare 4 bed, 3 bath home with stunning unobstructed lake views. Recently renovated and set right on the lake, this 2200+ square foot home features an open concept main floor with walk-out to a private backyard facing the water. 

Situated on a family friendly lake front promenade only 20 minutes away from the Toronto downtown core yet steps away from one of the city’s major beaches/parks - your oasis but a stone’s throw away from the city!
description.space:
Highlights:

* Fully equipped chef’s kitchen with a large island and all the stainless steel appliances you will ever need: gas stove, oven, 1100 CFM range hood,dishwasher, full-sized fridge, bar fridge and 2 sinks. 
* Living/family room with 60” TV with 7.2 home theatre and walk-out to backyard
* Dining room with 6 person seating and lakeside views (additional seating for 2 at kitchen island)
* Master bedroom with walk-in closet, 62” TV and spa bathroom including double vanity, large luxurious walk-in rain shower with body jets and soaker tub
* Second and third bedrooms furnished with a double and queen size bed, respectively
* Fourth bedroom furnished with a modern day bed (convertible into a queen size bed) - room can also be used as a separate family room and is equipped with 40” TV
* Three-piece bathrooms located on the main and second floor
* Office space on main floor and 500 Mbps (up/down) high speed internet throughout home via wifi
* Ample storage space throughout including custom closets
* Laundry on the second floor (no carrying loads up and down the stairs)
* Private backyard equipped with a gas barbecue and fire table 
* Excellent transport links - 15 minutes from Pearson airport, 5 minutes from major highways and 20 minutes from downtown core (by car or from Long Branch GO train station)
* 4 car parking on private driveway
* Garage & basement access not included
* 2 minute walk to Marie Curtis beach featuring a sandy beach, playground and splash pad, picnic areas, multi-purpose trails and volleyball courts.
description.access:
Perfect for a family or a couple who like their space. Make breakfast in the fully equipped chef’s kitchen before walking to Marie Curtis Beach (two minutes) with a playground with splash pad to entertain the kids or enjoy a leisurely stroll along the beachfront boardwalk and soft sandy beach. Explore the city’s waterfront by renting a bicycle (station at Marie Curtis Park) and explore the 56km Martin Goodman Trail , which runs along Toronto’s waterfront. 

With high speed fibre wifi, check your emails, take a video conference call, steam a movie before jumping on the GO train (7-min walk) into Toronto’s downtown core via Union Station. 

Retreat from the bustle and excitement of the city to your fire table in the backyard and watch and hear the waves crashing or look over the moonlit lake.

Guests will have access to park up to 4 cars on the driveway. Street parking is free.  Keep in mind guests are responsible to abide by all Toronto parking bylaws.
description.notes:
Easy & Secure Check-in: 

No keys to lose or to return! Your vacation home provides a self check in-and-out experience through a secure, keyless entry with an August Smart Lock. You can lock and unlock the door with your smartphone, using a unique virtual key, or personal entry code issued to you for the duration of your stay.

Shopping: 

Head to 1 of 2 nearby shopping malls: Sherway Gardens (5 min) for some designer fashions or some delectable dining, or Dixie Outlet Mall to find some bargains. 

Recreation: 

The Lake House is nestled right on the Martin Goodman (waterfront) Trail. Explore the neighbourhood streets and parkettes, or head 2-min west to Marie Curtis Park and soak in the soothing sounds of crashing waves, watch kite surfers jump through the air, or hit the playground/splashpad with the kiddies.

Feel like a round of golf? Feel free to golf at Lakeview Golf Course (5-min) while the rest of your family/friends explore the waterfront trails or relax at the local beach.
description.neighborhood:
With a rich vibrant history Long Branch is a vibrant residential neighbourhood of Toronto, with a rich past having historical roots planted as being Toronto’s original “cottage country”. In modern times it is composed mostly of single-family homes, store fronts, schools and is overall a safe and beautiful neighbourhood covered by a beautiful canopy of old-growth trees and inhabited by a vibrant community.

Long Branch is divided north-south by the main arterial strip of Lake Shore Boulevard West, which is rich in family-owned restaurants, cafes, markets, pharmacies, and one of Toronto's major colleges, Humber College, South Campus. 

Long Branch's southern border is majestic! It is wrapped by the shores of Lake Ontario (one of North America's five Great Lakes) and is one of few boroughs in which you can own a home along the Toronto waterfront. 

2 beautiful & grand parks straddle Long Branch east and west -- Colonel Samuel Smith Park on the east, and Marie Curtis Park on the west (a 2 min walk away from your home-away-from home). 

Spend your time in Long Branch exploring the Martin Goodman (waterfront) Trail trail), or spend time relaxing in either of the two parks and beaches. 

Tired of relaxing?  Head east towards Toronto's downtown core, only a short 20-minute drive/train-ride away, or if you're feeling adventurous a 60-minute bicycle ride.
description.transit:
The Lake House is on one of Long Branch's most vibrant streets -- Lake Promenade.  All year round, you will find families, bicyclists, nature-lovers, pets, and more moving along on the Promenade.  Transit is highly accessible in Long Branch. 

By Car: 
Guests have access to a 4-car driveway. Street parking is free, however guests are responsible for agreeing to Toronto’s parking bylaws. Major highways are only a 5 minute drive away, which can take you west to the beautiful Niagara region (1-1.5 hr drive) or east towards Toronto's downtown core (20 min).

By Foot: 

The Lake House is nestled right on the Martin Goodman (waterfront) Trail. Explore the neighbourhood streets and parkettes, or head 2-min west to Marie Curtis Park and soak in the soothing sounds of crashing waves, watch kite surfers jump through the air, or hit the playground/splashpad with the kiddies.

By Bicycle: 

Explore the city’s waterfront or the local parks on bicycle. Bicycles are available for rent at the automated bike rental station at Marie Curtis Park just off of Forty Second St a 3-min walk away. The Lake House is situated on Toronto's 56km Martin Goodman Trail , which runs along Toronto’s waterfront. 

By Train: 

No time for parking or don't have a car?  Either hit the GO Train or TTC by walking up to Long Branch GO Station, only a 7-min walk north. Toronto’s downtown core via Union Station is only a 20-min ride away by GO Train.
description.interaction:
Your concierge hosts Janice and Jacob are locals with extensive knowledge of Toronto and the immediate areas.  

We are happy to provide recommendations or help you to make your stay comfortable. 

We are available to answer your questions conveniently and promptly through the Airbnb app.
description.house_rules:
No shoes in the house: please remove shoes at front door. 

Our home is situated in a quiet residential neighbourhood so in consideration of our neighbours we can not accommodate parties or events. 

No additional guests aside from those listed on the reservation without prior consent.  

Please do not rearrange furniture or TV connections: if experiencing challenges please reach out to your hosts.

The beds were very comfortable. Well stocked with linens and towels. Media room was perfect for movie night and watching all the Christmas classics. Given the time of year we weren't able to enjoy the amazing grounds but definitely are thinking of a return visit in the summer to enjoy! Bryan was easy to get ahold of when we needed him and made sure we had everything we needed. And the espresso machine rocks!

description.summary:
Ideally perched on the Stoney Creek Escarpment, our guests will have use of our Lake Ontario, Toronto Skyline, and lower city view home.

In addition to gorgeous views, our home features an inground heated salt-water pool, gourmet kitchen, enormous living room, private tiered movie room, sauna, steam shower, library, formal dining room, jacuzzi tub, barbecue, smart TVs, unlimited internet and basketball court.
description.space:
We are easily accessible to downtown Stoney Creek, QEW, shopping centers, grocery stores, fine dining, fast food restaurants, and places of worship.  We are also a short drive to movie theatres, spas, Wild Waterworks, Confederation Park, outlet malls, wine country, John C Monroe Airport and Lake Ontario

We are perfectly suited for professional business people or families in need of long-term housing. A stay of 30 nights or longer is preferred and a generous discount is offered for this. A booking form/contract is required for all stays. 

We are easily accessible to downtown Stoney Creek, QEW, shopping centers, grocery stores, fine dining and fast food restaurants and places of worship. We are also a short drive to movie theatres, spas, Wild Waterworks, Confederation Park, outlet malls, wine country, John C Monroe Airport and Lake Ontario

description.house_rules:
QUEEN'S ESTATES INC. PROPERTY RENTAL BOOKING TERMS AND CONDITIONS

TERMS & CONDITIONS For the purposes of these terms and conditions, the following terms shall be deemed to mean:

THE OWNER Queen’s Estates Inc., whose business mailing address is 58 King Street West, Stoney Creek, Ontario, Canada, L8G 1H8.

THE CLIENT
The signatory to these Terms and Conditions and the lead name specified on and signatory to the Booking Form, which shall be one and the same, as well as all the named guests on said form.

The booking of the stay constitutes acceptance of these Terms and Conditions by The Client and warrants that he/she is authorized to accept them on behalf of all other booked guests.

HOUSE RULES:
· No smoking.
· No parties or events. This will result in the automatic forfeiture of your security deposit.
· No loud music. Please respect the local, full-time neighbours.
· There is an automatic $50 fee per day for pool heating for all stays requesting a heated pool (A special request will be made once the reservation is confirmed).
· Check-in is any time after 4:00pm. Self check-in with lockbox.
· Check-out is by 11:00am. Unless there are prior arrangements made, there is a $200 plus tax fee for late check-outs. Check-outs after 1:00pm the day of check-out will be subject to a fee of one nights stay at the base nightly rate.

The Client’s vehicles must be parked in the assigned parking spot of The Property. It is not permitted to leave vehicles in the roadway. RVs, trailers, commercial vehicles, and boats are not permitted under any circumstances.

The Owner accepts no responsibility for, and shall not be held liable for, any loss of or changes to the booking that are a consequence of force majeure events, e.g., strikes, floods, fires, airport closures, weather, or any other event beyond The Owner’s direct control. The Owner shall not be held responsible or liable for the loss or interruption of services such as gas, water, electricity, drainage, or television. The Owner shall make every effort to ensure that all the advertised equipment, facilities and services of The Property are available for use throughout the Client’s stay. However, in the unlikely event of the withdrawal or malfunction of any facility or item of equipment, The Owner can accept no liability for such and shall not be held liable. In the unlikely event that, due to circumstances beyond its control, The Owner is forced to cancel the booking, The Owner shall only be liable to refund in full any monies already paid to The Owner by The Client.

The Owner cannot accept any responsibility for loss of damage to, or theft of, the Client’s property or belongings whilst in The Property. The Client is also responsible for all personal medical, travel and all-risks insurance for all persons named by The Client prior to check-in.

The Owner accepts no liability for injuries caused because of using The Property's facilities.

The Booking Client must be a minimum of 25 years of age with photo ID and phone number to match the credit card used to secure the reservation. The Property is booked exclusively for the use of the persons at the time of booking. No other persons shall use The Property without the prior written consent of The Owner. 

The Client agrees to treat The Property, its equipment and its contents with due care and attention and shall leave The Property in a reasonable state of cleanliness, with all furniture and accessories in the same position as found upon arrival.

The Client shall be obliged to follow the clear instructions provided in The Owner regarding the general condition of The Property upon vacating, the handling and management of trash, the amount of laundry that may be left upon vacating the Property, the cleaning of BBQs (if any and if used) and any other issues that may be advised by The Owner in the home or by other means. Failure to follow the guidelines, instructions and information provided by The Owner may result in charges being levied against the Refundable Conditional Security Deposit.

The Owner cannot accept any responsibility for loss or damage to, or theft of, the Client’s property or belongings whilst in The Property. The Client is also responsible for all personal medical, travel and all-risks insurance for all named parties on the Booking Form.

PETS OF ANY TYPE ARE NOT PERMITTED. If the presence of a pet is not determined until after the renter's stay, an additional fee of $500 plus tax will be charged for the inconvenience and the non-disclosure. Any damage caused by The Client’s pet(s) must be reported and should damage be found the Refundable Conditional Security Deposit shall be used for repairs. Failure to comply with this condition will result in the forfeiture of the whole Refundable Conditional Security Deposit.

No smoking is permitted (Cigarettes, vapes, marijuana, etc) within the interior or exterior of The Property An automatic fee of $500 plus HST is charged for any evidence of smoking indoors. An additional fee will be charged for loss of revenue for nights not available to book due to the smoke remediation. Failure to comply with this condition will result in the forfeiture of the whole of the Refundable Conditional Security Deposit.

The Owner reserves the right to refuse acceptance of any booking, at any time, at its discretion and furthermore reserves the right to cancel any booking at any time if all the terms and conditions of the booking are not fulfilled by The Client.

The Property shall be available to The Client from the time allocated for arrival (4pm) and must be vacated similarly (11am), unless alternative arrangements are agreed in advance with The Owner.

A Conditional Refundable Security Deposit of $500 is held on The Owner’s behalf with Airbnb. No claim through Airbnb will be made for the Conditional Refundable Security Deposit against the Client if, following a check of The Property, it is confirmed that no untoward losses or damages have occurred during the use of The Property, its equipment and its contents by The Client, or any other parties named. The amount of the Conditional Refundable Security Deposit does not limit The Client's liability and, if any loss or damage is caused to The Property, its equipment or contents which exceeds the value of the Conditional Refundable Security Deposit, the Client shall be held accountable for any costs incurred to put right the damage or loss and appropriate steps will be taken by The Owner to ensure the total cost of such loss or damages is recovered.

Throughout these Terms and Conditions, the singular shall mean the plural, the male and the female, and all agreements shall be construed as joint and several.

These Terms and Conditions and the booking itself shall be governed by Canadian law.
